original: na pratyekabodhim anutpāda iti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽nānutpādaṃ pratyekabodhir iti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽na pratyekabodhim anirodha iti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na pratyeka bodhim anutpādaḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na anutpādam pratyeka bodhiḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na pratyeka bodhim a nirodhe iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize the individual enlightenment as non-arising.🔽They will not conceptualize non-arising as the individual enlightenment.🔽They will not conceptualize the individual enlightenment as non-cessation.

original: nānirodhaṃ pratyekabodhir iti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽na pratyekabodhiṃ śānteti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na anirodham pratyeka bodhiḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na pratyeka bodhim śāntā iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize non-cessation as the individual enlightenment.🔽They will not conceptualize the individual enlightenment as peaceful.

original: na śāntaṃ pratyekabodhir iti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽na pratyekabodhiṃ viviktam iti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na śāntam pratyeka bodhiḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na pratyeka bodhim viviktam iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize peace as the individual enlightenment.🔽They will not conceptualize the individual enlightenment as secluded.

original: na viviktaṃ pratyekabodhir iti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽na mārgākārajñatāṃ śūnyeti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na viviktam pratyeka bodhiḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na mārga ākāra jña tām śūnyā iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize seclusion as the individual enlightenment.🔽They will not conceptualize the knowledge of the aspects of the path as empty.

original: na śūnyatāṃ mārgākārajñateti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽na mārgākārajñatām ānimittam iti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽nānimittaṃ mārgākārajñateti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na śūnyatām mārga ākāra jña tā iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na mārga ākāra jña tām ā nimittam iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na animittam mārga ākāra jña tā iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize emptiness as the knowledge of the aspects of the path.🔽They will not conceptualize the knowledge of the aspects of the path as signless.🔽They will not conceptualize the signless as the knowledge of the aspects of the path.

original: na mārgākārajñatām apraṇihiteti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na mārga ākāra jña tām apraṇihitā iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize the knowledge of the aspects of the path as wishless.

original: nāpraṇihitaṃ mārgākārajñateti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽na mārgākārajñatām anutpāda iti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na apraṇihitam mārga ākāra jña tā iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na mārga ākāra jña tām anutpāde iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize the signless as the knowledge of the aspects of the path.🔽They will not conceptualize the knowledge of the aspects of the path as non-production.

original: nānutpādaṃ mārgākārajñateti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽na mārgākārajñatām anirodha iti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na anutpādam mārga ākāra jña tā iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na mārga ākāra jña tām anirodhe iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize non-production as the knowledge of the aspects of the path.🔽They will not conceptualize the knowledge of the aspects of the path as non-cessation.

original: nānirodhaṃ mārgākārajñateti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽na mārgākārajñatāṃ śānteti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na anirodham mārga ākāra jña tā iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na mārga ākāra jña tām śāntā iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize non-cessation as the knowledge of the aspects of the path.🔽They will not conceptualize the knowledge of the aspects of the path as calm.

original: na śāntaṃ mārgākārajñateti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽na mārgākārajñatāṃ vivikteti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na śāntam mārga ākāra jña tā iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na mārga ākāra jña tām viviktā iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize calm as the knowledge of the aspects of the path.🔽They will not conceptualize the knowledge of the aspects of the path as void.

original: na viviktaṃ mārgākārajñateti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽na sarvākārajñatāṃ śūnyeti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na viviktam mārga ākāra jña tā iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na sarva ākārajña tām śūnyā iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize void as the knowledge of the aspects of the path.🔽They will not conceptualize the knowledge of all aspects as empty.

original: na śūnyatāṃ sarvākārajñateti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽na sarvākārajñatām ānimittam iti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na śūnyatām sarva ākāra jña tā iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na sarva ākāra jña tām ā nimittam iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize emptiness as the knowledge of all aspects.🔽They will not conceptualize the knowledge of all aspects as signless.

original: nānimittaṃ sarvākārajñateti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽na sarvākārajñatām apraṇihiteti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na animittam sarva ākārajña tā iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na sarva ākārajña tām apraṇihitā iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize the signless as the knowledge of all aspects.🔽They will not conceptualize the knowledge of all aspects as wishless.

original: nāpraṇihitaṃ sarvākārajñateti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na apraṇihitam sarva ākārajña tā iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize the wishless as the knowledge of all aspects.

original: na sarvākārajñatām anutpāda iti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na sarva ākārajña tām anutpādaḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceive of the knowledge of all aspects as non-arising.

original: nānutpādaṃ sarvākārajñateti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽na sarvākārajñatām anirodha iti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na anutpādam sarva ākārajña tā iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na sarva ākāra jña tām anirodhe iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceive of non-arising as the knowledge of all aspects.🔽They will not conceive of the knowledge of all aspects as cessation.

original: nānirodhaṃ sarvākārajñateti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽na sarvākārajñatāṃ śānteti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na anirodham sarva ākārajña tā iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na sarva ākāra jña tām śāntā iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceive of cessation as the knowledge of all aspects.🔽They will not conceive of the knowledge of all aspects as peaceful.

original: na śāntaṃ sarvākārajñateti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽na sarvākārajñatāṃ vivikteti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na śāntam sarva ākāra jña tā iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na sarva ākārajña tām viviktā iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceive of peace as the knowledge of all aspects.🔽They will not conceive of the knowledge of all aspects as secluded.

original: na viviktaṃ sarvākārajñateti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽na saṃskṛtadhātuṃ śūnya iti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na viviktam sarva ākārajña tā iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na saṃskṛta dhātum śūnye iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceive of seclusion as the knowledge of all aspects.🔽They will not conceive of the conditioned realm as empty.

original: na śūnyatāṃ saṃskṛtadhātur iti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽na saṃskṛtadhātum ānimittam iti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na śūnyatām saṃskṛta dhātuḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na saṃskṛta dhātum ā nimittam iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceive of emptiness as the conditioned realm.🔽They will not conceive of the conditioned realm as signless.

original: na ānimittaṃ saṃskṛtadhātur iti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽na saṃskṛtadhātum apraṇihita iti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na ā nimittam saṃskṛta dhātuḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na saṃskṛta dhātum apraṇihitaḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceive of signlessness as the conditioned realm.🔽They will not conceive of the conditioned realm as wishless.

original: nāpraṇihitaṃ saṃskṛtadhātur iti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na apraṇihitam saṃskṛta dhātuḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceive of wishlessness as the conditioned realm.

original: na saṃskṛtadhātum anutpāda iti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na saṃskṛta dhātum anutpādaḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize the conditioned element as non-arising.

original: nānutpādaṃ saṃskṛtadhātur iti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽na saṃskṛtadhātum anirodha iti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na anutpādam saṃskṛta dhātuḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na saṃskṛta dhātum a nirodhe iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize non-arising as the conditioned element.🔽They will not conceptualize the conditioned element as non-cessation.

original: nānirodhaṃ saṃskṛtadhātur iti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽na saṃskṛtadhātuṃ śānta iti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na a nirodham saṃskṛta dhātuḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na saṃskṛta dhātum śāntaḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize non-cessation as the conditioned element.🔽They will not conceptualize the conditioned element as peaceful.

original: na śāntaṃ saṃskṛtadhātur iti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽na saṃskṛtadhātuṃ viviktam iti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na śāntam saṃskṛta dhātuḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na saṃskṛta dhātum viviktam iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize peace as the conditioned element.🔽They will not conceptualize the conditioned element as secluded.

original: na viviktaṃ saṃskṛtadhātur iti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽nāsaṃskṛtadhātuṃ śūnya iti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na viviktam saṃskṛta dhātuḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na asaṃskṛta dhātum śūnye iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize seclusion as the conditioned element.🔽They will not conceptualize the unconditioned element as empty.

original: na śūnyatām asaṃskṛtadhātur iti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽nāsaṃskṛtadhātum ānimittam iti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na śūnyatām asaṃskṛta dhātuḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na a saṃskṛta dhātum ā nimittam iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize emptiness as the unconditioned element.🔽They will not conceptualize the unconditioned element as signless.

original: na ānimittam asaṃskṛtadhātur iti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽nāsaṃskṛtadhātum apraṇihita iti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na ā nimittam a saṃskṛta dhātuḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na a saṃskṛta dhātum a praṇihite iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize the signless as the unconditioned element.🔽They will not conceptualize the unconditioned element as wishless.

original: nāpraṇihitam asaṃskṛtadhātur iti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na apraṇihitam asaṃskṛta dhātuḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize the wishless as the unconditioned element.

original: nāsaṃskṛtadhātum anutpāda iti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na asaṃskṛta dhātum anutpādaḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize the unconditioned element as non-arising.

original: nānutpādam asaṃskṛtadhātur iti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽nāsaṃskṛtadhātum anirodha iti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na anutpādam asaṃskṛta dhātuḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na asaṃskṛta dhātum anirodhe iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize non-arising as the unconditioned element.🔽They will not conceptualize the unconditioned element as non-cessation.

original: nānirodham asaṃskṛtadhātur iti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽nāsaṃskṛtadhātuṃ śānta iti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na a nirodham a saṃskṛta dhātuḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na asaṃskṛta dhātum śāntaḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize non-cessation as the unconditioned element.🔽They will not conceptualize the unconditioned element as peaceful.

original: na śāntam asaṃskṛtadhātur iti vikalpayiṣyanti /🔽nāsaṃskṛtadhātuṃ vivikta iti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na śāntam a saṃskṛta dhātuḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti  na asaṃskṛta dhātum vivikte iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize peace as the unconditioned element.🔽They will not conceptualize the unconditioned element as secluded.

original: na viviktam asaṃskṛtadhātur iti vikalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: na viviktam asaṃskṛta dhātuḥ iti vikalpayiṣyanti
translated: They will not conceptualize seclusion as the unconditioned element.

original: anena devaputrāḥ paryāyeṇāsyā gambhīrāyāḥ prajñāpāramitāyā evaṃgambhīrāyā evamatarkāyā
analyzed: anena deva putrāḥ paryāyeṇa asyāḥ gambhīrāyāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ evaṃgambhīrāyāḥ evamatarkāyāḥ
translated: By this method, O sons of gods, in this profound perfection of wisdom, which is so profound,🔽which is so hard to see, so hard to understand, so peaceful,🔽so sublime,

original: evamatarkāvacarāyā evaṃsūkṣmāyā evaṃnipuṇāyā evaṃdurdṛśyāyā evaṃduravabodhāyā evaṃśāntāyā
analyzed: evam a tarka avacarāyāḥ evam sūkṣmāyāḥ evam nipuṇāyāḥ evam durdṛśyāyāḥ evam duravabodhāyāḥ evam śāntāyāḥ
translated: so subtle, so refined, so hard to discern, so hard to realize, so peaceful,

original: evaṃpraṇītāyā
analyzed: evaṃpraṇītāyāḥ
translated: so excellent,

original: evamalamāryāyā evaṃpaṇḍitavijñavedanīyāyā na kecit pratyeṣitāro bhaviṣyanti / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: evam alam āryāyāḥ evaṃpaṇḍita vijña vedanīyāyāḥ na kecid pratyeṣitāraḥ bhaviṣyanti tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: so noble, so to be known by the wise and the learned, there will be no one who will believe in it. Why is that?

original: tathā hy atra na kaścid dharmaḥ sūcyate na paridīpyate / yathaivātra na kaścid dharmaḥ sūcyate na paridīpyate tathaivātra na kaścit sattvaḥ
analyzed: tathā hi atra na kaścid dharmaḥ sūcyate na paridīpyate yathā eva atra na kaścid dharmaḥ sūcyate na paridīpyate tathā eva atra na kaścid sattvaḥ
translated: For in this [perfection of wisdom], no dharma is indicated or revealed. Just as no dharma is indicated or revealed here, in the same way, no sentient being is indicated or revealed here.

original: atha āyuṣmān śāradvatīputra āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtim etad avocat /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān śāradvatī putraḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Śāradvatīputra said this to the Venerable Subhūti:

original: na tv āyuṣman subhūte iha prajñāpāramitāyāṃ vistareṇa trīṇi yānāni vyavasthāpyante / śrāvakayānaṃ pratyekabuddhayānaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhayānaṃ /
analyzed: na tu āyuṣman subhūte iha prajñāpāramitāyām vistareṇa trīṇi yānāni vyavasthāpyante śrāvaka yānam pratyekabuddha yānam samyaksaṃbuddha yānam
translated: Venerable Subhūti, the three vehicles are not established in detail in this perfection of wisdom, namely the vehicle of the hearers, the vehicle of the solitary buddhas, and the vehicle of the perfectly enlightened ones.

original: bodhisattvānāṃ ca mahāsattvānāṃ saṃparigraha upadiśyate / prathamacittotpādam upādāya yāvad daśamaś cittotpādam upādāya bodhisattvamārgaś copadiśyate /
analyzed: bodhisattvānām ca mahāsattvānām saṃparigrahaḥ upadiśyate prathama citta utpādam upādāya yāvat daśamaḥ citta utpādam upādāya bodhisattva mārgaḥ ca upadiśyate
translated: And the inclusion of the bodhisattvas, the great beings, is taught, beginning with the first production of the thought of enlightenment up to the tenth production of the thought of enlightenment, and the bodhisattva path is taught.

original: yad uta dānapāramitā /
analyzed: yat uta dāna pāramitā
translated: Namely, the perfection of giving,

original: śīlapāramitā /🔽kṣāntipāramitā /
analyzed: śīla pāramitā  kṣānti pāramitā
translated: the perfection of morality,🔽the perfection of patience,

original: vīryapāramitā /
analyzed: vīrya pāramitā
translated: the perfection of effort,

original: dhyānapāramitā /
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitā
translated: the perfection of concentration,

original: prajñāpāramitā /🔽adhyātmaśūnyatā /🔽bahirdhāśūnyatā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā  adhyātma śūnyatā  bahirdhā śūnyatā
translated: and the perfection of wisdom.🔽Internal emptiness,🔽external emptiness,

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatā /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā
translated: internal and external emptiness,

original: śūnyatāśūnyatā /
analyzed: śūnyatā aśūnyatā
translated: emptiness of emptiness,

original: mahāśūnyatā /
analyzed: mahāśūnyatā
translated: great emptiness,

original: paramārthaśūnyatā /
analyzed: paramārtha śūnyatā
translated: ultimate emptiness,

original: saṃskṛtaśūnyatā /
analyzed: saṃskṛta śūnyatā
translated: The emptiness of the conditioned.

original: asaṃskṛtaśūnyatā /🔽atyantaśūnyatā /🔽anavarāgrasūnyatā /
analyzed: asaṃskṛta śūnyatā  atyanta śūnyatā  an avara agra sūnya tā
translated: The emptiness of the unconditioned.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The emptiness of the beginningless and endless.

original: anavakāraśūnyatā /
analyzed: anavakāra śūnyatā
translated: The emptiness of non-dispersal.

original: prakṛtiśūnyatā /
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatā

original: sarvadharmaśūnyatā /
analyzed: sarva dharma śūnyatā
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena.

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyatā /🔽anupalambhaśūnyatā /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā  anupalambha śūnyatā
translated: The emptiness of specific characteristics.🔽The emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: abhāvaśūnyatā /🔽svabhāvaśūnyatā /
analyzed: abhāva śūnyatā  svabhāva śūnyatā
translated: The emptiness of non-existence.🔽The emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā /
analyzed: abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā
translated: The emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence.

original: catvāri smṛtyupasthānāni /🔽catvāri samyakprahāṇāni /
analyzed: catvāri smṛti upasthānāni  catvāri samyakprahāṇāni
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness.🔽The four right efforts.

original: catvāra ṛddhipādāḥ /
analyzed: catvāraḥ ṛddhipādāḥ

original: pañcendriyāṇi /
analyzed: pañca indriyāṇi
translated: The five faculties.

original: pañca balāni /
analyzed: pañca balāni
translated: The five powers.

original: sapta bodhyaṅgāni /
analyzed: sapta bodhyaṅgāni
translated: The seven factors of awakening.

original: āryāṣṭāṅgo mārgaḥ /
analyzed: ārya aṣṭa aṅgaḥ mārgaḥ
translated: The noble eightfold path.

original: catvāry āryasatyāni /
analyzed: catvāri ārya satyāni
translated: The four noble truths.

original: catvāri dhyānāni /
analyzed: catvāri dhyānāni
translated: The four meditations.

original: catvāry apramāṇāni /
analyzed: catvāri apramāṇāni
translated: The four immeasurables.

original: catasra ārūpyasamāpattayaḥ /
analyzed: catasraḥ ārūpya samāpattayaḥ
translated: The four formless attainments.

original: aṣṭau vimokṣāḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭau vimokṣāḥ
translated: The eight liberations.

original: navānupūrvavihārasamāpattayaḥ /
analyzed: nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ
translated: The nine successive attainments.

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhāni /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhāni
translated: The liberations through emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: pañcābhijñāḥ /🔽sarvasamādhayaḥ /
analyzed: pañca abhijñāḥ  sarva samādhayaḥ
translated: The five higher knowledges.🔽All meditative absorptions.

original: sarvadhāraṇīmukhāni /
analyzed: sarva dhāraṇī mukhāni
translated: All doors of mnemonic incantation.

original: daśatathāgatabalāni /
analyzed: daśa tathāgata balāni
translated: The ten powers of the Tathagata.

original: catvāri vaiśāradyāni /
analyzed: catvāri vaiśāradyāni
translated: The four forms of fearlessness.

original: catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ /🔽mahāmaitrī /
analyzed: catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ  mahā maitrī
translated: The four forms of unobstructed cognition.🔽Great love.

original: mahākaruṇā /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā
translated: Great compassion.

original: aṣṭādaśāveṇikabuddhadharmāḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭādaśa āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ
translated: The eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha.

original: bodhisattvānāṃ ca mahāsattvānām abhijñāvikrīḍitāny upadiśyante / evaṃkila bodhisattvā
analyzed: bodhisattvānām ca mahāsattvānām abhijñā vikrīḍitāni upadiśyante evam kila bodhisattvāḥ
translated: And the play of the higher knowledges of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is taught. In this way, it is said, the bodhisattva

original: mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranta upapādukā bhaviṣyanti / evam abhijñāsv aparihāṇadharmāṇo bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyām carantaḥ upapādukāḥ bhaviṣyanti evam abhijñāsu a parihāṇa dharmāṇaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: mahāsattvas, practicing the perfection of wisdom, will be spontaneously born. In this way they will not fall away from the higher knowledges.

original: buddhakṣetrād buddhakṣetraṃ saṃkramiṣyanti /🔽yaiś ca kuśalamūlair ākāṅkṣiṣyanti / tān buddhān bhagavataḥ satkartuṃ gurukartuṃ mānayituṃ🔽pūjayituṃ tāni tathārūpāṇi kuśalamūlāni samṛdhyanti / yañ ca teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatām
analyzed: buddhakṣetrāt buddhakṣetram saṃkramiṣyanti  yaiḥ ca kuśala mūlaiḥ ākāṅkṣiṣyanti tān buddhān bhagavataḥ satkartum gurukartum mānayitum  pūjayitum tāni tathārūpāṇi kuśala mūlāni samṛdhyanti yam ca teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām
translated: They will travel from buddhafield to buddhafield.🔽And whatever wholesome roots they long for, those roots of virtue will be successful for them, in order to honor, venerate, respect,

original: antikād dharmaṃ śroṣyanti /
analyzed: antikāt dharmam śroṣyanti
translated: and make offerings to those Buddhas, Blessed Ones. And whatever Dharma they will hear from those Buddhas, Blessed Ones,

original: sa na kadācid ācchetsyate /
analyzed: sa na kadācid ācchetsyate
translated: that will never be cut off.

original: yāvat sarvākārajñatām anuprāpsyanti / sadāsamāhitāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: yāvat sarva ākāra jña tām anuprāpsyanti sadā samāhitāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: Until they attain complete knowing in all its aspects, they will always be concentrated.

original: avikṣiptā samāhitayogena /🔽asaṅgapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: avikṣiptā samāhita yogena  a saṅga pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: And they will be undistracted, through the yoga of concentration.🔽And they will have unobstructed eloquence.

original: anācchedyapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: an ācchedya pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: And they will have uninterrupted eloquence.

original: sahitapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: sahita pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: And they will have appropriate eloquence.

original: mukṣapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /🔽śliṣṭapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: ca bhaviṣyanti  śliṣṭa pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will have unobstructed eloquence.🔽They will have coherent eloquence.

original: tranyapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will have uninterrupted eloquence.

original: sarvalokābhyudgataviśiṣṭapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: sarva loka abhyudgata viśiṣṭa pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will have eloquence that is superior to all worlds.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: evam etad āyuṣman śāradvatīputra evam etat /
analyzed: evam etat āyuṣman śāradvatī putra evam etat
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, it is so, it is so.

original: tathā yathā vadasi vistareṇeha prajñāpāramitāyāṃ trīṇi yānāny upadiṣṭāni śrāvakayānaṃ
analyzed: tathā yathā vadasi vistareṇa iha prajñāpāramitāyām trīṇi yānāni upadiṣṭāni śrāvaka yānam
translated: As you say, in this perfection of wisdom, the three vehicles are taught in detail: the vehicle of the hearers,

original: pratyekabuddhayānaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhayānaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ ca mahāsattvānāṃ saṃparigraha upadiṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: pratyekabuddha yānam samyaksaṃbuddha yānam bodhisattvānām ca mahāsattvānām saṃparigrahaḥ upadiṣṭaḥ
translated: the vehicle of the solitary buddhas, and the vehicle of the perfectly enlightened buddhas. The complete acceptance of the bodhisattvas, the great beings, is taught.

original: prathamacittotpādam upādāya yāvad daśamaś cittotpādo bodhisattvamārgaś copadiśyate /
analyzed: prathama citta utpādam upādāya yāvat daśamaḥ citta utpādaḥ bodhisattva mārgaḥ ca upadiśyate
translated: Beginning from the first production of the thought of enlightenment up to the tenth production of the thought, the bodhisattva path is taught.

analyzed: yat uta dāna pāramitā
translated: Namely, the perfection of giving,

analyzed: catvāri dhyānāni

analyzed: catvāri apramāṇāni

analyzed: pañca abhijñāḥ  sarva samādhayaḥ

analyzed: sarva dhāraṇī mukhāni

analyzed: daśa tathāgata balāni

analyzed: catvāri vaiśāradyāni

analyzed: catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ  mahā maitrī
translated: The four forms of unobstructed cognition.🔽Great love.

original: mahākaruṇā /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā
translated: Great compassion.

original: aṣṭādaśāveṇikabuddhadharmāḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭādaśa āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ
translated: The eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha.

original: bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyābhijñāvikrīḍitāny /
analyzed: bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya abhijñā vikrīḍitāni
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattvas play with the superknowledges.

original: upadiśyante / evaṃkila bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranta upapādukā bhaviṣyanti / evam abhijñāsv aparihāṇadharmāṇo bhavanti /
analyzed: upadiśyante evam kila bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyām carantaḥ upapādukāḥ bhaviṣyanti evam abhijñāsu a parihāṇa dharmāṇaḥ bhavanti
translated: Thus, indeed, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, practicing the perfection of wisdom, will become apparitional. Thus they will not fall away from the superknowledges.

original: buddhakṣetrād buddhakṣetraṃ saṃkramiṣyanti /
analyzed: buddhakṣetrāt buddhakṣetram saṃkramiṣyanti
translated: They will travel from buddhafield to buddhafield.

original: yaiś ca kuśalamūlair ākāṅkṣiṣyanti / tān buddhān bhagavataḥ satkartuṃ gurukartuṃ mānayituṃ pūjayituṃ tānīmāni tathārūpāṇi kuśalamūlāni samṛdhyante /
analyzed: yaiḥ ca kuśala mūlaiḥ ākāṅkṣiṣyanti tān buddhān bhagavataḥ satkartum gurukartum mānayitum pūjayitum tāni imāni tathārūpāṇi kuśala mūlāni samṛdhyante
translated: And whatever wholesome roots they long for, those very wholesome roots will be accomplished for them, in order to honor, venerate, respect, and make offerings to those Buddhas, Blessed Ones.

original: yaś ca teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatām antikād dharmaṃ śroṣyanti /
analyzed: yaḥ ca teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām antikāt dharmam śroṣyanti
translated: And whatever Dharma they will hear from those Buddhas, Blessed Ones,

original: sa na kadācid ācchetsyate /
analyzed: sa na kadācid ācchetsyate
translated: that will never be forgotten by them.

original: yāvat sarvākārajñatām anuprāpsyanti / sadāsamāhitāś ca bhaviṣyanty avikṣiptā samāhitayogena / asaṅgapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: yāvat sarva ākāra jña tām anuprāpsyanti sadā samāhitāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti a vikṣiptā samāhita yogena a saṅga pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: And they will always be concentrated, undistracted, with the yoga of concentration, until they attain complete knowing in all aspects. And they will have unimpeded eloquence.

original: anācchedyapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: an ācchedya pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: And they will have uninterrupted eloquence.

original: samāhitapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: samāhita pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: And they will have concentrated eloquence.

original: yuktapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: yukta pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will have appropriate eloquence.

original: akliṣṭapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /🔽arthavatpratibhānāś ca 🔽bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: a kliṣṭa pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti  arthavat pratibhānāḥ ca  bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will have unadulterated eloquence.🔽They will have meaningful eloquence.

original: sarvalokābhyudgataviśiṣṭapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: sarva loka abhyudgata viśiṣṭa pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will have eloquence that is superior to all worlds.

original: tathānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: tathā anupalambha yogena
translated: In the same way, through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: ātmano 'nupalambhayogena /🔽sattvasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: ātmanaḥ n upalambha yogena  sattvasya anupalambha yogena
translated: Through the yoga of non-apprehending a self.🔽Through the yoga of non-apprehending a being.

original: jīvasyānupalambhayogena /🔽poṣasyānupalambhayogena /🔽puruṣasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: jīvasya anupalambha yogena  poṣasya anupalambha yogena  puruṣasya anupalambha yogena
translated: Through the yoga of non-apprehending a living being.🔽Through the yoga of non-apprehending a nourished being.🔽Through the yoga of non-apprehending a person.

original: pudgalasyānupalambhayogena /🔽manujasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: pudgalasya anupalambha yogena  manujasya anupalambha yogena
translated: Through the yoga of non-apprehending an individual.🔽Through the yoga of non-apprehending a human.

original: mānavasyānupalambhayogena /🔽kārakasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: mānavasya anupalambha yogena  kārakasya anupalambha yogena
translated: Through the yoga of non-apprehending a man.🔽Through the yoga of non-apprehending a creator.

original: vedakasyānupalambhayogena /🔽janakasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: vedakasya anupalambha yogena  janakasya anupalambha yogena
translated: Through the yoga of non-apprehending a feeler.🔽Through the yoga of non-apprehending a producer.

original: paśyakasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: paśyakasya anupalambha yogena
translated: Through the yoga of non-apprehending a seer.

original: rūpasyānupalambhayogena /🔽vedanāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: rūpasya anupalambha yogena  vedanāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: Through the yoga of non-apprehending form.🔽Through the yoga of non-apprehending feeling.

original: saṃjñāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: saṃjñāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: Through the yoga of non-apprehending perception.

original: saṃskārāṇām anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: saṃskārāṇām an upalambha yogena
translated: Through the yoga of non-apprehending volitional formations.

original: vijñānasyānupalambhayogena /🔽cakṣuṣo 'nupalambhayogena /
analyzed: vijñānasya an upalambha yogena  cakṣuṣaḥ n upalambha yogena
translated: Through the yoga of non-apprehending consciousness.🔽Through the yoga of non-apprehending the eye.

original: śrotrasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: śrotrasya anupalambha yogena
translated: Through the yoga of non-apprehending the ear.

original: ghrāṇasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: ghrāṇasya anupalambha yogena
translated: through the yoga of non-apprehension of the nose.

original: jihvāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: jihvāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: through the yoga of non-apprehension of the tongue.

original: kāyasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: kāyasya anupalambha yogena
translated: through the yoga of non-apprehension of the body.

original: manaso 'nupalambhayogena /
analyzed: manasaḥ n upalambha yogena
translated: through the yoga of non-apprehension of the mind.

original: rūpasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: rūpasya anupalambha yogena
translated: through the yoga of non-apprehension of form.

original: śabdasyānupalambhayogena /🔽gandhasyānupalambhayogena /🔽rasasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: śabdasya anupalambha yogena  gandhasya anupalambha yogena  rasasya anupalambha yogena
translated: through the yoga of non-apprehension of sound.🔽through the yoga of non-apprehension of smell.🔽through the yoga of non-apprehension of taste.

original: sparśasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: sparśasya anupalambha yogena
translated: through the yoga of non-apprehension of touch.

original: dharmāṇām anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: dharmāṇām anupalambha yogena
translated: through the yoga of non-apprehension of dharmas.

original: cakṣurvijñānasyānupalambhayogena /🔽śrotravijñānasyānupalambhayogena /🔽ghrāṇavijñānasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ vijñānasya an upalambha yogena  śrotra vijñānasya an upalambha yogena  ghrāṇa vijñānasya an upalambha yogena
translated: through the yoga of non-apprehension of eye consciousness.🔽through the yoga of non-apprehension of ear consciousness.🔽through the yoga of non-apprehension of nose consciousness.

original: jihvāvijñānasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: jihvā vijñānasya anupalambha yogena
translated: through the yoga of non-apprehension of tongue consciousness.

original: kāyavijñānasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: kāya vijñānasya anupalambha yogena
translated: through the yoga of non-apprehension of body consciousness.

original: manovijñānasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñānasya an upalambha yogena
translated: through the yoga of non-apprehension of mind consciousness.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśasyānupalambhayogena /🔽śrotrasaṃsparśasyānupalambhayogena /🔽ghrāṇasaṃsparśasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśasya anupalambha yogena  śrotra saṃsparśasya anupalambha yogena  ghrāṇa saṃsparśasya anupalambha yogena
translated: through the yoga of non-apprehension of eye contact.🔽through the yoga of non-apprehension of ear contact.🔽through the yoga of non-apprehension of nose contact.

original: jihvāsaṃsparśasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: jihvā saṃsparśasya anupalambha yogena
translated: through the yoga of non-apprehension of tongue contact.

original: kāyasaṃsparśasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: kāya saṃsparśasya anupalambha yogena
translated: through the yoga of non-apprehension of body contact.

original: manaḥsaṃsparśasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: manaḥ saṃsparśasya anupalambha yogena
translated: through the yoga of non-apprehension of mind contact.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśajāvedanāyā anupalambhayogena /🔽śrotrasaṃsparśajāvedanāyā anupalambhayogena /🔽ghrāṇasaṃsparśajāvedanāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa jā vedanāyāḥ anupalambha yogena  śrotra saṃsparśa jā vedanāyāḥ anupalambha yogena  ghrāṇa saṃsparśa jā vedanāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: The non-apprehension of the feeling that arises from eye-contact is through the yoga of non-apprehension.🔽The non-apprehension of the feeling that arises from ear-contact is through the yoga of non-apprehension.🔽The non-apprehension of the feeling that arises from nose-contact is through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: jihvāsaṃsparśajāvedanāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: jihvā saṃsparśa jāḥ vedanāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: The non-apprehension of the feeling that arises from tongue-contact is through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: kāyasaṃsparśajāvedanāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: kāya saṃsparśa jā vedanāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: The non-apprehension of the feeling that arises from body-contact is through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: manaḥsaṃsparśajāvedanāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: manaḥ saṃsparśa jāḥ vedanāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: The non-apprehension of the feeling that arises from mind-contact is through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: pṛthivīdhātor anupalambhayogena /🔽abdhātor anupalambhayogena /🔽tejodhātor anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: pṛthivī dhātoḥ anupalambha yogena  ap dhātoḥ anupalambha yogena  tejaḥ dhātoḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: The non-apprehension of the earth element is through the yoga of non-apprehension.🔽The non-apprehension of the water element is through the yoga of non-apprehension.🔽The non-apprehension of the fire element is through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: vāyudhātor anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: vāyu dhātoḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: The non-apprehension of the wind element is through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: ākāśadhātor anupalambhayogena /🔽vijñānadhātor anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: ākāśa dhātoḥ anupalambha yogena  vijñāna dhātoḥ an upalambha yogena
translated: The non-apprehension of the space element is through the yoga of non-apprehension.🔽The non-apprehension of the consciousness element is through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: avidyāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: avidyāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: The non-apprehension of ignorance is through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: saṃskārāṇām anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: saṃskārāṇām anupalambha yogena
translated: The non-apprehension of formations is through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: vijñānasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: vijñānasya an upalambha yogena
translated: The non-apprehension of consciousness is through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: nāmarūpasyānupalambhayogena /🔽ṣaḍāyatanasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: nāma rūpasya anupalambha yogena  ṣaṣ āyatanasya anupalambha yogena
translated: The non-apprehension of name-and-form is through the yoga of non-apprehension.🔽The non-apprehension of the six sense bases is through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: sparśasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: sparśasya anupalambha yogena
translated: The non-apprehension of contact is through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: vedanāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: vedanāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: The non-apprehension of feeling is through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: tṛṣṇāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: tṛṣṇāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: The non-apprehension of craving is through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: upādānasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: upādānasya anupalambha yogena
translated: by the yoga of non-apprehension of clinging;

original: bhavasyānupalambhayogena /🔽jāter anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: bhavasya anupalambha yogena  jāteḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: by the yoga of non-apprehension of becoming;🔽by the yoga of non-apprehension of birth;

original: jarāmaraṇasyānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: jarā maraṇasya anupalambha yogena
translated: by the yoga of non-apprehension of old age and death;

original: dānapāramitāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: dāna pāramitāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: by the yoga of non-apprehension of the perfection of giving;

original: śīlapāramitāyā anupalambhayogena /🔽kṣāntipāramitāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: śīla pāramitāyāḥ anupalambha yogena  kṣānti pāramitāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: by the yoga of non-apprehension of the perfection of morality;🔽by the yoga of non-apprehension of the perfection of patience;

original: vīryapāramitāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: vīrya pāramitāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: by the yoga of non-apprehension of the perfection of vigor;

original: dhyānapāramitāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: by the yoga of non-apprehension of the perfection of meditation;

original: prajñāpāramitāyā anupalambhayogena /🔽adhyātmaśūnyatāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyāḥ an upalambha yogena  adhyātma śūnyatāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: by the yoga of non-apprehension of the perfection of wisdom;🔽by the yoga of non-apprehension of inner emptiness;

original: bahirdhāśūnyatāyā anupalambhayogena /🔽adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ anupalambha yogena  adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: by the yoga of non-apprehension of outer emptiness;🔽by the yoga of non-apprehension of inner and outer emptiness;

original: śūnyatāśūnyatāyā anupalambhayogena /🔽mahāśūnyatāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: śūnyatā aśūnyatāyāḥ anupalambha yogena  mahāśūnyatāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: by the yoga of non-apprehension of the emptiness of emptiness;🔽by the yoga of non-apprehension of great emptiness;

original: paramārthaśūnyatāyā anupalambhayogena /🔽saṃskṛtaśūnyatāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: paramārtha śūnyatāyāḥ anupalambha yogena  saṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: by the yoga of non-apprehension of the emptiness of ultimate reality;🔽by the yoga of non-apprehension of the emptiness of the conditioned;

original: asaṃskṛtasṇnyatāyā anupalambhayogena /🔽atyantaśūnyatāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: asaṃskṛta sṇnya tāyāḥ anupalambha yogena  atyanta śūnyatāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: by the yoga of non-apprehension of the emptiness of the unconditioned;🔽by the yoga of non-apprehension of absolute emptiness;

original: anavarāgraśūnyatāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: an avara agra śūnyatāyāḥ an upalambha yogena
translated: by the yoga of non-apprehension of emptiness without beginning or end;

original: anavakāraśūnyatāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anavakāra śūnyatāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: the emptiness of non-rejection through the yoga of non-apprehension,

original: prakṛtiśūnyatāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: the emptiness of nature through the yoga of non-apprehension,

original: sarvadharmaśūnyatāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva dharma śūnyatāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: the emptiness of all phenomena through the yoga of non-apprehension,

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāyā anupalambhayogena /🔽anupalambhaśūnyatāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatāyāḥ anupalambha yogena  anupalambha śūnyatāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: the emptiness of specific characteristics through the yoga of non-apprehension,🔽the emptiness of non-apprehension through the yoga of non-apprehension,

original: abhāvaśūnyatāyā anupalambhayogena /🔽svabhāvaśūnyatāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: abhāva śūnyatāyāḥ anupalambha yogena  svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: the emptiness of non-existence through the yoga of non-apprehension,🔽the emptiness of own-nature through the yoga of non-apprehension,

original: abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyā anupalambhayogena /🔽smṛtyupasthānānām anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ anupalambha yogena  smṛti upasthānānām anupalambha yogena
translated: the emptiness of the non-existence of own-nature through the yoga of non-apprehension,🔽the applications of mindfulness through the yoga of non-apprehension,

original: samyakprahāṇānām anupalambhayogena /🔽ṛddhipādām anupalambhayogena /🔽indriyāṇām anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: samyak prahāṇānām an upalambha yogena  ṛddhipādām anupalambha yogena  indriyāṇām anupalambha yogena
translated: the right efforts through the yoga of non-apprehension,🔽the bases of supernatural power through the yoga of non-apprehension,🔽the faculties through the yoga of non-apprehension,

original: balānām anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: balānām anupalambha yogena
translated: the powers through the yoga of non-apprehension,

original: bodhyaṅgānām anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: bodhyaṅgānām anupalambha yogena
translated: the factors of awakening through the yoga of non-apprehension,

original: āryāṣṭāṅgamārgasyānupalambhayogena /🔽āryasatyānām anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: ārya aṣṭāṅga mārgasya anupalambha yogena  ārya satyānām anupalambha yogena
translated: the noble eightfold path through the yoga of non-apprehension,🔽the noble truths through the yoga of non-apprehension,

original: dhyānānām anupalambhayogena /🔽apramāṇānām anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: dhyānānām anupalambha yogena  apramāṇānām anupalambha yogena
translated: the meditative absorptions through the yoga of non-apprehension,🔽the immeasurables through the yoga of non-apprehension,

original: ārūpyasamāpattīnām anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: ārūpya samāpattīnām an upalambha yogena
translated: the formless concentrations through the yoga of non-apprehension,

original: vimokṣāṇām anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: vimokṣāṇām an upalambha yogena
translated: the liberations through the yoga of non-apprehension,

original: anupūrvavihārasamāpattīnām anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupūrva vihāra samāpattīnām an upalambha yogena
translated: of the successive absorptions, by way of non-apprehension;

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhānām anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhānām anupalambha yogena
translated: of the doors of liberation—emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, by way of non-apprehension;

original: abhijñānām anupalambhayogena /🔽samādhīnām anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: abhijñānām an upalambha yogena  samādhīnām anupalambha yogena
translated: of the superknowledges, by way of non-apprehension;🔽of the concentrations, by way of non-apprehension;

original: dhāraṇīmukhānām anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: dhāraṇī mukhānām anupalambha yogena
translated: of the dhāraṇī gateways, by way of non-apprehension;

original: tathāgatabalānām anupalambhayogena /🔽vaiśāradyānām anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: tathāgata balānām anupalambha yogena  vaiśāradyānām anupalambha yogena
translated: of the powers of the Tathāgata, by way of non-apprehension;🔽of the grounds of self-confidence, by way of non-apprehension;

original: pratisaṃvidānām anupalambhayogena /🔽mahāmaitryā anupalambhayogena /
translated: of the detailed and thorough knowledges, by way of non-apprehension;🔽of great love, by way of non-apprehension;

original: mahākaruṇāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: mahā karuṇāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: of great compassion, by way of non-apprehension;

original: āveṇikabuddhadharmāṇām anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: āveṇika buddha dharmāṇām an upalambha yogena
translated: of the unique qualities of a buddha, by way of non-apprehension;

original: mārgākārajñatāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: of the knowledge of path aspects, by way of non-apprehension;

original: sarvākārajñatāyā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: of the knowledge of all aspects, by way of non-apprehension?

original: athāyuṣman śāradvatīputra āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtim etad avocat /
analyzed: atha āyuṣman śāradvatī putraḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Śāradvatīputra said this to the Venerable Subhūti:

original: kena kāraṇenāyuṣman subhūte iha prajñāpāramitāyāṃ trīṇi yānāni vistareṇopadiśyante /
analyzed: kena kāraṇena āyuṣman subhūte iha prajñāpāramitāyām trīṇi yānāni vistareṇa upadiśyante
translated: Venerable Subhūti, for what reason are the three vehicles taught in detail in this perfection of wisdom?

original: anupalambhayogena / kena kāraṇena subhūte bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ saṃparigraha upadiśyate / prathamacittotpādam upādāya yāvad daśamacittotpādo
analyzed: anupalambha yogena kena kāraṇena subhūte bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām saṃparigrahaḥ upadiśyate prathama citta utpādam upādāya yāvat daśama citta utpādaḥ
translated: By way of non-apprehension. For what reason, Subhuti, is the full acceptance of the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas taught? Beginning from the first production of the thought of enlightenment up to the tenth production of the thought of enlightenment,

original: bodhimārgaś copadiśyate /
analyzed: bodhi mārgaḥ ca upadiśyate
translated: and the path to enlightenment is taught.

original: yad uta dānapāramitā /
analyzed: yat uta dāna pāramitā
translated: Namely, the perfection of giving,

original: śīlapāramitā /🔽kṣāntipāramitā /
analyzed: śīla pāramitā  kṣānti pāramitā
translated: the perfection of morality,🔽the perfection of patience,

original: vīryapāramitā /
analyzed: vīrya pāramitā
translated: the perfection of vigor,

original: dhyānapāramitā /
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitā
translated: the perfection of meditation,

original: prajñāpāramitā /🔽adhyātmaśūnyatā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā  adhyātma śūnyatā
translated: the perfection of wisdom,🔽inner emptiness,🔽outer emptiness,

original: bahirdhāśūnyatā /🔽adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatā /
analyzed: bahirdhā śūnyatā  adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā
translated: inner and outer emptiness,

original: śūnyatāśūnyatā /
analyzed: śūnyatā aśūnyatā
translated: emptiness of emptiness,

original: mahāśūnyatā /🔽paramārthaśūnyatā /
analyzed: mahāśūnyatā  paramārtha śūnyatā
translated: great emptiness,🔽ultimate emptiness,

original: saṃskṛtaśūnyatā /🔽asaṃskṛtaśūnyatā /🔽atyantaśūnyatā /
analyzed: saṃskṛta śūnyatā  asaṃskṛta śūnyatā  atyanta śūnyatā
translated: emptiness of the conditioned,🔽emptiness of the unconditioned,🔽absolute emptiness,

original: anavarāgraśūnyatā /🔽anavakāraśūnyatā /
analyzed: an avara agra śūnyatā  anavakāra śūnyatā
translated: emptiness without beginning or end,🔽emptiness of non-dispersal,

original: prakṛtiśūnyatā /
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatā
translated: emptiness of inherent nature,

original: sarvadharmaśūnyatā /
analyzed: sarva dharma śūnyatā
translated: emptiness of all phenomena,

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyatā /🔽anupalambhaśūnyatā /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā  anupalambha śūnyatā
translated: emptiness of specific characteristics,🔽emptiness of non-apprehension,

original: abhāvaśūnyatā /🔽svabhāvaśūnyatā /
analyzed: abhāva śūnyatā  svabhāva śūnyatā
translated: emptiness of non-existence,🔽emptiness of own-nature,

original: abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā /
analyzed: abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā
translated: emptiness of the own-nature of non-existence,

original: catvāri smṛtyupasthānāni /🔽catvāri samyakprahāṇāni /
analyzed: catvāri smṛti upasthānāni  catvāri samyakprahāṇāni
translated: the four establishments of mindfulness,🔽the four right efforts,

original: catvāra ṛddhipādāḥ /🔽pañcendriyāṇi /
analyzed: catvāraḥ ṛddhipādāḥ  pañca indriyāṇi
translated: the four bases of supernatural power,🔽the five faculties,

original: pañca balāni /
analyzed: pañca balāni
translated: the five strengths,

original: sapta bodhyaṅgāni /
analyzed: sapta bodhyaṅgāni
translated: The seven factors of awakening.

original: āryāṣṭāṅgo mārgaḥ /
analyzed: ārya aṣṭa aṅgaḥ mārgaḥ
translated: The noble eightfold path.

original: catvāry āryasatyāni /
analyzed: catvāri ārya satyāni
translated: The four noble truths.

original: catvāri dhyānāni /
analyzed: catvāri dhyānāni
translated: The four concentrations.

original: catvāry apramāṇāni /
analyzed: catvāri apramāṇāni
translated: The four immeasurables.

original: catasra ārūpyasamāpattayaḥ /
analyzed: catasraḥ ārūpya samāpattayaḥ
translated: The four formless attainments.

original: aṣṭau vimokṣāḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭau vimokṣāḥ
translated: The eight liberations.

original: navānupūrvavihārasamāpattayaḥ /
analyzed: nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ
translated: The nine successive absorptions.

original: śūnyatanimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhāni /
analyzed: śūnyata nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhāni
translated: The liberations through emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: pañcābhijñāḥ /🔽sarvasamādhayaḥ /
analyzed: pañca abhijñāḥ  sarva samādhayaḥ
translated: The five higher knowledges.🔽All the meditative absorptions.

original: sarvadhāraṇīmukhāni /
analyzed: sarva dhāraṇī mukhāni
translated: All the doors of retention.

original: daśatathāgatabalāni /🔽catvāri vaiśāradyāni /
analyzed: daśa tathāgata balāni  catvāri vaiśāradyāni
translated: The ten powers of the Tathagata.🔽The four confidences.

original: catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ /
analyzed: catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ
translated: The four detailed and thorough knowledges.

original: mahāmaitrī /
analyzed: mahā maitrī
translated: Great love.

original: mahākaruṇā /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā
translated: Great compassion.

original: aṣṭādaśāveṇikabuddhadharmāḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭādaśa āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ
translated: The eighteen distinctive qualities of a Buddha.

original: bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyābhijñāvikrīḍitāny upadiśyate / evaṃkila bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ
analyzed: bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya abhijñā vikrīḍitāni upadiśyate evam kila bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva is taught the play of the higher knowledges. In this way, indeed, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranta upapādukā bhaviṣyanti / evam abhijñāsv aparihāṇadharmāṇo bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām carantaḥ upapādukāḥ bhaviṣyanti evam abhijñāsu a parihāṇa dharmāṇaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: practicing the perfection of wisdom will attain rebirth. In this way, they will be those who do not fall away from the higher knowledges.

original: buddhakṣetrād buddhakṣetraṃ saṃkramiṣyanti /
analyzed: buddhakṣetrāt buddhakṣetram saṃkramiṣyanti
translated: They will travel from buddhafield to buddhafield.

original: yaiś ca kuśalamūlair ākāṅkṣiṣyanti / tān buddhān bhagavataḥ satkartuṃ gurukartuṃ mānayituṃ pūjayituṃ tāni tathārūpāṇi kuśalamūlāni samṛtsyanti /
analyzed: yaiḥ ca kuśala mūlaiḥ ākāṅkṣiṣyanti tān buddhān bhagavataḥ satkartum gurukartum mānayitum pūjayitum tāni tathārūpāṇi kuśala mūlāni samṛtsyanti
translated: And with whatever wholesome roots they wish to honor, venerate, respect, and worship those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, those wholesome roots will be successful for them.

original: yañ ca teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatām antikād dharmaṃ śroṣyanti /🔽sa na kadācid ācchetsyate /
analyzed: yam ca teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām antikāt dharmam śroṣyanti  sa na kadācid ācchetsyate
translated: And whatever Dharma they will hear from those Buddhas, Blessed Ones,🔽that will never be lost to them until they attain omniscience.

original: yāvat sarvākārajñatām anuprāpsyanti / sadāsamāhitāś ca bhaviṣyanty avikṣiptasamāhitayogena / asaṅgapratibhānaś ca bhaviṣyanti /🔽anācchedyapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti / samāhitapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: yāvat sarva ākāra jña tām anuprāpsyanti sadā samāhitāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti a vikṣipta samāhita yogena asaṅga pratibhānaḥ ca bhaviṣyanti  an ācchedya pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti samāhita pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: And they will always be concentrated, with a concentration that is not distracted, and they will have unimpeded eloquence.🔽They will have uninterrupted eloquence, concentrated eloquence,🔽appropriate eloquence,

original: yuktapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /🔽śliṣṭapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: yukta pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti  śliṣṭa pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: connected eloquence,

original: arthavatpratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: arthavat pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: meaningful eloquence,

original: sarvalokābhyudgataviśiṣṭapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti bodhisattvā mahāsattvā bhaviṣyanty anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva loka abhyudgata viśiṣṭa pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti anupalambha yogena
translated: and they will have the most excellent eloquence that surpasses all worlds. Those Bodhisattva Mahasattvas will have all those qualities, through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: evam ukta āyuṣman subhūtir āyuṣmantaṃ śāradvatīputram etad avocat /
analyzed: evam uktaḥ āyuṣman subhūtiḥ āyuṣmantam śāradvatī putram etat avocat
translated: Thus addressed, the Venerable Subhuti said this to the Venerable SharadvatIputra:

original: adhyātmaśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: adhyātma śūnyatām upādāya
translated: On the basis of the emptiness of internal phenomena.

original: āyuṣman śāradvatīputra trīṇi yānāni vistareṇopadiśyante /
analyzed: āyuṣman śāradvatī putra trīṇi yānāni vistareṇa upadiśyante
translated: Venerable SharadvatIputra, the three vehicles are taught in detail.

original: anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupalambha yogena
translated: By way of non-apprehension.

original: bahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇopadiśyante /
analyzed: bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇa upadiśyante
translated: On the basis of the emptiness of external phenomena, the three vehicles are taught in detail.

original: anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupalambha yogena
translated: By way of non-apprehension.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇopadiśyante /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇa upadiśyante
translated: On the basis of the emptiness of both internal and external phenomena, the three vehicles are taught in detail.

original: anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupalambha yogena
translated: By way of non-apprehension.

original: śūnyatāśūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇopadiśyante /
analyzed: śūnyatā aśūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇa upadiśyante
translated: On the basis of the emptiness of emptiness, the three vehicles are taught in detail.

original: anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupalambha yogena
translated: By way of non-apprehension.

original: mahāśūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇopadiśyante /
analyzed: mahāśūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇa upadiśyante
translated: On the basis of great emptiness, the three vehicles are taught in detail.

original: anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupalambha yogena
translated: By way of non-apprehension.

original: paramārthaśūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇopadiśyante /
analyzed: paramārtha śūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇa upadiśyante
translated: On the basis of ultimate emptiness, the three vehicles are taught in detail.

original: anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupalambha yogena
translated: By way of non-apprehension.

original: saṃskṛtaśūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇopadiśyante /
analyzed: saṃskṛta śūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇa upadiśyante
translated: On the basis of conditioned emptiness, the three vehicles are taught in detail.

original: anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupalambha yogena
translated: By way of non-apprehension.

original: asaṃskṛtaśūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇopadiśyante /
analyzed: asaṃskṛta śūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇa upadiśyante
translated: The three vehicles are taught in detail, based on the emptiness of the unconditioned.

original: anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupalambha yogena
translated: By the method of non-apprehension.

original: atyantaśūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇopadiśyante /
analyzed: atyanta śūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇa upadiśyante
translated: The three vehicles are taught in detail, based on the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupalambha yogena
translated: By the method of non-apprehension.

original: anavarāgraśūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇopadiśyante /
analyzed: an avara agra śūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇa upadiśyante
translated: The three vehicles are taught in detail, based on the emptiness of the beginningless and endless.

original: anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupalambha yogena
translated: By the method of non-apprehension.

original: anavakāraśūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇopadiśyante /
analyzed: anavakāra śūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇa upadiśyante
translated: The three vehicles are taught in detail, based on the emptiness of non-disintegration.

original: anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupalambha yogena
translated: By the method of non-apprehension.

original: prakṛtiśūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇopadiśyante /
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇa upadiśyante
translated: The three vehicles are taught in detail, based on the emptiness of nature.

original: anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupalambha yogena
translated: By the method of non-apprehension.

original: sarvadharmaśūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇopadiśyante /
analyzed: sarva dharma śūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇa upadiśyante
translated: The three vehicles are taught in detail, based on the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupalambha yogena
translated: By the method of non-apprehension.

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇopadiśyante /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇa upadiśyante
translated: The three vehicles are taught in detail, based on the emptiness of specific characteristics.

original: anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupalambha yogena
translated: By the method of non-apprehension.

original: anupalambhaśūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇopadiśyante /
analyzed: anupalambha śūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇa upadiśyante
translated: The three vehicles are taught in detail, based on the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupalambha yogena
translated: By the method of non-apprehension.

original: abhāvaśūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇopadiśyante /
analyzed: abhāva śūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇa upadiśyante
translated: The three vehicles are taught in detail, based on the emptiness of non-existence.🔽By the method of non-apprehension.

original: anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupalambha yogena
translated: By way of non-apprehension.

original: svabhāvaśūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇopadiśyante /
analyzed: svabhāva śūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇa upadiśyante
translated: Based on the emptiness of inherent nature, the three vehicles are taught in detail.

original: anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupalambha yogena
translated: By way of non-apprehension.

original: abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇopadiśyante /
analyzed: abhāva svabhāva śūnyatām upādāya trīṇi yānāni vistareṇa upadiśyante
translated: Based on the emptiness of the nature of non-existence, the three vehicles are taught in detail.

original: anupalambhayogena / prathamacittotpādam upādāya yāvad daśamacittotpādo bodhisattvamārgaś copadiśyate /
analyzed: anupalambha yogena prathama citta utpādam upādāya yāvat daśama citta utpādaḥ bodhisattva mārgaḥ ca upadiśyate
translated: By way of non-apprehension. The bodhisattva path is taught, from the first production of the thought of enlightenment up to the tenth stage of a bodhisattva.

original: yad uta dānapāramitā /
analyzed: yat uta dāna pāramitā
translated: Namely, the perfection of giving.

original: śīlapāramitā /🔽kṣāntipāramitā /
analyzed: śīla pāramitā  kṣānti pāramitā
translated: The perfection of morality.🔽The perfection of patience.

original: vīryapāramitā /
analyzed: vīrya pāramitā
translated: The perfection of vigor.

original: dhyānapāramitā /
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitā
translated: The perfection of meditation.

original: prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā
translated: The perfection of wisdom.

original: adhyātmaśūnyatām upādāya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya saṃparigraha ucyate /
analyzed: adhyātma śūnyatām upādāya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya saṃparigrahaḥ ucyate
translated: Based on the emptiness of the inner, the complete acceptance of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva is said to be taught.

original: prathamacittotpādam upādāya yāvad daśamaś cittotpādo bodhisattvamārgaś copadiśyate /
analyzed: prathama citta utpādam upādāya yāvat daśamaḥ citta utpādaḥ bodhisattva mārgaḥ ca upadiśyate
translated: The bodhisattva path is taught, from the first production of the thought of enlightenment up to the tenth stage of a bodhisattva.

original: yad uta dānapāramitā /
analyzed: yat uta dāna pāramitā
translated: Namely, the perfection of giving.

original: śīlapāramitā /🔽kṣāntipāramitā /
analyzed: śīla pāramitā  kṣānti pāramitā
translated: The perfection of morality.🔽The perfection of patience.

original: vīryapāramitā /
analyzed: vīrya pāramitā
translated: The perfection of vigor.

original: dhyānapāramitā /
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitā
translated: The perfection of meditation.

original: prajñāpāramitā /🔽adhyātmaśūnyatā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā  adhyātma śūnyatā
translated: The perfection of wisdom.🔽The emptiness of the inner.

original: bahirdhāśūnyatā /
analyzed: bahirdhā śūnyatā
translated: The emptiness of the outer.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatā /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā
translated: The emptiness of the inner and outer.

original: śūnyatāśūnyatā /
analyzed: śūnyatā aśūnyatā
translated: The emptiness of emptiness.

original: mahāśūnyatā /
analyzed: mahāśūnyatā
translated: Great emptiness.

original: paramārthaśūnyatā /🔽saṃskṛtaśūnyatā /
analyzed: paramārtha śūnyatā  saṃskṛta śūnyatā
translated: Ultimate emptiness.🔽Emptiness of the conditioned.

original: asaṃskṛtaśūnyatā /🔽atyantaśūnyatā /🔽anavarāgraśūnyatā /
analyzed: asaṃskṛta śūnyatā  atyanta śūnyatā  an avara agra śūnyatā
translated: Emptiness of the unconditioned.🔽Absolute emptiness.🔽Emptiness without beginning or end.

original: anavakāraśūnyatā /
analyzed: anavakāra śūnyatā
translated: Emptiness without rejection.

original: prakṛtiśūnyatā /
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatā
translated: Emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: sarvadharmaśūnyatā /
analyzed: sarva dharma śūnyatā
translated: Emptiness of all phenomena.

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyatā /🔽anupalambhaśūnyatā /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā  anupalambha śūnyatā
translated: Emptiness of specific characteristics.🔽Emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: abhāvaśūnyatā /🔽svabhāvaśūnyatā /
analyzed: abhāva śūnyatā  svabhāva śūnyatā
translated: Emptiness of non-existence.🔽Emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā /
analyzed: abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā
translated: Emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence.

original: catvāri smṛtyupasthānāni /🔽catvāri samyakprahāṇāni /
analyzed: catvāri smṛti upasthānāni  catvāri samyakprahāṇāni
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness.🔽The four right efforts.

original: catvāra ṛddhipādāḥ /
analyzed: catvāraḥ ṛddhipādāḥ
translated: The four bases of supernatural power.

original: pañcendriyāṇi /
analyzed: pañca indriyāṇi
translated: The five faculties.

original: pañca balāni /
analyzed: pañca balāni
translated: The five strengths.

original: sapta bodhyaṅgāni /
analyzed: sapta bodhyaṅgāni
translated: The seven factors of awakening.

original: āryāṣṭāṅgo mārgaḥ /
analyzed: ārya aṣṭa aṅgaḥ mārgaḥ
translated: The noble eightfold path.

original: catvāry āryasatyāni /
analyzed: catvāri ārya satyāni
translated: The four noble truths.

original: catvāri dhyānāni /
analyzed: catvāri dhyānāni
translated: The four meditations.

original: catvāry apramāṇāni /
analyzed: catvāri apramāṇāni
translated: The four immeasurables.

original: catasra ārūpyasamāpattayaḥ /
analyzed: catasraḥ ārūpya samāpattayaḥ
translated: The four formless attainments.

original: aṣṭau vimokṣāḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭau vimokṣāḥ
translated: The eight liberations.

original: navānupūrvavihārasamāpattayaḥ /
analyzed: nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ
translated: The nine successive attainments.

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhāni /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhāni
translated: The liberations through emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: pañcābhijñāḥ /🔽sarvasamādhayaḥ /
analyzed: pañca abhijñāḥ  sarva samādhayaḥ
translated: The five higher knowledges.🔽All meditative absorptions.

original: sarvadhāraṇīmukhāni /
analyzed: sarva dhāraṇī mukhāni
translated: All doors of mnemonic incantation.

original: daśatathāgatabalāni /
analyzed: daśa tathāgata balāni
translated: The ten powers of the Tathagata.

original: catvāri vaiśāradyāni /
analyzed: catvāri vaiśāradyāni
translated: The four forms of fearlessness.

original: catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ /
analyzed: catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ
translated: The four forms of unobstructed cognition.

original: mahāmaitrī /
analyzed: mahā maitrī
translated: Great loving kindness.

original: mahākaruṇā /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā
translated: Great compassion.

original: aṣṭādaśāveṇikabuddhadharmāḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭādaśa āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ
translated: The eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyābhijñāvikrīḍitāny upadiśyante /
analyzed: bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya abhijñā vikrīḍitāni upadiśyante
translated: The playful displays of the superknowledges of the bodhisattva mahāsattva are taught.

original: evaṃkila bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranta upapādukā bhaviṣyanti / evam abhijñāsv aparihāṇadharmāṇo bhavanti /
analyzed: evam kila bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyām carantaḥ upapādukāḥ bhaviṣyanti evam abhijñāsu a parihāṇa dharmāṇaḥ bhavanti
translated: Thus, indeed, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, practicing the perfection of wisdom, will become spontaneously born. Thus they become those whose nature is not to fall away from the superknowledges.

original: buddhakṣetrād buddhakṣetraṃ saṃkramiṣyanti /
analyzed: buddhakṣetrāt buddhakṣetram saṃkramiṣyanti
translated: They will travel from buddhafield to buddhafield.

original: yaiś ca kuśalamūlair ākāṅkṣiṣyanti / tān buddhān bhagavataḥ satkartuṃ gurukartuṃ mānayituṃ pūjayituṃ tāni tathārūpāṇi kuśalamūlāni samṛtsyanti /
analyzed: yaiḥ ca kuśala mūlaiḥ ākāṅkṣiṣyanti tān buddhān bhagavataḥ satkartum gurukartum mānayitum pūjayitum tāni tathārūpāṇi kuśala mūlāni samṛtsyanti
translated: And with whatever wholesome roots they wish to honor, revere, respect, and worship those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, those such wholesome roots will be fulfilled.

original: yañ ca teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatām antikād dharmaṃ śroṣyanti /
analyzed: yam ca teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām antikāt dharmam śroṣyanti
translated: And whatever Dharma they will hear from those Buddhas, Blessed Ones,

original: sa na kadācid ācchetsyate /
analyzed: sa na kadācid ācchetsyate
translated: that will never be cut off.

original: yāvat sarvākārajñatām anuprāpsyanti /
analyzed: yāvat sarva ākāra jña tām anuprāpsyanti
translated: Until they attain complete knowing in all its aspects.

original: sadāsamāhitāś ca bhaviṣyanti /🔽avikṣiptāś ca samāhitayogena / asaṅgapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: sadā samāhitāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti  avikṣiptāḥ ca samāhita yogena asaṅga pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will always be concentrated.🔽And they will be undistracted, concentrated through the yoga of non-attachment, and will have unobstructed eloquence.

original: anācchedyapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: an ācchedya pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: And they will have uninterrupted eloquence.

original: samāhitapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /🔽yuktapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: samāhita pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti  yukta pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will have focused eloquence.🔽They will have appropriate eloquence.

original: śliṣṭapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: śliṣṭa pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will have coherent eloquence.

original: arthavatpratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: arthavat pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will have meaningful eloquence.

original: sarvalokābhyudgataviśiṣṭapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti bodhisattvā mahāsattvā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva loka abhyudgata viśiṣṭa pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: They will have eloquence that is superior to all worlds. Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas will have that through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: bahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya saṃparigraha upadiśyate /
analyzed: bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya saṃparigrahaḥ upadiśyate
translated: The complete acceptance of the bodhisattva mahāsattva is taught on the basis of external emptiness.

original: prathamacittotpādam upādāya yāvad daśamaś cittotpādo bodhisattvamārgaś copadiśyate /
analyzed: prathama citta utpādam upādāya yāvat daśamaḥ citta utpādaḥ bodhisattva mārgaḥ ca upadiśyate
translated: The bodhisattva path, from the first production of the thought of enlightenment up to the tenth stage, is taught.

original: yad uta dānapāramitā /
analyzed: yat uta dāna pāramitā
translated: Namely, the perfection of giving.

original: śīlapāramitā /🔽kṣāntipāramitā /
analyzed: śīla pāramitā  kṣānti pāramitā
translated: The perfection of morality.🔽The perfection of patience.

original: vīryapāramitā /
analyzed: vīrya pāramitā
translated: The perfection of effort.

original: dhyānapāramitā /
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitā
translated: The perfection of concentration.

original: prajñāpāramitā /🔽adhyātmaśūnyatā /🔽bahirdhāśūnyatā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā  adhyātma śūnyatā  bahirdhā śūnyatā
translated: The perfection of wisdom.🔽Internal emptiness.🔽External emptiness.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatā /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā
translated: Emptiness of both internal and external.

original: śūnyatāśūnyatā /
analyzed: śūnyatā aśūnyatā
translated: Emptiness of emptiness.

original: mahāśūnyatā /🔽paramārthaśūnyatā /
analyzed: mahāśūnyatā  paramārtha śūnyatā
translated: Great emptiness.🔽Ultimate emptiness.

original: saṃskṛtaśūnyatā /🔽asaṃskṛtaśūnyatā /
analyzed: saṃskṛta śūnyatā  asaṃskṛta śūnyatā
translated: Emptiness of the conditioned.🔽Emptiness of the unconditioned.

original: atyantaśūnyatā /🔽anavarāgraśūnyatā /
analyzed: atyanta śūnyatā  an avara agra śūnyatā
translated: Absolute emptiness.🔽Emptiness without beginning or end.

original: anavakāraśūnyatā /
analyzed: anavakāra śūnyatā
translated: Emptiness without rejection.

original: prakṛtiśūnyatā /
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatā
translated: The emptiness of nature.

original: sarvadharmaśūnyatā /
analyzed: sarva dharma śūnyatā
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena.

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyatā /🔽anupalambhaśūnyatā /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā  anupalambha śūnyatā
translated: The emptiness of specific characteristics.🔽The emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: abhāvaśūnyatā /🔽svabhāvaśūnyatā /
analyzed: abhāva śūnyatā  svabhāva śūnyatā
translated: The emptiness of non-existence.🔽The emptiness of own-nature.

original: abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā /
analyzed: abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā
translated: The emptiness of the own-nature of non-existence.

original: catvāri smṛtyupasthānāni /🔽catvāri samyakprahāṇāni /
analyzed: catvāri smṛti upasthānāni  catvāri samyakprahāṇāni
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness.🔽The four right efforts.

original: catvāra ṛddhipādāḥ /
analyzed: catvāraḥ ṛddhipādāḥ
translated: The four bases of supernatural power.

original: pañcendriyāṇi /
analyzed: pañca indriyāṇi
translated: The five faculties.

original: pañca balāni /
analyzed: pañca balāni
translated: The five powers.

original: sapta bodhyaṅgāni /
analyzed: sapta bodhyaṅgāni
translated: The seven factors of awakening.

original: āryāṣṭāṅgo mārgaḥ /
analyzed: ārya aṣṭa aṅgaḥ mārgaḥ
translated: The noble eightfold path.

original: catvāry āryasatyāni /
analyzed: catvāri ārya satyāni
translated: The four noble truths.

original: catvāri dhyānāni /
analyzed: catvāri dhyānāni
translated: The four meditations.

original: catvāry apramāṇāni /
analyzed: catvāri apramāṇāni
translated: The four immeasurables.

original: catasra ārūpyasamāpattayaḥ /
analyzed: catasraḥ ārūpya samāpattayaḥ
translated: The four formless attainments.

original: aṣṭau vimokṣāḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭau vimokṣāḥ
translated: The eight liberations.

original: navānupūrvavihārasamāpattayaḥ /
analyzed: nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ
translated: The nine successive attainments.

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhāni /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhāni
translated: The liberations through emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: pañcābhijñāḥ /🔽sarvasamādhayaḥ /
analyzed: pañca abhijñāḥ  sarva samādhayaḥ
translated: The five higher knowledges.🔽All the concentrations.

original: sarvadhāraṇīmukhāni /
analyzed: sarva dhāraṇī mukhāni
translated: All the doors of retention.

original: daśatathāgatabalāni /
analyzed: daśa tathāgata balāni
translated: The ten powers of the Tathagata.

original: catvāri vaiśāradyāni /
analyzed: catvāri vaiśāradyāni
translated: The four confidences.

original: catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ /
analyzed: catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ
translated: The four analytical knowledges.

original: mahāmaitrī /
analyzed: mahā maitrī
translated: Great love.

original: mahākaruṇā /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā
translated: Great compassion.

original: aṣṭādaśāveṇikabuddhadharmāḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭādaśa āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ
translated: The eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyābhijñāvikrīḍitāny upadiśyante /
analyzed: bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya abhijñā vikrīḍitāni upadiśyante
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva is taught the play of the higher knowledges.

original: evaṃkila bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranta upapādukā bhaviṣyanti / evam abhijñāsv aparihāṇadharmāṇo bhavanti /
analyzed: evam kila bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyām carantaḥ upapādukāḥ bhaviṣyanti evam abhijñāsu a parihāṇa dharmāṇaḥ bhavanti
translated: In this way, indeed, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, practicing the perfection of wisdom, will be spontaneously born. In this way, they will not fall away from the superknowledges.

original: buddhakṣetrād buddhakṣetraṃ saṃkramiṣyanti /
analyzed: buddhakṣetrāt buddhakṣetram saṃkramiṣyanti
translated: They will travel from buddhafield to buddhafield.

original: yaiś ca kuśalamūlair ākāṅkṣiṣyanti / tān buddhān bhagavataḥ satkartuṃ gurukartuṃ mānayituṃ pūjayituṃ tāni tathārūpāṇi kuśalamūlāni samṛtsyanti /
analyzed: yaiḥ ca kuśala mūlaiḥ ākāṅkṣiṣyanti tān buddhān bhagavataḥ satkartum gurukartum mānayitum pūjayitum tāni tathārūpāṇi kuśala mūlāni samṛtsyanti
translated: And with whatever wholesome roots they wish to honor, revere, respect, and worship those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, those forms of wholesome roots will be successful.

original: yañ ca teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatām antikād dharmaṃ śroṣyanti / sa na kadācid ācchetsyate
analyzed: yam ca teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām antikāt dharmam śroṣyanti sa na kadācid ācchetsyate
translated: And whatever Dharma they will hear from those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, that will never be cut off

original: yāvat sarvākārajñatām anuprāpsyante / sadāsamāhitāś ca bhaviṣyanti avikṣiptāś ca samāhitayogena /
analyzed: yāvat sarva ākāra jña tām anuprāpsyante sadā samāhitāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti avikṣiptāḥ ca samāhita yogena
translated: until they attain omniscience. And they will always be concentrated, undistracted, with the yoga of concentration.

original: asaṅgapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: a saṅga pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will have unobstructed eloquence.

original: anācchedyapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti / samāhitapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: an ācchedya pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti samāhita pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will have uninterrupted eloquence. They will have concentrated eloquence.

original: yuktapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: yukta pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will have reasoned eloquence.

original: śliṣṭapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: śliṣṭa pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will have coherent eloquence.

original: arthavatpratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: arthavat pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will have meaningful eloquence.

original: sarvalokābhyudgataviśiṣṭapratibhānāś ca bhaviṣyanti bodhisattvā mahāsattvā anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva loka abhyudgata viśiṣṭa pratibhānāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ anupalambha yogena
translated: They will have eloquence that is superior to all worlds. Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas will have eloquence through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya saṃparigraha upadiśyate prathamacittotpādam upādāya yāvad daśamaś cittotpādo
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya saṃparigrahaḥ upadiśyate prathama citta utpādam upādāya yāvat daśamaḥ citta utpādaḥ
translated: The acceptance of the bodhisattva mahāsattva is taught, beginning with the first production of the thought of enlightenment up to the tenth production of the thought of enlightenment,

original: yad uta dānapāramitā /
analyzed: yat uta dāna pāramitā
translated: namely, the perfection of giving,

original: śīlapāramitā /🔽kṣāntipāramitā /
analyzed: śīla pāramitā  kṣānti pāramitā
translated: the perfection of morality,🔽the perfection of patience,

analyzed: dhyāna pāramitā

analyzed: prajñāpāramitā  adhyātma śūnyatā
translated: and the perfection of wisdom.🔽The emptiness of internal phenomena,

original: bahirdhāśūnyatā /
analyzed: bahirdhā śūnyatā
translated: the emptiness of external phenomena,

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatā /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā
translated: the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena,

analyzed: śūnyatā aśūnyatā
translated: the emptiness of emptiness,

original: mahāśūnyatā /
analyzed: mahāśūnyatā
