analyzed: na cakṣuḥ śūnyatā cakṣuḥ śūnyatām samanupaśyati  na śrotra śūnyatā śrotra śūnyatām samanupaśyati  na ghrāṇa śūnyatā ghrāṇa śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of the eye as the emptiness of the eye.🔽He does not see the emptiness of the ear as the emptiness of the ear.🔽He does not see the emptiness of the nose as the emptiness of the nose.

original: na jihvāśūnyatā jihvāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na jihvā śūnyatā jihvā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of the tongue as the emptiness of the tongue.

original: na kāyaśūnyatā kāyaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na kāya śūnyatā kāya śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of the body as the emptiness of the body.

original: na manaḥśūnyatā manaḥśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na manaḥ śūnyatā manaḥ śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of the mind as the emptiness of the mind.

original: na rūpaśūnyatā rūpaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽na śabdaśūnyatā śabdaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽na gandhaśūnyatā gandhaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na rūpa śūnyatā rūpa śūnyatām samanupaśyati  na śabda śūnyatā śabda śūnyatām samanupaśyati  na gandha śūnyatā gandha śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of form as the emptiness of form.🔽He does not see the emptiness of sound as the emptiness of sound.🔽He does not see the emptiness of smell as the emptiness of smell.

original: na rasaśūnyatā rasaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na rasa śūnyatā rasa śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of taste as the emptiness of taste.

original: na sparśaśūnyatā sparśaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na sparśa śūnyatā sparśa śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of touch as the emptiness of touch.

original: na dharmaśūnyatā dharmaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na dharma śūnyatā dharma śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of phenomena does not consider the emptiness of phenomena.

original: na cakṣurvijñānaśūnyatā cakṣurvijñānaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽na śrotravijñānaśūnyatā śrotravijñānaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽na ghrāṇavijñānaśūnyatā ghrāṇavijñānaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na cakṣuḥ vijñāna śūnyatā cakṣuḥ vijñāna śūnyatām samanupaśyati  na śrotra vijñāna śūnyatā śrotra vijñāna śūnyatām samanupaśyati  na ghrāṇa vijñāna śūnyatā ghrāṇa vijñāna śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of eye consciousness does not consider the emptiness of eye consciousness.🔽The emptiness of ear consciousness does not consider the emptiness of ear consciousness.🔽The emptiness of nose consciousness does not consider the emptiness of nose consciousness.

original: na jihvāvijñānaśūnyatā jihvāvijñānaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na jihvā vijñāna śūnyatā jihvā vijñāna śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of tongue consciousness does not consider the emptiness of tongue consciousness.

original: na kāyavijñānaśūnyatā kāyavijñānaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na kāya vijñāna śūnyatā kāya vijñāna śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of body consciousness does not consider the emptiness of body consciousness.

original: na manovijñānaśūnyatā manovijñānaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na manaḥ vijñāna śūnyatā manaḥ vijñāna śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of mind consciousness does not consider the emptiness of mind consciousness.

original: na cakṣuḥsaṃsparśaśūnyatā saṃjñāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽na śrotrasaṃsparśaśūnyatā saṃjñāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽na ghrāṇasaṃsparśaśūnyatā saṃjñāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa śūnyatā saṃjñā śūnyatām samanupaśyati  na śrotra saṃsparśa śūnyatā saṃjñā śūnyatām samanupaśyati  na ghrāṇa saṃsparśa śūnyatā saṃjñā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of eye contact does not consider the emptiness of eye contact.🔽The emptiness of ear contact does not consider the emptiness of ear contact.🔽The emptiness of nose contact does not consider the emptiness of nose contact.

original: na jihvāsaṃsparśaśūnyatā saṃjñāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na jihvā saṃsparśa śūnyatā saṃjñā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of tongue contact does not consider the emptiness of tongue contact.

original: na kāyasaṃsparśaśūnyatā saṃjñāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na kāya saṃsparśa śūnyatā saṃjñā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of body contact does not consider the emptiness of body contact.

original: na manaḥsaṃsparśaśūnyatā saṃjñāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na manaḥ saṃsparśa śūnyatā saṃjñā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of mental contact does not consider the emptiness of perception.

original: na cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyatā cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽na śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyatā śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽na ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyatā ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatā cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatām samanupaśyati  na śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatā śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatām samanupaśyati  na ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatā ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of the eye-contact-conditioned feeling does not consider the emptiness of the eye-contact-conditioned feeling.🔽The emptiness of the ear-contact-conditioned feeling does not consider the emptiness of the ear-contact-conditioned feeling.🔽The emptiness of the nose-contact-conditioned feeling does not consider the emptiness of the nose-contact-conditioned feeling.

original: na jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyatā jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatā jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of the tongue-contact-conditioned feeling does not consider the emptiness of the tongue-contact-conditioned feeling.

original: na kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyatā kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati / na
analyzed: na kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatā kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatām samanupaśyati na
translated: The emptiness of the body-contact-conditioned feeling does not consider the emptiness of the body-contact-conditioned feeling.

original: manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyatā manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatā manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of the mind-contact-conditioned feeling does not consider the emptiness of the mind-contact-conditioned feeling.

original: na pṛthivīdhātuśūnyatā pṛthivīdhātuśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na pṛthivī dhātu śūnyatā pṛthivī dhātu śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of the earth element does not consider the emptiness of the earth element.

original: nābdhātuśūnyatābdhātuśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽na tejodhātuśūnyatā tejodhātuśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na ap dhātu śūnyatā ap dhātu śūnyatām samanupaśyati  na tejaḥ dhātu śūnyatā tejaḥ dhātu śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of the water element as the emptiness of the water element.🔽He does not see the emptiness of the fire element as the emptiness of the fire element.

original: na vāyudhātuśūnyatā vāyudhātuśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na vāyu dhātu śūnyatā vāyu dhātu śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of the wind element as the emptiness of the wind element.

original: nākāśadhātuśūnyatākāśadhātuśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na ākāśa dhātu śūnyatā ākāśa dhātu śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of the space element as the emptiness of the space element.

original: na vijñānadhātuśūnyatā vijñānadhātuśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na vijñāna dhātu śūnyatā vijñāna dhātu śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of the consciousness element as the emptiness of the consciousness element.

original: nāvidyāśūnyatāvidyāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na avidyā śūnyatā avidyā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of ignorance as the emptiness of ignorance.

original: na saṃskāraśūnyatā saṃskāraśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na saṃskāra śūnyatā saṃskāra śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of volitional formations as the emptiness of volitional formations.

original: na vijñānaśūnyatā vijñānaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na vijñāna śūnyatā vijñāna śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of consciousness as the emptiness of consciousness.

original: na nāmarūpaśūnyatā nāmarūpaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na nāma rūpa śūnyatā nāma rūpa śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of name and form as the emptiness of name and form.

original: na ṣaḍāyatanaśūnyata ṣaḍāyatanaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na ṣaṣ āyatana śūnyataiḥ ṣaṣ āyatana śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of the six sense bases as the emptiness of the six sense bases.

original: na sparśaśūnyatā sparśaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na sparśa śūnyatā sparśa śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of contact as the emptiness of contact.

original: na vedanāśūnyatā vedanāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽na tṛṣṇāśūnyatā tṛṣṇāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na vedanā śūnyatā vedanā śūnyatām samanupaśyati  na tṛṣṇā śūnyatā tṛṣṇā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of feeling as the emptiness of feeling.🔽He does not see the emptiness of craving as the emptiness of craving.

original: nopādānaśūnyatā upādānaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na upādāna śūnyatā upādāna śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of clinging as the emptiness of clinging.

original: na bhavaśūnyatā bhavaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na bhava śūnyatā bhava śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of existence does not see the emptiness of existence.

original: na jātisūnyatā jātiśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na jāti sūnyatā jāti śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of birth does not see the emptiness of birth.

original: na jarāmaraṇaśūnyatā jarāmaraṇaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na jarā maraṇa śūnyatā jarā maraṇa śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of old age and death does not see the emptiness of old age and death.

original: na dānapāramitāśūnyatā dānapāramitāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na dāna pāramitā śūnyatā dāna pāramitā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of the perfection of giving does not see the emptiness of the perfection of giving.

original: na śīlapāramitāśūnyatā śīlapāramitāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽na kṣāntipāramitāśūnyatā kṣāntipāramitāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na śīla pāramitā śūnyatā śīla pāramitā śūnyatām samanupaśyati  na kṣānti pāramitā śūnyatā kṣānti pāramitā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of the perfection of morality does not see the emptiness of the perfection of morality.🔽The emptiness of the perfection of patience does not see the emptiness of the perfection of patience.

original: na vīryapāramitāśūnyatā vīryapāramitāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na vīrya pāramitā śūnyatā vīrya pāramitā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of the perfection of effort does not see the emptiness of the perfection of effort.

original: na dhyānapāramitāśūnyatā dhyānapāramitāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na dhyāna pāramitā śūnyatā dhyāna pāramitā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of the perfection of concentration does not see the emptiness of the perfection of concentration.

original: na prajñāpāramitāśūnyatā prajñāpāramitāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽nādhyātmaśūnyatāśūnyatādhyātmaśūnyatāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na prajñāpāramitā śūnyatā prajñāpāramitā śūnyatām samanupaśyati  na adhyātma śūnyatā aśūnyatā adhyātma śūnyatā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of the perfection of wisdom does not see the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The emptiness of the emptiness of the internal does not see the emptiness of the emptiness of the internal.

original: na bahirdhāśūnyatāśūnyatā bahirdhāśūnyatāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na bahirdhā śūnyatā aśūnyatā bahirdhā śūnyatā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of the emptiness of the external does not see the emptiness of the emptiness of the external.

original: nādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāśūnyatādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā aśūnyatā adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of internal and external as empty of the emptiness of internal and external.

original: na śūnyatāśūnyatāśūnyatā śūnyatāśūnyatāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na śūnyatā a śūnyatā a śūnyatā śūnyatā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of emptiness as empty of the emptiness of emptiness.

original: na mahāśūnyatāśūnyatā mahāśūnyatāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽na paramārthaśūnyatāśūnyatā paramārthaśūnyatāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na mahā śūnyatā aśūnyatā mahā śūnyatā aśūnyatām samanupaśyati  na paramārtha śūnyatā aśūnyatā paramārtha śūnyatā aśūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of great as empty of the emptiness of great.🔽He does not see the emptiness of ultimate reality as empty of the emptiness of ultimate reality.

original: na saṃskṛtaśūnyatāśūnyatā saṃskṛtaśūnyatāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na saṃskṛta śūnyatā śūnyatā saṃskṛta śūnyatā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of conditioned phenomena as empty of the emptiness of conditioned phenomena.

original: nāsaṃskṛtaśūnyatāśūnyatāsaṃskṛtaśūnyatāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na asaṃskṛta śūnyatā śūnyatā asaṃskṛta śūnyatā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena as empty of the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena.

original: nātyantaśūnyatāśūnyatātyantaśūnyatāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽nānavarāgraśūnyatāśūnyatānavarāgraśūnyatāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽nānavakāraśūnyatāśūnyatānavakāraśūnyatāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na atyanta śūnyatā aśūnyatā atyanta śūnyatā aśūnyatām samanupaśyati  na an avara agra śūnyatā a śūnyatā an avara agra śūnyatā śūnyatām samanupaśyati  na anavakāra śūnyatā śūnyatā anavakāra śūnyatā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of the ultimate as empty of the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽He does not see the emptiness of the beginningless and endless as empty of the emptiness of the beginningless and endless.🔽He does not see the emptiness of non-rejection as empty of the emptiness of non-rejection.

original: na prakṛtiśūnyatāśūnyatā prakṛtiśūnyatāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na prakṛti śūnyatā śūnyatā prakṛti śūnyatā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of nature as empty of the emptiness of nature.

original: na sarvadharmaśūnyatāśūnyatā
analyzed: na sarva dharma śūnyatā aśūnyatā
translated: He does not see the emptiness of all phenomena as empty of the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: sarvadharmaśūnyatāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: sarva dharma śūnyatā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of all phenomena as empty.

original: na svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāśūnyatā svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā śūnyatā sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of its own mark as the emptiness of its own mark.

original: nānupalambhaśūnyatāśūnyatānupalambhaśūnyatāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na anupalambha śūnyatā śūnyatā anupalambha śūnyatā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of non-apprehension as the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: nābhāvaśūnyatāśūnyatābhāvaśūnyatāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na abhāva śūnyatā aśūnyatā abhāva śūnyatā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of non-existence as the emptiness of non-existence.

original: na svabhāvaśūnyatāśūnyatā svabhāvaśūnyatāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na svabhāva śūnyatā aśūnyatā svabhāva śūnyatā aśūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of own-nature as the emptiness of own-nature.

original: nābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāśūnyatābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā aśūnyatā abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of the own-nature of non-existence as the emptiness of the own-nature of non-existence.

original: na smṛtyupasthānaśūnyatā smṛtyupasthānaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na smṛti upasthāna śūnyatā smṛti upasthāna śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of the applications of mindfulness as the emptiness of the applications of mindfulness.

original: na samyakprahāṇaśūnyatā samyakprahāṇaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽na ṛddhipādaśūnyatā ṛddhipādaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na samyakprahāṇa śūnyatā samyakprahāṇa śūnyatām samanupaśyati  na ṛddhipāda śūnyatā ṛddhipāda śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of the right efforts as the emptiness of the right efforts.🔽He does not see the emptiness of the bases of spiritual power as the emptiness of the bases of spiritual power.

original: nendriyaśūnyatā indriyaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na indriya śūnyatā indriya śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of the faculties as the emptiness of the faculties.

original: na balaśūnyatā balaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na bala śūnyatā bala śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of the powers as the emptiness of the powers.

original: na bodhyaṅgaśūnyatā bodhyaṅgaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na bodhyaṅga śūnyatā bodhyaṅga śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of the limbs of enlightenment as the emptiness of the limbs of enlightenment.

original: na mārgaśūnyatā mārgaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na mārga śūnyatā mārga śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of the path does not see the emptiness of the path.

original: nāryasatyasūnyatāryasatyaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na ārya satya sūnyatā ārya satya śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of the noble truths does not see the emptiness of the noble truths.

original: na dhyānaśūnyatā dhyānaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na dhyāna śūnyatā dhyāna śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of the concentrations does not see the emptiness of the concentrations.

original: nāpramāṇaśūnyatāpramāṇaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na apramāṇa śūnyatā apramāṇa śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of the immeasurables does not see the emptiness of the immeasurables.

original: nārūpyasamāpattiśūnyatārūpyasamāpattiśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na arūpya samāpatti śūnyatā ārūpya samāpatti śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of the formless concentrations does not see the emptiness of the formless concentrations.

original: na vimokṣaśūnyatā vimokṣaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽nānupūrvavihārasamāpattiśūnyatānupūrvavihārasamāpattiśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na vimokṣa śūnyatā vimokṣa śūnyatām samanupaśyati  na anupūrva vihāra samāpatti śūnyatā anupūrva vihāra samāpatti śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of the liberations does not see the emptiness of the liberations.🔽The emptiness of the successive concentrations does not see the emptiness of the successive concentrations.

original: na śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhaśūnyatā śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukha śūnyatā śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukha śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of the liberations through emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness does not see the emptiness of the liberations through emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: nābhijñāśūnyatābhijñāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽na samādhiśūnyatā samādhiśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na abhijñā śūnyatā abhijñā śūnyatām samanupaśyati  na samādhi śūnyatā samādhi śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of the higher knowledges does not see the emptiness of the higher knowledges.🔽The emptiness of the meditative absorptions does not see the emptiness of the meditative absorptions.

original: na dhāraṇīmukhaśūnyatā dhāraṇīmukhaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na dhāraṇīmukha śūnyatā dhāraṇīmukha śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: The emptiness of the dhāraṇī gateways does not see the emptiness of the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: na daśatathāgatabalaśūnyatā daśatathāgatabalaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na daśa tathāgata bala śūnyatā daśa tathāgata bala śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of the ten powers of the Tathāgata as empty of the ten powers of the Tathāgata.

original: na vaiśāradyaśūnyatā vaiśāradyaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na vaiśāradya śūnyatā vaiśāradya śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of the fearlessnesses as empty of the fearlessnesses.

original: na pratisaṃvicchūnyatā pratisaṃvicchūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /🔽na mahāmaitrīśūnyatā mahāmaitrīśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na pratisaṃvid śūnyatā pratisaṃvid śūnyatām samanupaśyati  na mahā maitrī śūnyatā mahā maitrī śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of the detailed and thorough knowledges as empty of the detailed and thorough knowledges.🔽He does not see the emptiness of the great friendliness as empty of the great friendliness.

original: na mahākaruṇāśūnyatā mahākaruṇāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na mahā karuṇā śūnyatā mahā karuṇā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of the great compassion as empty of the great compassion.

original: nāveṇikabuddhadharmaśūnyatāveṇikabuddhadharmaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na āveṇika buddha dharma śūnyatā āveṇika buddha dharma śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of the distinct attributes of a Buddha as empty of the distinct attributes of a Buddha.

original: na sarvadharmaśūnyatā sarvadharmaśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na sarva dharma śūnyatā sarva dharma śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of all dharmas as empty of all dharmas.

original: na sarvajñatāśūnyatā sarvajñatāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na sarvajña tā śūnyatā sarvajña tā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of the knowledge of all modes as empty of the knowledge of all modes.

original: na mārgākārajñatāśūnyatā mārgākārajñatāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na mārga ākāra jñatā śūnyatā mārga ākāra jñatā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of the knowledge of paths as empty of the knowledge of paths.

original: na sarvākārajñatāśūnyatā sarvākārajñatāśūnyatāṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na sarva ākārajñatā śūnyatā sarva ākārajñatā śūnyatām samanupaśyati
translated: He does not see the emptiness of the knowledge of all aspects as empty of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: yaḥ kauśika iha śūnyatāyāṃ na śikṣate sa śūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ kauśikaḥ iha śūnyatāyām na śikṣate sa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: Kauśika, he who does not train in this emptiness trains in emptiness without making a duality.

original: sa rūpaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa rūpa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of form without making a duality.

original: sa vedanāśūnyatāyāṃ 🔽śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa saṃjñāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa saṃskāraśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa vedanā śūnyatāyām  śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa saṃjñā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa saṃskāra śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of feeling...🔽He trains in the emptiness of perception...🔽He trains in the emptiness of volitional formations...

original: sa vijñānaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa cakṣuḥśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa vijñāna śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa cakṣuḥ śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of consciousness without making a duality.🔽He trains in the emptiness of the eye without making a duality.

original: sa śrotraśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa ghrāṇaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa śrotra śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa ghrāṇa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the ear...🔽He trains in the emptiness of the nose...

original: sa jihvāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa jihvā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the tongue...

original: sa kāyaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa kāya śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the body...

original: sa manaḥśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa rūpaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa manaḥ śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa rūpa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the thinking-mind without making a duality.🔽He trains in the emptiness of form without making a duality.

original: sa śabdaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa gandhaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa śabda śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa gandha śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of sound...🔽He trains in the emptiness of smell...

original: sa rasaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa sparśaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa rasa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa 🔽sa sparśa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of taste...🔽He trains in the emptiness of touch...

original: sa dharmaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa cakṣurvijñānaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa dharma śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa cakṣuḥ vijñāna śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of phenomena without making any distinctions.🔽He trains in the emptiness of eye consciousness without making any distinctions.

original: sa śrotravijñānaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa ghrāṇavijñānaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa śrotra vijñāna śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa ghrāṇa vijñāna śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of ear consciousness without making any distinctions.🔽He trains in the emptiness of nose consciousness without making any distinctions.

original: sa jihvāvijñānaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa jihvā vijñāna śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of tongue consciousness without making any distinctions.

original: sa kāyavijñānaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa kāya vijñāna śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of body consciousness without making any distinctions.

original: sa manovijñānaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa cakṣuḥsaṃsparśaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa manaḥ vijñāna śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of mind consciousness without making any distinctions.🔽He trains in the emptiness of eye contact without making any distinctions.

original: sa śrotrasaṃsparśaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa ghrāṇasaṃsparśaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa śrotra saṃsparśa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa ghrāṇa saṃsparśa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of ear contact without making any distinctions.🔽He trains in the emptiness of nose contact without making any distinctions.

original: sa jihvāsaṃsparśaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa kāyasaṃsparśaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa jihvā saṃsparśa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa kāya saṃsparśa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of tongue contact without making any distinctions.🔽He trains in the emptiness of body contact without making any distinctions.

original: sa manaḥsaṃsparśaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa manaḥ saṃsparśa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of mind contact without making any distinctions.

original: sa cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of eye contact as a condition for feeling without making a distinction.

original: sa śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of ear contact as a condition for feeling without making a distinction.🔽He trains in the emptiness of nose contact as a condition for feeling without making a distinction.

original: sa jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of tongue contact as a condition for feeling without making a distinction.

original: sa kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of body contact as a condition for feeling without making a distinction.

original: sa manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa pṛthivīdhātuśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa pṛthivī dhātu śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of mind contact as a condition for feeling without making a distinction.🔽He trains in the emptiness of the earth element without making a distinction.

original: so 'bdhātuśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa tejodhātuśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saḥ b dhātu śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa tejaḥ dhātu śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the water element without making a distinction.🔽He trains in the emptiness of the fire element without making a distinction.

original: sa vāyudhātuśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa ākāśadhātuśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa vāyu dhātu śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  saḥ ākāśa dhātu śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the wind element without making a distinction.🔽He trains in the emptiness of the space element without making a distinction.

original: sa vijñānadhātuśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa vijñānadhātu śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the consciousness element without making a distinction.

original: so 'vidyāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saḥ vidyā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of ignorance without making a division into two.

original: sa saṃskāraśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa saṃskāra śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of volitional factors without making a division into two.

original: sa vijñānaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa vijñāna śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of consciousness without making a division into two.

original: sa nāmarūpaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa ṣaḍāyatanaśūnyatāyāṃ
analyzed: sa nāma rūpa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa ṣaṣ āyatana śūnyatāyām
translated: He trains in the emptiness of name and form without making a division into two.

original: śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa sparśaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa sparśa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the six sense fields without making a division into two.🔽He trains in the emptiness of contact without making a division into two.

original: sa vedanāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa tṛṣṇāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa vedanā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa tṛṣṇā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of feeling without making a division into two.🔽He trains in the emptiness of craving without making a division into two.

original: sa upādānaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa bhavaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saḥ upādāna śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa bhava śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of grasping without making a division into two.🔽He trains in the emptiness of existence without making a division into two.

original: sa jātiśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa jāti śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of birth without making a division into two.

original: sa jarāmaraṇaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa jarā maraṇa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of old age and death without making a division into two.

original: sa dānapāramitāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa śīlapāramitāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa dāna pāramitā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa śīla pāramitā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the perfection of giving without making a division into two.🔽He trains in the emptiness of the perfection of morality without making a division into two.

original: sa kṣāntipāramitāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa kṣānti pāramitā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the perfection of patience without making a division into two.

original: sa vīryapāramitāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa vīrya pāramitā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the perfection of perseverance without making anything into a non-dual entity.

original: sa dhyānapāramitāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa dhyāna pāramitā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the perfection of concentration without making anything into a non-dual entity.

original: sa prajñāpāramitāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkareṇa /
analyzed: sa prajñāpāramitā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkareṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom without making anything into a non-dual entity.

original: so 'dhyātmaśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa bahirdhāśūnyatāśūnyatāyaṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saḥ dhyā ātma śūnyatā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa bahirdhā śūnyatā śūnyatā ayam śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of inner emptiness without making anything into a non-dual entity.🔽He trains in the emptiness of outer emptiness without making anything into a non-dual entity.

original: so 'dhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saḥ dhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of inner and outer emptiness without making anything into a non-dual entity.

original: sa śūnyatāśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa mahāśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa śūnyatā a śūnyatā a śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa mahā śūnyatā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of emptiness without making anything into a non-dual entity.🔽He trains in the emptiness of great emptiness without making anything into a non-dual entity.

original: sa paramārthaśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa saṃskṛtaśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa paramārtha śūnyatā aśūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa saṃskṛta śūnyatā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of ultimate emptiness without making anything into a non-dual entity.🔽He trains in the emptiness of conditioned phenomena without making anything into a non-dual entity.

original: so 'saṃskṛtaśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽so 'tyantaśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saḥ saṃskṛta śūnyatā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sā u tyanta śūnyatā aśūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena without making anything into a non-dual entity.🔽He trains in the emptiness of the ultimate without making anything into a non-dual entity.

original: so 'navarāgraśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saḥ navara agra śūnyatā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the limitless without making anything into a non-dual entity.🔽He trains in the emptiness of what has no beginning or end without making anything into a non-dual entity.

original: so 'navakāraśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saḥ navakāra śūnyatā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the non-repudiation of the emptiness of emptiness, without making any distinction.

original: sa prakṛtiśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa prakṛti śūnyatā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the emptiness of nature, without making any distinction.

original: sa sarvadharmaśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa sarva dharma śūnyatā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the emptiness of all dharmas, without making any distinction.

original: sa svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽so 'nupalambhaśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā aśūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  saḥ nu upalambha śūnyatā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the emptiness of specific characteristics, without making any distinction.🔽He trains in the emptiness of the emptiness of non-apprehension, without making any distinction.

original: so 'bhāvaśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa svabhāvaśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saḥ bhāva śūnyatā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa svabhāva śūnyatā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the emptiness of non-existence, without making any distinction.🔽He trains in the emptiness of the emptiness of own-nature, without making any distinction.

original: so 'bhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa smṛtyupasthānaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saḥ bhāva svabhāva śūnyatā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa smṛti upasthāna śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the emptiness of the own-nature of non-existence, without making any distinction.🔽He trains in the emptiness of the applications of mindfulness, without making any distinction.

original: sa samyakprahāṇaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa ṛddhipādaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa indriyaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa samyakprahāṇa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  saḥ ṛddhipāda śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  saḥ indriya śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the right efforts, without making any distinction.🔽He trains in the emptiness of the bases of supernatural power, without making any distinction.🔽He trains in the emptiness of the faculties, without making any distinction.

original: sa balaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa bala śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the powers, without making any distinction.

original: sa bodhyaṅgaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa bodhyaṅga śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the factors of awakening without making any distinction.

original: sa āryāṣṭāṅgamārgaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa āryasatyaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saḥ ārya aṣṭāṅga mārga śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  saḥ ārya satya śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the noble eightfold path without making any distinction.🔽He trains in the emptiness of the noble truths without making any distinction.

original: sa dhyānaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa dhyāna śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the meditative concentrations without making any distinction.

original: so 'pramāṇaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa ārūpyasamāpattiśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saḥ pramāṇa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  saḥ ārūpya samāpatti śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the immeasurables without making any distinction.🔽He trains in the emptiness of the formless absorptions without making any distinction.

original: sa vimokṣaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽so 'nupūrvavihārasamāpattiśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa vimokṣa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  saḥ nupūrva vihāra samāpatti śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the liberations without making any distinction.🔽He trains in the emptiness of the successive absorptions without making any distinction.

original: sa śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukha śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the doors of liberation that are emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness without making any distinction.

original: so 'bhijñāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa samādhiśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saḥ bhijñā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa samādhi śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the higher knowledges without making any distinction.🔽He trains in the emptiness of the meditative absorptions without making any distinction.

original: sa dhāraṇīmukhaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa dhāraṇī mukha śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the dhāraṇī gateways without making any distinction.

original: sa tathāgatabalaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa tathāgata bala śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the powers of the Tathāgata without making any distinction.

original: sa vaiśāradyaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa vaiśāradya śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the fearlessnesses without making any distinctions.

original: sa pratisaṃvicchūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa mahāmaitrīśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa pratisaṃvid śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa mahā maitrī śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the analytical knowledges without making any distinctions.🔽He trains in the emptiness of the great love without making any distinctions.

original: sa mahākaruṇāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa mahā karuṇā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the great compassion without making any distinctions.

original: sa āveṇikabuddhadharmaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa sarvajñatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saḥ āveṇika buddha dharma śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa sarvajña tā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the unique qualities of a Buddha without making any distinctions.🔽He trains in the emptiness of the knowledge of all modes without making any distinctions.

original: sa mārgākārajñatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa mārga ākāra jña tā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the knowledge of all modes without making any distinctions.

original: sa sarvākārajñatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa sarva ākāra jñatā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the knowledge of all modes without making any distinctions.

original: yaḥ kauśika rūpaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo vedanāśūnyatāyaṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ kauśika rūpa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ vedanā śūnyatā ayam śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: Kauśika, he who trains in the emptiness of form without making any distinctions.🔽He who trains in the emptiness of feeling without making any distinctions.

original: yaḥ saṃjñāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ saṃjñā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of perception without making any distinctions.

original: yaḥ saṃskāraśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo vijñānaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ saṃskāra śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ vijñāna śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of the volitional formations without making any distinctions.🔽He who trains in the emptiness of consciousness without making any distinctions.

original: yaś cakṣuḥśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ cakṣuḥ śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of the eye without making any distinctions.

original: yaḥ śrotraśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo ghrāṇaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ śrotra śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ ghrāṇa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of the ear, without making a duality.🔽He who trains in the emptiness of the nose, without making a duality.

original: yo jihvāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yaḥ kāyaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ jihvā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ kāya śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of the tongue, without making a duality.🔽He who trains in the emptiness of the body, without making a duality.

original: yo manaḥśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ manaḥ śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of the mind, without making a duality.

original: yo rūpaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yaḥ śabdaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ rūpa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ śabda śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of form, without making a duality.🔽He who trains in the emptiness of sound, without making a duality.

original: yo gandhaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo rasaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ gandha śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ rasa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of smell, without making a duality.🔽He who trains in the emptiness of taste, without making a duality.

original: yaḥ sparśaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ sparśa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of touch, without making a duality.

original: yo dharmaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yaś cakṣurvijñānaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ dharma śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ cakṣuḥ vijñāna śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of dharmas, without making a duality.🔽He who trains in the emptiness of eye consciousness, without making a duality.

original: yaḥ śrotravijñānaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo ghrāṇavijñānaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ śrotra vijñāna śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ ghrāṇa vijñāna śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of ear consciousness, without making a duality.🔽He who trains in the emptiness of nose consciousness, without making a duality.

original: yo jihvāvijñānaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ jihvā vijñāna śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of tongue consciousness, without making a duality.

original: yaḥ kāyavijñānaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ kāya vijñāna śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: who trains in the emptiness of the body consciousness without making a duality,

original: yo manovijñānaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yaś cakṣuḥsaṃsparśaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ manaḥ vijñāna śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: who trains in the emptiness of the mind consciousness without making a duality,🔽who trains in the emptiness of eye contact without making a duality,

original: yaḥ śrotrasaṃsparśaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo ghrāṇasaṃsparśaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ śrotra saṃsparśa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ ghrāṇa saṃsparśa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: who trains in the emptiness of ear contact without making a duality,🔽who trains in the emptiness of nose contact without making a duality,

original: yo jihvāsaṃsparśaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ jihvā saṃsparśa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: who trains in the emptiness of tongue contact without making a duality,

original: yaḥ kāyasaṃsparśaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ kāya saṃsparśa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: who trains in the emptiness of body contact without making a duality,

original: yo manaḥsaṃsparśaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yaś cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ manaḥ saṃsparśa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: who trains in the emptiness of mind contact without making a duality,🔽who trains in the emptiness of the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact without making a duality,

original: yaḥ śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa / yo 🔽ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: who trains in the emptiness of the feeling that arises from the condition of ear contact without making a duality,

original: yo jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: who trains in the emptiness of the feeling that arises from the condition of nose contact without making a duality,🔽who trains in the emptiness of the feeling that arises from the condition of tongue contact without making a duality,

original: yaḥ kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: who trains in the emptiness of the feeling that arises from the contact of body and mind without making any distinction,

original: yo manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yaḥ pṛthivīdhātuśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo 'bdhātuśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ pṛthivī dhātu śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ p dhātu śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: who trains in the emptiness of the feeling that arises from the contact of mind and mind without making any distinction,🔽who trains in the emptiness of the earth element without making any distinction,🔽who trains in the emptiness of the water element without making any distinction,

original: yas tejodhātuśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo vāyudhātuśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ tejaḥ dhātu śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ vāyu dhātu śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: who trains in the emptiness of the fire element without making any distinction,🔽who trains in the emptiness of the wind element without making any distinction,

original: ya ākāśadhātuśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo vijñānadhātuśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ ākāśa dhātu śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ vijñānadhātu śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: who trains in the emptiness of the space element without making any distinction,🔽who trains in the emptiness of the consciousness element without making any distinction,

original: yo 'vidyāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ vidyā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: who trains in the emptiness of ignorance without making any distinction,

original: yaḥ saṃskāraśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ saṃskāra śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: who trains in the emptiness of volitional factors without making any distinction,

original: yo vijñānaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ vijñāna śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: who trains in the emptiness of consciousness without making any distinction,

original: yo nāmarūpaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yaḥ ṣaḍāyatanaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ nāma rūpa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ ṣaṣ āyatana śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: who trains in the emptiness of name and form without making any distinction,🔽who trains in the emptiness of the six sense sources without making any distinction,

original: yaḥ sparśaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ sparśa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: who trains in the emptiness of contact without making any distinction,

original: yo vedanāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ vedanā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of feeling without making a duality.

original: yas tṛṣṇāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽ya upādānaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ tṛṣṇā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ upādāna śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of craving without making a duality.🔽He who trains in the emptiness of grasping without making a duality.

original: yo bhavaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo jātiśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ bhava śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ jāti śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of becoming without making a duality.🔽He who trains in the emptiness of birth without making a duality.

original: yo jarāmaraṇaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ jarā maraṇa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of old age and death without making a duality.

original: yo dānapāramitāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yaḥ śīlapāramitāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ dāna pāramitā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ śīla pāramitā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of the perfection of giving without making a duality.🔽He who trains in the emptiness of the perfection of morality without making a duality.

original: yaḥ kṣāntipāramitāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo vīryapāramitāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ kṣānti pāramitā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ vīrya pāramitā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of the perfection of patience without making a duality.🔽He who trains in the emptiness of the perfection of effort without making a duality.

original: yo dhyānapāramitāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ dhyāna pāramitā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of the perfection of concentration without making a duality.

original: yaḥ prajñāpāramitāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo 'dhyātmaśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ prajñāpāramitā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ dhyātma śūnyatā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom without making a duality.🔽He who trains in the emptiness of inner emptiness without making a duality.

original: yo bahirdhāśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ bahirdhā śūnyatā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of outer emptiness without making a duality.

original: yo 'dhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ dhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of the emptiness of internal and external phenomena, without making any distinction.

original: yaḥ śūnyatāśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo mahāśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ śūnyatā a śūnyatā a śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ mahā śūnyatā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of the emptiness of emptiness, without making any distinction.🔽He who trains in the emptiness of the great emptiness, without making any distinction.

original: yaḥ paramārthaśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yaḥ saṃskṛtaśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ paramārtha śūnyatā aśūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ saṃskṛta śūnyatā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of the ultimate emptiness, without making any distinction.🔽He who trains in the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, without making any distinction.

original: yo 'saṃskṛtaśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo 'tyantaśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo 'navarāgraśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saṃskṛta śūnyatā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  tyanta śūnyatā aśūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ navara agra śūnyatā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, without making any distinction.🔽He who trains in the emptiness of absolute emptiness, without making any distinction.🔽He who trains in the emptiness of the emptiness of no beginning or end, without making any distinction.

original: yo 'navakāraśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yaḥ prakṛtiśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ navakāra śūnyatā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ prakṛti śūnyatā aśūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of the emptiness of no remainder, without making any distinction.🔽He who trains in the emptiness of the emptiness of the nature of phenomena, without making any distinction.

original: yaḥ sarvadharmaśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ sarva dharma śūnyatā aśūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of the emptiness of all phenomena, without making any distinction.

original: yaḥ svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā aśūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of the emptiness of specific characteristics, without making any distinction.

original: yo 'nupalambhaśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ n upalambha śūnyatā a śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: who trains in the emptiness of the emptiness of non-apprehension without making a duality;

original: yo 'bhāvaśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ
analyzed: yaḥ bhāva śūnyatā aśūnyatāyām
translated: who trains in the emptiness of the emptiness of non-existence

original: śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yaḥ svabhāvaśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ svabhāva śūnyatā aśūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: without making a duality;🔽who trains in the emptiness of the emptiness of intrinsic nature without making a duality;

original: yo 'bhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yaḥ smṛtyupasthānaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ bhāva svabhāva śūnyatā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ smṛti upasthāna śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: who trains in the emptiness of the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence without making a duality;🔽who trains in the emptiness of the applications of mindfulness without making a duality;

original: yaḥ samyakprahāṇaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽ya ṛddhipādaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ samyakprahāṇa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ ṛddhipāda śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: who trains in the emptiness of the right efforts without making a duality;🔽who trains in the emptiness of the bases of supernatural power without making a duality;

original: ya indriyaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo balaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ indriya śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ bala śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: who trains in the emptiness of the faculties without making a duality;🔽who trains in the emptiness of the powers without making a duality;

original: yo bodhyaṅgaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ bodhyaṅga śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: who trains in the emptiness of the limbs of enlightenment without making a duality;

original: yo mārgaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽ya āryasatyaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo dhyānaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ mārga śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ ārya satya śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ dhyāna śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: who trains in the emptiness of the path without making a duality;🔽who trains in the emptiness of the noble truths without making a duality;🔽who trains in the emptiness of the meditative absorptions without making a duality;

original: yo 'pramāṇaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: pramāṇa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: who trains in the emptiness of the formless [absorptions] without making a duality;

original: ya ārūpyasamāpattiśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ ārūpya samāpatti śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: “One who trains in the emptiness of the formless attainments, without making any distinction.

original: yo 'ṣṭau vimokṣaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ ṣṭau vimokṣa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: “One who trains in the emptiness of the eight liberations, without making any distinction.

original: yo 'nupūrvavihārasamāpattiśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ nupūrva vihāra samāpatti śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: “One who trains in the emptiness of the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, without making any distinction.

original: yaḥ śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukha śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: “One who trains in the emptiness of the gateways to liberation that are emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness, without making any distinction.

original: yo 'bhijñāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yaḥ samādhiśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ bhijñā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ samādhi śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: “One who trains in the emptiness of the forms of higher knowledge, without making any distinction.🔽“One who trains in the emptiness of the meditative stabilities, without making any distinction.

original: yo dhāraṇīmukhaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ dhāraṇī mukha śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: “One who trains in the emptiness of the dhāraṇī gateways, without making any distinction.

original: yo daśatathāgatabalaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo vaiśāradyaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ daśa tathāgata bala śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ vaiśāradya śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: “One who trains in the emptiness of the ten powers of the tathāgatas, without making any distinction.🔽“One who trains in the emptiness of the fearlessnesses, without making any distinction.

original: yaḥ pratisaṃvicchūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo mahāmaitrīśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ pratisaṃvid śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ mahā maitrī śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: “One who trains in the emptiness of the detailed and thorough knowledges, without making any distinction.🔽“One who trains in the emptiness of the great love, without making any distinction.

original: yo mahākaruṇāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ mahā karuṇā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: “One who trains in the emptiness of the great compassion, without making any distinction.

original: ya āveṇikabuddhadharmaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ āveṇika buddha dharma śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: “One who trains in the emptiness of the distinct attributes of a buddha, without making any distinction.

original: yaḥ sarvajñatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo mārgākārajñatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ sarvajña tā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ mārga ākāra jña tā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of omniscience without making a duality.🔽He who trains in the emptiness of the knowledge of path aspects without making a duality.

original: yaḥ sarvākārajñatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ sarva ākārajña tā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of the knowledge of all aspects without making a duality.

original: sa dānapāramitāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa dāna pāramitāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the perfection of giving without making a duality.

original: sa śīlapāramitāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa vīryapāramitāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa śīla pāramitāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa kṣānti pāramitāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa vīrya pāramitāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the perfection of morality without making a duality.🔽He trains in the perfection of patience without making a duality.🔽He trains in the perfection of effort without making a duality.

original: sa dhyānapāramitāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa dhyāna pāramitāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the perfection of concentration without making a duality.

original: sa prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽so 'dhyātmaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  saḥ dhyā ātma śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the perfection of wisdom without making a duality.🔽He trains in internal emptiness without making a duality.

original: sa bahirdhāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽so 'dhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa bahirdhā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  saḥ dhī ātma bahirdhā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in external emptiness without making a duality.🔽He trains in internal and external emptiness without making a duality.

original: sa śūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa śūnyatā aśūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of emptiness without making a duality.

original: sa mahāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa mahā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in great emptiness without making a duality.

original: sa paramārthaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa paramārtha śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in ultimate emptiness without making any distinction.

original: sa saṃskṛtaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽so 'saṃskṛtaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa saṃskṛta śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  saḥ saṃskṛta śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in conditioned emptiness without making any distinction.🔽He trains in unconditioned emptiness without making any distinction.

original: so 'tyantaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽so 'navarāgraśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽so 'navakāraśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sā u tyanta śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  saḥ navara agra śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  saḥ navakāra śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in absolute emptiness without making any distinction.🔽He trains in emptiness that is not terminated without making any distinction.🔽He trains in emptiness that is not originated without making any distinction.

original: sa prakṛtiśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa / sa 🔽sarvadharmaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa prakṛti śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa sa  sarva dharma śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of intrinsic nature without making any distinction.🔽He trains in the emptiness of all things without making any distinction.

original: sa svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽so 'nupalambhaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkareṇa /
analyzed: sa sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  saḥ n upalambha śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkareṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of specific characteristics without making any distinction.🔽He trains in the emptiness of non-apprehension without making any distinction.

original: so 'bhāvaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa svabhāvaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saḥ bhāva śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa svabhāva śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of non-existence without making any distinction.🔽He trains in the emptiness of essential nature without making any distinction.

original: so 'bhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saḥ bhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence without making any distinction.

original: sa smṛtyupasthānneṣu śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa smṛti upastha anneṣu śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the applications of mindfulness without making any distinction.

original: sa samyakprahāṇeṣu śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa ṛddhipādeṣu śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa samyakprahāṇeṣu śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  saḥ ṛddhipādeṣu śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the right efforts without making a duality.🔽He trains in the bases of spiritual power without making a duality.

original: sa indriyeṣu śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa baleṣu śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saḥ indriyeṣu śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa baleṣu śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the faculties without making a duality.🔽He trains in the powers without making a duality.

original: sa bodhyaṅgeṣu śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa bodhyaṅgeṣu śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the limbs of awakening without making a duality.

original: sa āryāṣṭāṅgamārge śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa āryasatyeṣu śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saḥ ārya aṣṭāṅga mārge śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  saḥ ārya satyeṣu śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the noble eightfold path without making a duality.🔽He trains in the noble truths without making a duality.

original: sa dhyāneṣu śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽so 'pramāṇeṣu śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa dhyāneṣu śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  saḥ pramāṇeṣu śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the meditative absorptions without making a duality.

original: sa ārūpyasamāpattiṣu śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saḥ ārūpya samāpattiṣu śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the formless [absorptions] without making a duality.

original: so 'ṣṭāsu vimokṣeṣu śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saḥ u tāsu vimokṣeṣu śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the eight liberations without making a duality.

original: so 'nupūrvavihārasamāpattiṣu śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saḥ nupūrva vihāra samāpattiṣu śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the nine sequential absorptions without making a duality.

original: sa śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukheṣu śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽so 'bhijñāsu śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa samādhiṣu śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukheṣu śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  saḥ bhijñāsu śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa samādhiṣu śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness doors of liberation without making a duality.🔽He trains in the [ten] powers without making a duality.

original: sa dhāraṇīmukheṣu śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa dhāraṇīmukheṣu śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the [four] fearlessnesses without making a duality.🔽He trains in the [four] detailed and thorough knowledges without making a duality.🔽He trains in the [eighteen] unique qualities of a buddha without making a duality.🔽He trains in the knowledge of all aspects without making a duality.

original: sa tathāgatabaleṣu śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa vaiśāradyeṣu śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa tathāgata baleṣu śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa vaiśāradyeṣu śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the powers of the Tathāgata without making a duality.🔽He trains in the fearlessnesses without making a duality.

original: sa pratisaṃvitsu śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa mahāmaitryāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa pratisaṃvitsu śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa mahāmaitryām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the detailed and thorough knowledges without making a duality.🔽He trains in the great love without making a duality.

original: sa mahākaruṇāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa mahā karuṇāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the great compassion without making a duality.

original: so 'ṣṭādaśāveṇikabuddhadharmeṣu śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa srotaāpattiphaleṣu śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saḥ ṣṭādaśa āveṇika buddha dharmeṣu śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa srotaāpatti phaleṣu śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha without making a duality.🔽He trains in the fruit of entering the stream without making a duality.

original: sa sakṛdāgāmiphaleṣu śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa sakṛdāgāmi phaleṣu śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth without making a duality.

original: so 'nāgāmiphaleṣu śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saḥ na āgāmi phaleṣu śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth without making a duality.

original: so 'rhattve śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽sa pratyekabodhau śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: saḥ ṛhat tve śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  sa pratyeka bodhau śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in arhatship without making a duality.🔽He trains in individual enlightenment without making a duality.

original: sa buddhatve śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa buddhatve śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in buddhahood without making a duality.

original: sa sarvajñatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa sarvajña tāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in omniscience without making a duality.

original: sa mārgākārajñatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa mārga ākāra jña tāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the knowledge of path aspects without making a duality.

original: sa sarvākārajñatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: sa sarva ākārajña tāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the knowledge of all aspects without making a duality.

original: yo dānapāramitāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ dāna pāramitāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He trains in the perfection of giving without making a duality.

original: yo dānapāramitāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ dāna pāramitāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the perfection of giving without making a duality.

original: yaḥ śīlapāramitāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yaḥ kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo vīryapāramitāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ śīla pāramitāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ kṣānti pāramitāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ vīrya pāramitāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the perfection of morality without making a duality.🔽He who trains in the perfection of patience without making a duality.🔽He who trains in the perfection of effort without making a duality.

original: yo dhyānapāramitāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ dhyāna pāramitāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the perfection of meditation without making a duality.

original: yaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo 'dhyātmaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ dhyātma śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the perfection of wisdom without making a duality.🔽He who trains in internal emptiness without making a duality.

original: yo bahirdhāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo 'dhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ bahirdhā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ dhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in external emptiness without making a duality.🔽He who trains in internal and external emptiness without making a duality.

original: yaḥ śūnyatāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo mahāśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ śūnyatā aśūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ mahāśūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of emptiness without making a duality.🔽He who trains in great emptiness without making a duality.

original: yaḥ paramārthaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yaḥ saṃskṛtaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ paramārtha śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ saṃskṛta śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of ultimate reality without making a duality.🔽He who trains in the emptiness of conditioned phenomena without making a duality.

original: yo 'saṃskṛtaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ saṃskṛta śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: He who trains in the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena without making a duality.

original: yo 'tyantaśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate
analyzed: tyanta śūnyatāyām śikṣate
translated: He who trains in absolute emptiness

original: 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: dvaidhīkāreṇa
translated: without making a duality.

original: yo 'navarāgraśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /🔽yo 'navakāraśūnyatāyāṃ śikṣate 'dvaidhīkāreṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ navara agra śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa  yaḥ navakāra śūnyatāyām śikṣate dvaidhīkāreṇa
