translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon contact.

original: na vedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na tṛṣṇāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na vedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na tṛṣṇāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon feeling.🔽He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon craving.

original: nopādānasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na upādānasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon grasping.

original: na bhavasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na bhavasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or to abandon becoming.

original: na jāteḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na jāteḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or to abandon birth.

original: na jarāmaraṇasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na jarā maraṇasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or to abandon old age and death.

original: na dānapāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na dāna pāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or to abandon the perfection of giving.

original: na śīlapāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na kṣāntipāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na śīla pāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na kṣānti pāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or to abandon the perfection of morality.🔽He does not train in order to acquire or to abandon the perfection of patience.

original: na vīryapāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na vīrya pāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or to abandon the perfection of perseverance.

original: na dhyānapāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na dhyāna pāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or to abandon the perfection of concentration.

original: na prajñāpāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽nādhyātmaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na bahirdhāśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na prajñāpāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na adhyātma śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or to abandon the perfection of wisdom.🔽He does not train in order to acquire or to abandon inner emptiness.🔽He does not train in order to acquire or to abandon outer emptiness.

original: nādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or to abandon inner and outer emptiness.

original: na śūnyatāśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na śūnyatā aśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon emptiness of emptiness.

original: na mahāśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate 🔽nāntardhānāya /🔽na paramārthaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na mahāśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate  na antardhānāya  na paramārtha śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon great emptiness.🔽He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon emptiness of ultimate reality.

original: na saṃskṛtaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na saṃskṛtaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽nātyantaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na saṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na saṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na atyanta śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon emptiness of conditioned phenomena.🔽He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon emptiness of unconditioned phenomena.

original: nānavarāgraśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽nānavakāraśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na an avara agra śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na anavakāra śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon emptiness of the endless and beginningless.🔽He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon emptiness of non-rejection.

original: na prakṛtiśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na prakṛti śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon emptiness of nature.

original: na sarvadharmaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhāriāya /🔽na svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na sarva dharma śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhāriāya  na sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon emptiness of all phenomena.🔽He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon emptiness of specific characteristics.

original: nānupalambhaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na anupalambha śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: nābhāvaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na svabhāvaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na abhāva śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to grasp or abandon the emptiness of non-existence.🔽He does not train in order to grasp or abandon the emptiness of own-nature.

original: nābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to grasp or abandon the emptiness of the own-nature of non-existence.

original: na smṛtyupasthānānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na smṛti upasthānānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to grasp or abandon the applications of mindfulness.

original: na samyakprahāṇānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽narddhipādānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽nendriyāṇāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na samyakprahāṇānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na ṛddhipādānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na indriyāṇām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to grasp or abandon the right efforts.🔽He does not train in order to grasp or abandon the bases of supernatural power.🔽He does not train in order to grasp or abandon the faculties.

original: na balānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na balānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to grasp or abandon the powers.

original: na bodhyaṅgānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na bodhyaṅgānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to grasp or abandon the limbs of enlightenment.

original: nāryāṣṭāṅgasya mārgasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽nāryasatyānnāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na dhyānānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhāṇāya /
analyzed: na āryā aṣṭāṅgasya mārgasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na ari asatyāt nām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na dhyānānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhāṇāya
translated: He does not train in order to grasp or abandon the noble eightfold path.🔽He does not train in order to grasp or abandon the noble truths.🔽He does not train in order to grasp or abandon the meditative absorptions.

original: nāpramāṇānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na a pramāṇānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to grasp or abandon the formless [absorptions].

original: na ārūpyasamāpattīnāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na ārūpya samāpattīnām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon the formless concentrations.

original: nāṣṭānāṃ vimokṣāṇāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na aṣṭānām vimokṣāṇām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon the eight liberations.

original: nānupūrvavihārasamāpattīnāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na anupūrva vihāra samāpattīnām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon the nine successive meditative absorptions.

original: na śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽nābhijñānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na samādhīnāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na abhijñānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na samādhīnām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness gateways to liberation.🔽He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon the [ten] powers.🔽He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon the [four] fearlessnesses.

original: na dhāraṇīmukhānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na tathāgatabalānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na vaiśāradyānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na pratisaṃvidānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na mahāmaitryāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na dhāraṇī mukhānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na tathāgata balānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na vaiśāradyānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na pratisaṃvidānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na mahāmaitryāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon the [four] detailed and thorough knowledges.🔽He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon the [great] love.

original: na mahākaruṇāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na mahā karuṇāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon the [great] compassion.

original: nāṣṭādaśānām āveṇikānāṃ buddhadharmāṇāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na aṣṭādaśānām āveṇikānām buddha dharmāṇām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: na srotaāpattiphalasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na sakṛdāgāmiphalasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na srotaāpatti phalasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na sakṛdāgāmi phalasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon the fruit of stream-entry.🔽He does not train in order to acquire or abandon the fruit of once-returning.

original: nānāgāmiphalasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: nānāgāmi phalasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon the fruit of non-returning.

original: nārhattvasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na arhat tvasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon arhatship.

original: na pratyekabodheḥ parigrahāya śikṣate 🔽nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na pratyeka bodheḥ parigrahāya śikṣate  na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon individual enlightenment.

original: na mārgākārajñatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na mārga ākāra jña tāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon the knowledge of paths and aspects.

original: na sarvākārajñatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon the knowledge of all aspects.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: evaṃ śikṣamāṇa āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na rūpasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na vedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: evam śikṣamāṇaḥ āyuṣman chāradvatī putra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na rūpasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na vedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains like this does not train in order to acquire or abandon form.🔽He does not train in order to acquire or abandon feeling.

original: na saṃjñāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na saṃjñāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon perception.

original: na saṃskārāṇāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na saṃskārāṇām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon the formative predispositions.

original: na vijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na vijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon consciousness.

original: na cakṣuṣaḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na śrotrasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na ghrāṇasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na cakṣuṣaḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na śrotrasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na ghrāṇasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon the eye.🔽He does not train in order to acquire or abandon the ear.🔽He does not train in order to acquire or abandon the nose.

original: na jihvāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na jihvāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon the tongue.

original: na kāyasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na kāyasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon the body.

original: na manasaḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na manasaḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon the mind.

original: na rūpasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na rūpasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon form.

original: na śabdasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na gandhasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na śabdasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na gandhasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon sound.🔽He does not train in order to acquire or abandon smell.

original: na rasasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na sparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na rasasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na sparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon taste.🔽He does not train in order to acquire or abandon the tangible.

original: na dharmāṇāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na dharmāṇām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon mental objects.

original: na cakṣurvijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na śrotravijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na ghrāṇavijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na cakṣuḥ vijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na śrotra vijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na ghrāṇa vijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon eye consciousness.🔽He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon ear consciousness.🔽He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon nose consciousness.

original: na jihvāvijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na jihvā vijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon tongue consciousness.

original: na kāyavijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na kāya vijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon body consciousness.

original: na manovijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na manaḥ vijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon mind consciousness.

original: na cakṣuḥsaṃsparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na śrotrasaṃsparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na ghrāṇasaṃsparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na cakṣuḥ saṃsparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na śrotra saṃsparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na ghrāṇa saṃsparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon eye contact.🔽He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon ear contact.🔽He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon nose contact.

original: na jihvāsaṃsparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na jihvā saṃsparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon tongue contact.

original: na kāyasaṃsparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na kāya saṃsparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon body contact.

original: na manaḥsaṃsparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na manaḥ saṃsparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon mind contact.

original: na cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject eye contact.🔽He does not train to adopt or reject ear contact.🔽He does not train to adopt or reject nose contact.

original: na jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject tongue contact.

original: na kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject body contact.

original: na manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāḥ parigrahāya sikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ parigrahāya sikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject mind contact.

original: na pṛthivīdhātoḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /🔽nābdhātoḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /🔽na tejodhātoḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /🔽na vāyudhātoḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: na pṛthivī dhātoḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya  na ap dhātoḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya  na tejaḥ dhātoḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya  na vāyu dhātoḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject the earth element.🔽He does not train to adopt or reject the water element.🔽He does not train to adopt or reject the fire element.

original: nākāśadhātoḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: na ākāśa dhātoḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject the wind element.🔽He does not train to adopt or reject the space element.

original: na vijñānadhātoḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: na vijñāna dhātoḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon the consciousness element.

original: nāvidyāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na avidyāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon ignorance.

original: na saṃskārāṇāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na saṃskārāṇām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon volitional formations.

original: na vijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: na vijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon consciousness.

original: na nāmarūpasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: na nāma rūpasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon name-and-form.

original: na ṣaḍāyatanasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: na ṣaṣ āyatanasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon the six sense bases.

original: na sparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: na sparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon contact.

original: na vedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na vedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon feeling.

original: na tṛṣṇāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /🔽nopādānasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: na tṛṣṇāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya  na upādānasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon craving.🔽He does not train in order to acquire or abandon grasping.

original: na bhavasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /🔽na jāteḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: na bhavasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya  na jāteḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon becoming.🔽He does not train in order to acquire or abandon birth.

original: na jarāmaraṇasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na jarā maraṇasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon old age and death.

original: na dānapāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: na dāna pāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: He does not train in order to acquire or abandon the perfection of giving.

original: na śīlapāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na kṣāntipāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: na śīla pāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na kṣānti pāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject the perfection of morality.🔽He does not train to adopt or reject the perfection of patience.

original: na vīryapāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: na vīrya pāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject the perfection of effort.

original: na dhyānapāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: na dhyāna pāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject the perfection of concentration.

original: na prajñāpāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /🔽nādhyātmaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: na prajñāpāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya  na adhyātma śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject the perfection of wisdom.🔽He does not train to adopt or reject inner emptiness.

original: na bahirdhāśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽nādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: na bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject outer emptiness.🔽He does not train to adopt or reject inner and outer emptiness.

original: na śūnyatāśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: na śūnyatā aśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject the emptiness of emptiness.

original: na mahāśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /🔽na paramārthaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na mahāśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya  na paramārtha śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject great emptiness.🔽He does not train to adopt or reject ultimate emptiness.

original: na saṃskṛtaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: na saṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject conditioned emptiness.

original: nāsaṃskṛtaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /🔽nātyantaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: na asaṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya  na atyanta śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject the emptiness of the unconditioned.🔽He does not train to adopt or reject the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: nānavarāgraśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /🔽nānavakāraśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: na an avara agra śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya  na anavakāra śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject the emptiness of the unlimited.🔽He does not train to adopt or reject the emptiness of the primordial.

original: na prakṛtiśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na prakṛti śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject the emptiness of nature.

original: na sarvadharmaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: na sarva dharma śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: na svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /🔽nānupalambhaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: na sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya  na anupalambha śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject the emptiness of specific characteristics.🔽He does not train to adopt or reject the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: nābhāvaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na svabhāvaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na abhāva śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject the emptiness of non-existence.🔽He does not train to adopt or reject the emptiness of own-nature.

original: nābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate 🔽nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate  na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject the emptiness of the non-existence of own-nature.

original: na smṛtyupasthānānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na smṛti upasthānānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject the applications of mindfulness.

original: na samyakprahāṇānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽narddhipādānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽nendriyāṇāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na samyakprahāṇānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na ṛddhipādānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na indriyāṇām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject the right efforts.🔽He does not train to adopt or reject the bases of spiritual power.🔽He does not train to adopt or reject the faculties.

original: na balānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na balānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject the powers.

original: na bodhyaṅgānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na bodhyaṅgānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject the limbs of awakening.

original: nāryāṣṭāṅgasya mārgasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na āryā aṣṭāṅgasya mārgasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject the noble eightfold path.

original: nāryasatyāṃnāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na ari asatyāṃnām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject the noble truths.

original: na dhyānānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽nāpramāṇānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na dhyānānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na a pramāṇānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject the meditative absorptions.🔽He does not train to adopt or reject the formless concentrations.

original: nārūpyasamāpattīnāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na ārūpya samāpattīnām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject the attainments.

original: nāṣṭānāṃ vimokṣāṇāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na aṣṭānām vimokṣāṇām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject the eight deliverances.

original: nānupūrvavihārasamāpattīnāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na anupūrva vihāra samāpattīnām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train to adopt or reject the successive attainments.

original: na śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon the emptiness, signless, and wishless gateways to liberation.

original: nābhijñānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na samādhīnāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na abhijñānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na samādhīnām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon the superknowledges.🔽He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon the concentrations.

original: na dhāraṇīmukhānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na dhāraṇī mukhānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: na tathāgatabalānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na vaiśāradyānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na tathāgata balānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na vaiśāradyānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon the powers of the Tathāgata.🔽He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon the fearlessnesses.

original: na pratisaṃvidānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na mahāmaitryāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na pratisaṃvidānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na mahāmaitryāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon the detailed and thorough knowledges.🔽He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon great loving kindness.

original: na mahākaruṇāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na mahā karuṇāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon great compassion.

original: nāṣṭādaśānām āveṇikānāṃ buddhadharmāṇāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽na srotaāpattiphalasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na aṣṭādaśānām āveṇikānām buddha dharmāṇām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  na srotaāpatti phalasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon the fruit of entering the stream.

original: na sakṛdāgāmiphalasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na sakṛdāgāmi phalasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train in order to appropriate or abandon the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth.

original: nānāgāmiphalasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: nānāgāmi phalasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train to grasp or disappear the fruit of non-returner.

original: nārhattvasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na arhat tvasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train to grasp or disappear arhatship.

original: na pratyekabodheḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na pratyeka bodheḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train to grasp or disappear individual enlightenment.

original: na mārgākārajñatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na mārga ākāra jña tāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train to grasp or disappear the knowledge of the aspects of the path.

original: na sarvākārajñatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He does not train to grasp or disappear the knowledge of all aspects.

original: āha / kiṃkāraṇam āyuṣman subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na rūpasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ na vedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ na saṃjñāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: āha kiṃkāraṇam āyuṣman subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na rūpasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na vedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na saṃjñāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: He said: Why, Venerable Subhuti, does the bodhisattva mahasattva not train to grasp or disappear form?🔽Why does he not train to grasp or disappear feeling?🔽Why does he not train to grasp or disappear perception?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na saṃskārānaṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train to grasp or disappear volitional formations?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na vijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na vijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train to grasp or disappear consciousness?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na cakṣuṣaḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na cakṣuṣaḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train to grasp or disappear the eye?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na śrotrasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ na ghrāṇasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na śrotrasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na ghrāṇasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or abandon the ear?🔽Why does he not train in order to appropriate or abandon the nose?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na jihvāyāḥ 🔽parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na jihvāyāḥ  parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or abandon the tongue?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na kāyasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na kāyasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or abandon the body?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na manasaḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na manasaḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or abandon the mind?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na rūpasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na rūpasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or abandon forms?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na śabdasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ na gandhasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ na rasasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na śabdasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na gandhasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na rasasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or abandon sounds?🔽Why does he not train in order to appropriate or abandon smells?🔽Why does he not train in order to appropriate or abandon tastes?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na sparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na sparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or abandon touches?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na dharmāṇāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na dharmāṇām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or abandon dharmas?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na cakṣurvijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ na śrotravijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ na ghrāṇavijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na cakṣuḥ vijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na śrotra vijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na ghrāṇa vijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or abandon eye consciousness?🔽Why does he not train in order to appropriate or abandon ear consciousness?🔽Why does he not train in order to appropriate or abandon nose consciousness?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na jihvāvijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na jihvā vijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or abandon tongue consciousness?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na kāyavijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na kāya vijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or abandon body consciousness?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na manovijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na manaḥ vijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or abandon mind consciousness?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na cakṣuḥsaṃsparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ na śrotrasaṃsparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ na ghrāṇasaṃsparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na cakṣuḥ saṃsparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na śrotra saṃsparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na ghrāṇa saṃsparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or abandon eye contact?🔽Why does he not train in order to appropriate or abandon ear contact?🔽Why does he not train in order to appropriate or abandon nose contact?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na jihvāsaṃsparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na jihvā saṃsparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or abandon tongue contact?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na kāyasaṃsparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na kāya saṃsparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train to acquire or to make an end of body contact?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na manaḥsaṃsparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na manaḥ saṃsparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train to acquire or to make an end of mind contact?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ na śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ na ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train to acquire or to make an end of the feeling that arises from eye contact?🔽Why does he not train to acquire or to make an end of the feeling that arises from ear contact?🔽Why does he not train to acquire or to make an end of the feeling that arises from nose contact?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ na kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train to acquire or to make an end of the feeling that arises from tongue contact?🔽Why does he not train to acquire or to make an end of the feeling that arises from body contact?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train to acquire or to make an end of the feeling that arises from mind contact?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na pṛthivīdhātoḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na pṛthivī dhātoḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train to acquire or to make an end of the earth element?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ nābdhātoḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ na tejodhātoḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na ap dhātoḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na tejaḥ dhātoḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to disappear the water element?🔽Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to disappear the fire element?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na vāyudhātoḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ nākāśadhātoḥ parigrahāya
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na vāyu dhātoḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na ākāśa dhātoḥ parigrahāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to disappear the wind element?

original: śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ na vijñānadhātoḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na vijñāna dhātoḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to disappear the space element?🔽Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to disappear the consciousness element?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ nāvidyāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na avidyāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to disappear ignorance?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na saṃskārāṇāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na saṃskārāṇām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to disappear volitional actions?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na vijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na vijñānasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to disappear consciousness?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na nāmarūpasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na nāma rūpasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to disappear name-and-form?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na ṣaḍāyatanasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na ṣaṣ āyatanasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to disappear the six sense bases?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na sparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na sparśasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to disappear contact?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na vedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ na tṛṣṇāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ nopādānasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na vedanāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya  kiṃkāraṇam na tṛṣṇāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya  kiṃkāraṇam na upādānasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to abandon feeling?🔽Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to abandon craving?🔽Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to abandon grasping?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na bhavasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ na jāteḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na bhavasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya  kiṃkāraṇam na jāteḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to abandon becoming?🔽Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to abandon birth?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na jarāmaraṇasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na jarā maraṇasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to abandon old age and death?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na dānapāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na dāna pāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to abandon the perfection of giving?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na śīlapāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ na kṣāntipāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na śīla pāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na kṣānti pāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to abandon the perfection of morality?🔽Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to abandon the perfection of patience?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na vīryapāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na vīrya pāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to abandon the perfection of perseverance?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na dhyānapāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na dhyāna pāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to abandon the perfection of concentration?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na prajñāpāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ nādhyātmaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na prajñāpāramitāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya  kiṃkāraṇam na adhyātma śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to make disappear the perfection of wisdom?🔽Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to make disappear inner emptiness?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na bahirdhāśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ nādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya  kiṃkāraṇam na adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to make disappear outer emptiness?🔽Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to make disappear inner and outer emptiness?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na śūnyatāśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ na mahāśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na śūnyatā aśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya  kiṃkāraṇam na mahāśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to make disappear the emptiness of emptiness?🔽Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to make disappear great emptiness?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na paramārthaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ na saṃskṛtaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ nāsaṃskṛtaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na paramārtha śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya  kiṃkāraṇam na saṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya  kiṃkāraṇam na asaṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to make disappear the emptiness of ultimate reality?🔽Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to make disappear the emptiness of conditioned phenomena?🔽Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to make disappear the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ nātyantaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na atyanta śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to make disappear absolute emptiness?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ nānavarāgraśūnyatāyaḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ nānavakāraśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya  kiṃkāraṇam na anavakāra śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to make disappear the emptiness of what is not present?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na prakṛtiśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na prakṛti śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to make disappear the emptiness of essential nature?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na sarvadharmaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhanāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na sarva dharma śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhanāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to make disappear the emptiness of all things?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate 🔽nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ nānupalambhaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate  na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na anupalambha śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to make disappear the emptiness of own-characteristics?🔽Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to make disappear the emptiness of non-apprehension?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ nābhāvaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ na svabhāvaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na abhāva śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to make disappear the emptiness of non-existence?🔽Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to make disappear the emptiness of own-nature?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ nābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to make disappear the emptiness of the non-existence of own-nature?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na smṛtyupasthānānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na smṛti upasthānānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to make disappear the applications of mindfulness?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na samyakprahāṇānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ narddhipādānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ nendriyāṇāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na samyakprahāṇānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na ṛddhipādānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na indriyāṇām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train to appropriate or to disintegrate the right efforts?🔽Why does he not train to appropriate or to disintegrate the bases of spiritual power?🔽Why does he not train to appropriate or to disintegrate the faculties?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na balānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na balānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train to appropriate or to disintegrate the powers?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na bodhyaṅgānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na bodhyaṅgānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train to appropriate or to disintegrate the limbs of awakening?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ nāryāṣṭāṅgasya mārgasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ nāryasatyānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na ārya aṣṭāṅgasya mārgasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na ārya satyānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train to appropriate or to disintegrate the noble eightfold path?🔽Why does he not train to appropriate or to disintegrate the noble truths?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na dhyānānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ nāpramāṇānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na dhyānānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na apramāṇānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train to appropriate or to disintegrate the meditative absorptions?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ nārūpyasamāpattīnāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na ārūpya samāpattīnām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train to appropriate or to disintegrate the formless concentrations?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ nāṣṭānāṃ vimokṣāṇāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na aṣṭānām vimokṣāṇām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train to appropriate or to disintegrate the eight deliverances?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ nānupūrvavihārasamāpattīnāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na anupūrva vihāra samāpattīnām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train to appropriate or to disintegrate the meditative stabilizations?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ nābhijñānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na abhijñānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train to appropriate or to disintegrate the emptiness, signless, and wishless gateways to liberation?🔽Why does he not train to appropriate or to disintegrate the clairvoyances?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na samādhīnāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na samādhīnām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train to appropriate or to disintegrate the meditative stabilities?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na dhāraṇīmukhānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na dhāraṇī mukhānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train to appropriate or to disintegrate the dhāraṇī gateways?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na tathāgatabalānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ na vaiśāradyānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na tathāgata balānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na vaiśāradyānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train to appropriate or to disintegrate the powers of the Tathāgata?🔽Why does he not train to appropriate or to disintegrate the fearlessnesses?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na pratisaṃvidānāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhāṇāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ na mahāmaitryāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na pratisaṃvidānām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhāṇāya  kiṃkāraṇam na mahāmaitryāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train to appropriate or to disintegrate the detailed and thorough knowledges?🔽Why does he not train to appropriate or to disintegrate great loving kindness?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na mahākaruṇāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na mahā karuṇāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train to appropriate or to disintegrate great compassion?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ nāṣṭādaśānām āveṇikānāṃ buddhadharmāṇāṃ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ na srotaāpattiphalasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na aṣṭādaśānām āveṇikānām buddha dharmāṇām parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam na srotaāpatti phalasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to disavow the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha?🔽Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to disavow the fruit of entering the stream?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na sakṛdāgāmiphalasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /🔽kiṃkāraṇaṃ nanāgāmiphalasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na sakṛdāgāmi phalasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya  kiṃkāraṇam nanāgāmi phalasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to disavow the fruit of the once-returner?🔽Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to disavow the fruit of the non-returner?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ nārhattvasya parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na arhat tvasya parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to disavow the fruit of arhatship?

original: na pratyekabodheḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: na pratyeka bodheḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to disavow individual enlightenment?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na mārgākārajñatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na mārga ākāra jña tāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to disavow the knowledge of paths?

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ na sarvākārajñatāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate nāntardhānāya /
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam na sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ parigrahāya śikṣate na antardhānāya
translated: Why does he not train in order to appropriate or to disavow the knowledge of all aspects?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: tathā hy āyuṣmañ chāradvatīputra rūpasya parigraho nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi āyuṣmam chāradvatī putra rūpasya parigrahaḥ na asti
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, it is because form is not appropriated.

original: na hi rūpaṃ rūpaṃ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: na hi rūpam rūpam parigṛhṇāti
translated: Form does not appropriate form.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya
translated: Because of the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, and the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena.

original: tathā hi vedanāyāḥ parigraho nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi vedanāyāḥ parigrahaḥ na asti
translated: Because there is no appropriation of feeling.

original: na hi vedanā vedanāṃ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: na hi vedanā vedanām parigṛhṇāti
translated: For feeling does not appropriate feeling.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya
translated: From the point of view of the emptiness of the inner and the outer.

original: tathā hi saṃjñāyāḥ parigraho nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi saṃjñāyāḥ parigrahaḥ na asti
translated: Because there is no appropriation of perception.

original: na hi saṃjñā saṃjñāṃ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: na hi saṃjñā saṃjñām parigṛhṇāti
translated: For perception does not appropriate perception.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /

translated: From the point of view of the emptiness of the inner and the outer.

original: tathā hi saṃskārāṇāṃ parigraho nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi saṃskārāṇām parigrahaḥ na asti

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /

translated: For consciousness does not appropriate consciousness.

original: nāsti / na hy anupalambhaśūnyatānupalambhaśūnyatāṃ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: na asti na hi anupalambha śūnyatā anupalambha śūnyatām parigṛhṇāti
translated: The emptiness of non-apprehension does not grasp the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya
translated: Because of the emptiness of internal and external.

original: tathā hy abhāvaśūnyatāyāḥ parigraho nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi abhāva śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahaḥ na asti
translated: For thus there is no grasping of the emptiness of non-existence.

original: na hy abhāvaśūnyatābhāvaśūnyatāṃ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: na hi abhāva śūnyatā abhāva śūnyatām parigṛhṇāti
translated: The emptiness of non-existence does not grasp the emptiness of non-existence.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya
translated: Because of the emptiness of internal and external.

original: tathā hi svabhāvaśūnyatāyāḥ parigraho nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahaḥ na asti
translated: For thus there is no grasping of the emptiness of own-nature.

original: na hi svabhāvaśūnyatā svabhāvaśūnyatāṃ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: na hi svabhāva śūnyatā svabhāva śūnyatām parigṛhṇāti
translated: The emptiness of own-nature does not grasp the emptiness of own-nature.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya
translated: Because of the emptiness of internal and external.

original: tathā hy abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyāḥ parigraho nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ parigrahaḥ na asti
translated: For thus there is no grasping of the emptiness of the own-nature of non-existence.

original: na hy abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāṃ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: na hi abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā abhāva svabhāva śūnyatām parigṛhṇāti
translated: The emptiness of the own-nature of non-existence does not grasp the emptiness of the own-nature of non-existence.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /🔽tathā hi smṛtyupasthānānāṃ parigraho nāsti /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya  tathā hi smṛti upasthānānām parigrahaḥ na asti
translated: Because of the emptiness of internal and external.🔽For thus there is no grasping of the applications of mindfulness.

original: na hi smṛtyupasthānāni smṛtyupasthānāni parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: na hi smṛti upasthānāni smṛti upasthānāni parigṛhṇāti
translated: The applications of mindfulness do not grasp the applications of mindfulness.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /🔽tathā hi samyakprahāṇānāṃ parigraho nāsti /🔽na hi samyakprahāṇāni samyakprahāṇāni parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya  tathā hi samyakprahāṇānām parigrahaḥ na asti  na hi samyakprahāṇāni samyakprahāṇāni parigṛhṇāti
translated: Because of the emptiness of the inner and outer.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /🔽tathā hy ṛddhipādānāṃ parigraho nāsti /🔽na hy ṛddhipādā ṛddhipādān parigṛhṇāti /🔽adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya  tathā hi ṛddhipādānām parigrahaḥ na asti  na hi ṛddhipādāḥ ṛddhipādān parigṛhṇāti  adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya
translated: Because of the emptiness of the inner and outer, the right efforts are not apprehended.

original: tathā hīndriyāṇāṃ parigraho nāsti /🔽na hīndriyāṇīndriyāṇi parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: tathā hi indriyāṇām parigrahaḥ na asti  na hi indriyāṇi indriyāṇi parigṛhṇāti
translated: Because of the emptiness of the inner and outer, the legs of miraculous power are not apprehended.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /🔽tathā hi balānāṃ parigraho nāsti /🔽na hi balāni balāni parigṛhṇāti /🔽adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /🔽tathā hi bodhyaṅgānāṃ parigraho nāsti /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya  tathā hi balānām parigrahaḥ na asti  na hi balāni balāni parigṛhṇāti  adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya  tathā hi bodhyaṅgānām parigrahaḥ na asti
translated: Because of the emptiness of the inner and outer, the faculties are not apprehended.🔽Because of the emptiness of the inner and outer, the powers are not apprehended.

original: na hi bodhyaṅgāni bodhyaṅgāni parigṛhṇāti /🔽adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: na hi bodhyaṅgāni bodhyaṅgāni parigṛhṇāti  adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya
translated: Because of the emptiness of the inner and outer, the limbs of awakening are not apprehended.

original: tathā hy āryāṣṭāṅgasya mārgasya parigraho nāsti /🔽na hi mārgo mārgaṃ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: tathā hi ārya aṣṭāṅgasya mārgasya parigrahaḥ na asti 🔽na hi mārgaḥ mārgam parigṛhṇāti
translated: Because of the emptiness of the inner and outer, the noble eightfold path is not apprehended.🔽Because of the emptiness of the inner and outer, the fruits of monastic practice are not apprehended.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya
translated: Because of the emptiness of the inner and the emptiness of the outer.

original: tathā hy āryasatyānāṃ parigraho nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi ārya satyānām parigrahaḥ na asti
translated: For in this way there is no appropriation of the noble truths.

original: na hy āryasatyāny āryasatyāni parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: na hi ārya satyāni ārya satyāni parigṛhṇāti
translated: For the noble truths do not appropriate the noble truths.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya
translated: Because of the emptiness of the inner and the emptiness of the outer.

original: tathā hi dhyānānāṃ parigraho nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi dhyānānām parigrahaḥ na asti
translated: For in this way there is no appropriation of the concentrations.

original: na hi dhyānāni dhyānāni parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: na hi dhyānāni dhyānāni parigṛhṇāti
translated: For the concentrations do not appropriate the concentrations.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya
translated: Because of the emptiness of the inner and the emptiness of the outer.

original: tathā hy apramāṇānāṃ parigraho nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi apramāṇānām parigrahaḥ na asti
translated: For in this way there is no appropriation of the immeasurables.

original: na hy apramāṇāny apramāṇāni parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: na hi apramāṇāni apramāṇāni parigṛhṇāti
translated: For the immeasurables do not appropriate the immeasurables.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya
translated: Because of the emptiness of the inner and the emptiness of the outer.

original: tathā hy ārūpyasamāpattīnāṃ parigraho nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi ārūpya samāpattīnām parigrahaḥ na asti
translated: For in this way there is no appropriation of the formless absorptions.

original: na hy ārūpyasamāpattaya ārūpyasamāpattīḥ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: na hi ārūpya samāpattaye ārūpya samāpattīḥ parigṛhṇāti
translated: For the formless absorptions do not appropriate the formless absorptions.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya
translated: Because of the emptiness of the inner and the emptiness of the outer.

original: tathā hi vimokṣāṇāṃ parigraho nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi vimokṣāṇām parigrahaḥ na asti
translated: For in this way there is no appropriation of the liberations.

original: na hi vimokṣā vimokṣāṃ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: na hi vimokṣā vimokṣām parigṛhṇāti
translated: For the liberations do not appropriate the liberations.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya
translated: Because of the emptiness of the inner and the emptiness of the outer.

original: tathā hy anupūrvavihārasamāpattīnāṃ parigraho nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi anupūrva vihāra samāpattīnām parigrahaḥ na asti
translated: For in this way there is no appropriation of the successive absorptions.

original: na hy anupūrvavihārasamāpattaya anupūrvavihārasamāpattīḥ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: na hi anupūrva vihāra samāpattaye anupūrva vihāra samāpattīḥ parigṛhṇāti
translated: For the meditative absorption of the successive spheres does not appropriate the meditative absorption of the successive spheres.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya
translated: Because of external emptiness, etc.

original: tathā hi śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhānāṃ parigraho nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhānām parigrahaḥ na asti
translated: For there is no appropriation of the doors of liberation that are emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: na hi śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhāni śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhāni parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: na hi śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhāni śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhāni parigṛhṇāti
translated: For the doors of liberation that are emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness do not appropriate the doors of liberation that are emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /🔽tathā hy abhijñānāṃ parigraho nāsti / na hy
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya  tathā hi abhijñānām parigrahaḥ na asti na hi
translated: Because of external emptiness, etc.🔽For there is no appropriation of the superknowledges.

original: abhijñā abhijñāḥ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: abhijñāḥ abhijñāḥ parigṛhṇāti
translated: For the superknowledges do not appropriate the superknowledges.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya
translated: Because of external emptiness, etc.

original: tathā hi samādhīnāṃ parigraho nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi samādhīnām parigrahaḥ na asti
translated: For there is no appropriation of the meditative stabilizations.

original: na hi samādhayaḥ samādhīn parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: na hi samādhayaḥ samādhīn parigṛhṇāti
translated: For the meditative stabilizations do not appropriate the meditative stabilizations.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya
translated: Because of external emptiness, etc.

original: tathā hi dhāraṇīmukhānāṃ parigraho nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi dhāraṇī mukhānām parigrahaḥ na asti
translated: For there is no appropriation of the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: na hi dhāraṇīmukhāni dhāraṇīmukhāni parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: na hi dhāraṇīmukhāni dhāraṇīmukhāni parigṛhṇāti
translated: For the dhāraṇī gateways do not appropriate the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya
translated: Because of external emptiness, etc.

original: tathā hi tathāgatabalānāṃ parigraho nāsti /
analyzed: tathā hi tathāgata balānām parigrahaḥ na asti
translated: For there is no appropriation of the powers of the Tathāgata.

original: na hi tathāgatabalāni tathāgatabalāni parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: na hi tathāgata balāni tathāgata balāni parigṛhṇāti
translated: For the powers of a tathāgata do not appropriate the powers of a tathāgata.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /🔽tathā hi vaiśāradyānāṃ parigraho nāsti /🔽na hi vaiśāradyāni vaiśāradyāni parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya  tathā hi vaiśāradyānām parigrahaḥ na asti  na hi vaiśāradyāni vaiśāradyāni parigṛhṇāti
translated: Because of the emptiness of the internal, the emptiness of the external, and the emptiness of the internal and the external.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /🔽tathā hi pratisaṃvidāṃ parigraho nāsti /🔽na hi pratisaṃvidaḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya  tathā hi pratisaṃvidām parigrahaḥ na asti  na hi pratisaṃvidaḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ parigṛhṇāti
translated: Because of the emptiness of the external, the emptiness of the internal, and the emptiness of the internal and the external.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /🔽tathā hi mahāmaitryāṃ parigraho nāsti /🔽na hi mahāmaitrī mahāmaitrīṃ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya  tathā hi mahāmaitryām parigrahaḥ na asti  na hi mahā maitrī mahā maitrīm parigṛhṇāti
translated: Because of the emptiness of the external, the emptiness of the internal, and the emptiness of the internal and the external.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /🔽tathā hi mahākaruṇāyāḥ parigraho nāsti /🔽na hi mahākaruṇā mahākaruṇāṃ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya  tathā hi mahā karuṇāyāḥ parigrahaḥ na asti  na hi mahā karuṇā mahā karuṇām parigṛhṇāti
translated: Because of the emptiness of the external, the emptiness of the internal, and the emptiness of the internal and the external.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatām upādāya /🔽tathā hy āveṇikabuddhadharmāṇāṃ parigraho nāsti /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām upādāya  tathā hi āveṇika buddha dharmāṇām parigrahaḥ na asti
translated: Because of the emptiness of the external, the emptiness of the internal, and the emptiness of the internal and the external.
