analyzed: yaḥ kauśika tathāgataḥ sa na mahā karuṇā tathatāyām saṃyuktaḥ na visaṃyuktaḥ
translated: Kauśika, the Tathāgata is not connected with or disconnected from the suchness of great compassion;

original: na mahākaruṇādharmatāyāṃ saṃyukto na visaṃyuktaḥ /🔽nānyatra mahākaruṇātathatāyāḥ saṃyukto na visaṃyuktaḥ /
analyzed: na mahā karuṇā dharmatāyām saṃyuktaḥ na visaṃyuktaḥ  na anyatra mahā karuṇā tathatāyāḥ saṃyuktaḥ na visaṃyuktaḥ
translated: he is not connected with or disconnected from the nature of great compassion;🔽he is not connected with or disconnected from anything other than the suchness of great compassion;

original: nānyatra mahākaruṇādharmatāyāḥ saṃyukto na visaṃyuktaḥ /
analyzed: na anyatra mahā karuṇā dharmatāyāḥ saṃyuktaḥ na visaṃyuktaḥ
translated: he is not connected with or disconnected from anything other than the nature of great compassion.

original: yaḥ kauśika tathāgataḥ sa nāveṇikabuddhadharmatathatāyāṃ saṃyukto na visaṃyuktaḥ /🔽nāveṇikabuddhadharmadharmatāyāṃ saṃyukto na visaṃyuktaḥ /🔽nānyatrāveṇikabuddhadharmatathatāyāḥ saṃyukto na visaṃyuktaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ kauśika tathāgataḥ sa na āveṇika buddha dharma tathatāyām saṃyuktaḥ na visaṃyuktaḥ  na āveṇika buddha dharma dharmatāyām saṃyuktaḥ na visaṃyuktaḥ  na anyatra āveṇika buddha dharma tathatāyāḥ saṃyuktaḥ na visaṃyuktaḥ
translated: Kauśika, the Tathāgata is not connected with or disconnected from the suchness of the unique qualities of a Buddha;🔽he is not connected with or disconnected from the nature of the unique qualities of a Buddha;🔽he is not connected with or disconnected from anything other than the suchness of the unique qualities of a Buddha;

original: nānyatrāveṇikabuddhadharmadharmatāyāḥ saṃyukto na visaṃyuktaḥ /
analyzed: na anyatra āveṇika buddha dharma dharmatāyāḥ saṃyuktaḥ na visaṃyuktaḥ
translated: he is not connected with or disconnected from anything other than the nature of the unique qualities of a Buddha.

original: yaḥ kauśika tathāgataḥ sa na sarvajñatātathatāyāṃ saṃyukto na visaṃyuktaḥ /🔽na sarvajñatādharmatāyāṃ saṃyukto na visaṃyuktaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ kauśika tathāgataḥ sa na sarvajña tā tathatāyām saṃyuktaḥ na visaṃyuktaḥ  na sarvajña tā dharmatāyām saṃyuktaḥ na visaṃyuktaḥ
translated: Kauśika, the Tathāgata is not connected with or disconnected from the suchness of omniscience;🔽he is not connected with or disconnected from the nature of omniscience;🔽he is not connected with or disconnected from anything other than the suchness of omniscience;

original: nānyatra sarvajñatātathatāyāḥ saṃyukto na visaṃyuktaḥ /
analyzed: na anyatra sarvajña tā tathatāyāḥ saṃyuktaḥ na visaṃyuktaḥ
translated: he is not connected with or disconnected from anything other than the nature of omniscience.

original: nānyatra sarvajñatādharmatāyāḥ saṃyukto na visaṃyuktaḥ /
analyzed: na anyatra sarvajña tā dharmatāyāḥ saṃyuktaḥ na visaṃyuktaḥ
translated: He is neither conjoined nor disjoined from anything other than the real nature of omniscience.

original: yaḥ kauśika tathāgataḥ sa na mārgākārajñatātathatāyāṃ saṃyukto na visaṃyuktaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ kauśika tathāgataḥ sa na mārga ākāra jña tā tathatāyām saṃyuktaḥ na visaṃyuktaḥ
translated: Kauśika, the Tathāgata is neither conjoined nor disjoined from the suchness of the knowledge of paths.

original: na mārgākārajñatādharmatāyāṃ saṃyukto na visaṃyuktaḥ /🔽nānyatra mārgākārajñatātathatāyāḥ saṃyukto na visaṃyuktaḥ /
analyzed: na mārga ākāra jña tā dharmatāyām saṃyuktaḥ na visaṃyuktaḥ  na anyatra mārga ākāra jña tā tathatāyāḥ saṃyuktaḥ na visaṃyuktaḥ
translated: He is neither conjoined nor disjoined from the real nature of the knowledge of paths.🔽He is neither conjoined nor disjoined from anything other than the suchness of the knowledge of paths.

original: nānyatra mārgākārajñatādharmatāyāḥ saṃyukto na visaṃyuktaḥ /🔽yaḥ kauśika tathāgataḥ sa na sarvākārajñatātathatāyāṃ
analyzed: na anyatra mārga ākāra jña tā dharmatāyāḥ saṃyuktaḥ na visaṃyuktaḥ  yaḥ kauśika tathāgataḥ sa na sarva ākāra jña tā tathatāyām
translated: He is neither conjoined nor disjoined from anything other than the real nature of the knowledge of paths.

original: saṃyukto na visaṃyuktaḥ /🔽na sarvākārajñatādharmatāyāṃ saṃyukto na visaṃyuktaḥ /🔽nānyatra sarvākārajñatātathatāyāḥ saṃyukto na visaṃyuktaḥ /
analyzed: saṃyuktaḥ na visaṃyuktaḥ  na sarva ākārajña tā dharmatāyām saṃyuktaḥ na visaṃyuktaḥ  na anyatra sarva ākārajña tā tathatāyāḥ saṃyuktaḥ na visaṃyuktaḥ
translated: Kauśika, the Tathāgata is neither conjoined nor disjoined from the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.🔽He is neither conjoined nor disjoined from the real nature of the knowledge of all aspects.🔽He is neither conjoined nor disjoined from anything other than the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: nānyatra sarvākārajñatādharmatāyāḥ saṃyukto na visaṃyuktaḥ /
analyzed: na anyatra sarva ākārajña tā dharmatāyāḥ saṃyuktaḥ na visaṃyuktaḥ
translated: He is neither conjoined nor disjoined from anything other than the real nature of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: yaḥ kauśika tathāgata ebhiḥ sarvadharmair na saṃyukto na visaṃyuktaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ kauśika tathāgataḥ ebhiḥ sarva dharmaiḥ na saṃyuktaḥ na visaṃyuktaḥ
translated: Kauśika, the Tathāgata, who is not conjoined with or disjoined from all these dharmas,

original: tasyaiṣo 'nubhāvas tasyaitad adhiṣṭhānam anadhiṣṭhānayogena /
analyzed: tasya eṣaḥ nubhāvaḥ tasya etat adhiṣṭhānam an adhiṣṭhāna yogena
translated: has this power, this might, by way of the yoga of non-establishment.

original: yat punaḥ kauśikaivaṃ vadasi /
analyzed: yat punar kauśika evam vadasi
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, when you say,

original: kuto bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā gaveṣitavyeti /
analyzed: kutas bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā gaveṣitavyā iti
translated: From where should the bodhisattva mahāsattva seek the perfection of wisdom?

original: na kauśika rūpato gaveṣitavyā nānyatra rūpato gaveṣitavyā /🔽na vedanāto gaveṣitavyā nānyatra vedanāto gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na kauśika rūpataḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra rūpataḥ gaveṣitavyā  na vedanātaḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra vedanātaḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: Kauśika, it should not be sought as form, nor should it be sought apart from form.🔽It should not be sought as feeling, nor should it be sought apart from feeling.

original: na saṃjñāto gaveṣitavyā nānyatra saṃjñāto gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na saṃjñātaḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra saṃjñātaḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: It should not be sought as perception, nor should it be sought apart from perception.

original: na saṃskārebhyo gaveṣitavyā nānyatra saṃskārebhyo gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na saṃskārebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra saṃskārebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: It should not be sought as volitional formations, nor should it be sought apart from volitional formations.

original: na vijñānato gaveṣitavyā nānyatra vijñānato gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na vijñānataḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra vijñānataḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: It should not be sought as consciousness, nor should it be sought apart from consciousness. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yac ca rūpaṃ yā ca vedanā yā ca saṃjñā ye ca saṃskārā yac ca vijñānaṃ /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yat ca rūpam yā ca vedanā yā ca saṃjñā ye ca saṃskārāḥ yat ca vijñānam
translated: Because, Kauśika, form, feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness,

original: yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca mahākaruṇā yā ca gaveṣaṇā sarvam ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā
analyzed: yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca mahā karuṇā yā ca gaveṣaṇā sarvam ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ
translated: the bodhisattva, the perfection of wisdom, great compassion, and seeking - all these dharmas are neither bound nor liberated, are formless, are not shown, are unimpeded,

original: ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: are of one mark, which is to say, are without marks.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na cakṣuṣo gaveṣitavyā nānyatra cakṣuṣo gaveṣitavyā /🔽na śrotrād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra śrotrād gaveṣitavyā /🔽na ghrāṇād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra ghrāṇād gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na cakṣuṣaḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra cakṣuṣaḥ gaveṣitavyā  na śrotrāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra śrotrāt gaveṣitavyā  na ghrāṇāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra ghrāṇāt gaveṣitavyā
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should not search for the perfection of wisdom in the eye, nor should he search for it apart from the eye.🔽He should not search for it in the ear, nor should he search for it apart from the ear.🔽He should not search for it in the nose, nor should he search for it apart from the nose.

original: na jihvāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra jihvāyā gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na jihvāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra jihvāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: He should not search for it in the tongue, nor should he search for it apart from the tongue.

original: na kāyād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra kāyād gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na kāyāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra kāyāt gaveṣitavyā
translated: He should not search for it in the body, nor should he search for it apart from the body.

original: na manaso gaveṣitavyā nānyatra manaso gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na manasaḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra manasaḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: He should not search for it in the mind, nor should he search for it apart from the mind. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yac ca cakṣur yac ca śrotraṃ yac ca ghrāṇaṃ yā ca jihvā yaś ca kāyo yac ca mano yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā 🔽ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yat ca cakṣuḥ yat ca śrotram yat ca ghrāṇam yā ca jihvā yaḥ ca kāyaḥ yat ca manaḥ yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā  ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: Because, Kauśika, the eye, the ear, the nose, the tongue, the body, the mind, the bodhisattva, the perfection of wisdom, and the searching—

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: all these dharmas are neither conjoined nor disjoined, they are formless, cannot be shown, do not obstruct, and have one mark, which is no mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na rūpād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra rūpād gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na rūpāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra rūpāt gaveṣitavyā
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom of a bodhisattva great being should not be sought in form, nor should it be sought apart from form.

original: na śabdād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra śabdād gaveṣitavyā /🔽na gandhād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra gandhād gaveṣitavyā /🔽na rasād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra rasād gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na śabdāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra śabdāt gaveṣitavyā  na gandhāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra gandhāt gaveṣitavyā  na rasāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra rasāt gaveṣitavyā
translated: It should not be sought in sound, nor should it be sought apart from sound.🔽It should not be sought in smell, nor should it be sought apart from smell.🔽It should not be sought in taste, nor should it be sought apart from taste.

original: na sparśād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra sparśād gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na sparśāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra sparśāt gaveṣitavyā
translated: It should not be sought in touch, nor should it be sought apart from touch.

original: na dharmebhyo gaveṣitavyā
analyzed: na dharmebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: It should not be sought in dharmas,

original: nānyatra dharmebhyo gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na anyatra dharmebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: nor should it be sought apart from dharmas. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yac ca rūpaṃ yaś ca śabdo yaś ca gandho yaś ca raso yaś ca sparśo
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yat ca rūpam yaḥ ca śabdaḥ yaḥ ca gandhaḥ yaḥ ca rasaḥ yaḥ ca sparśaḥ
translated: Because, Kauśika, whatever form there is, and whatever sound, smell, taste, touch,

original: ye ca dharmā yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā sarva ete dharmā
analyzed: ye ca dharmāḥ yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā sarve ete dharmāḥ
translated: and dharmas there are, and whatever bodhisattva there is, and whatever perfection of wisdom there is, and whatever seeking there is, all these dharmas

original: na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāh /
analyzed: na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: are neither bound nor liberated, are formless, are not shown, do not obstruct, and have one mark, which is to say, they are without a mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na cakṣurvijñānād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra cakṣurvijñānād gaveṣitavyā /🔽na śrotravijñānād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra śrotravijñānād gaveṣitavyā /🔽na ghrāṇavijñānād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra ghrāṇavijñānād gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na cakṣuḥ vijñānāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra cakṣuḥ vijñānāt gaveṣitavyā  na śrotra vijñānāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra śrotra vijñānāt gaveṣitavyā  na ghrāṇa vijñānāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra ghrāṇa vijñānāt gaveṣitavyā
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, the bodhisattva great being should not search for the perfection of wisdom in the eye consciousness, nor should they search for it apart from the eye consciousness.🔽They should not search for it in the ear consciousness, nor should they search for it apart from the ear consciousness.🔽They should not search for it in the nose consciousness, nor should they search for it apart from the nose consciousness.

original: na jihvāvijñānād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra jihvāvijñānād gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na jihvā vijñānāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra jihvā vijñānāt gaveṣitavyā
translated: They should not search for it in the tongue consciousness, nor should they search for it apart from the tongue consciousness.

original: na kāyavijñānād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra kāyavijñānād gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na kāya vijñānāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra kāya vijñānāt gaveṣitavyā
translated: They should not search for it in the body consciousness, nor should they search for it apart from the body consciousness.

original: na manovijñānād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra manovijñānād gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na manaḥ vijñānāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra manaḥ vijñānāt gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: They should not search for it in the mind consciousness, nor should they search for it apart from the mind consciousness. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yac ca cakṣurvijñānaṃ yac ca śrotravijñānaṃ yac ca ghrāṇavijñānaṃ
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yat ca cakṣuḥ vijñānam yat ca śrotra vijñānam yat ca ghrāṇa vijñānam
translated: Because, Kauśika, the eye consciousness, the ear consciousness, the nose consciousness,

original: yac ca jihvāvijñānaṃ yac ca kāyavijñānaṃ yac ca manovijñānaṃ yaś ca bodhisattvo yā
analyzed: yat ca jihvā vijñānam yat ca kāya vijñānam yat ca manaḥ vijñānam yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā
translated: the tongue consciousness, the body consciousness, the mind consciousness, the bodhisattva,

original: ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: the perfection of wisdom, and the search for it -🔽all these dharmas are neither conjoined nor disjoined, they are formless, undistinguishable, without support, and are the same as space.

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: All these dharmas are neither bound nor liberated, are formless, are not visible, are unimpeded, and have one characteristic, which is that they are without characteristics.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na cakṣuḥsaṃsparśād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra cakṣuḥsaṃsparśād gaveṣitavyā /🔽na śrotrasaṃsparśād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra śrotrasaṃsparśād gaveṣitavyā /🔽na ghrāṇasaṃsparśād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra ghrāṇasaṃsparśād gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na cakṣuḥ saṃsparśāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra cakṣuḥ saṃsparśāt gaveṣitavyā  na śrotra saṃsparśāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra śrotra saṃsparśāt gaveṣitavyā  na ghrāṇa saṃsparśāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra ghrāṇa saṃsparśāt gaveṣitavyā
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom of a bodhisattva-mahāsattva should not be sought in the contact of the eye, nor should it be sought apart from the contact of the eye.🔽It should not be sought in the contact of the ear, nor should it be sought apart from the contact of the ear.🔽It should not be sought in the contact of the nose, nor should it be sought apart from the contact of the nose.

original: na jihvāsaṃsparśād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra jihvāsaṃsparśād gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na jihvā saṃsparśāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra jihvā saṃsparśāt gaveṣitavyā
translated: It should not be sought in the contact of the tongue, nor should it be sought apart from the contact of the tongue.

original: na kāyasaṃsparśād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra kāyasaṃsparśād gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na kāya saṃsparśāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra kāya saṃsparśāt gaveṣitavyā
translated: It should not be sought in the contact of the body, nor should it be sought apart from the contact of the body.

original: na manaḥsaṃsparśād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra manaḥsaṃsparśād gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na manaḥ saṃsparśāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra manaḥ saṃsparśāt gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: It should not be sought in the contact of the mind, nor should it be sought apart from the contact of the mind. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yaś ca cakṣuḥsaṃsparśo yaś ca śrotrasaṃsparśo yaś ca ghrāṇasaṃsparśo
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yaḥ ca cakṣuḥ saṃsparśaḥ yaḥ ca śrotra saṃsparśaḥ yaḥ ca ghrāṇa saṃsparśaḥ
translated: Because, Kauśika, the contact of the eye, the contact of the ear, the contact of the nose,

original: yaś ca jihvāsaṃsparśo yaś ca kāyasaṃsparśo yaś ca manaḥsaṃsparśo yaś ca bodhisattvo
analyzed: yaḥ ca jihvā saṃsparśaḥ yaḥ ca kāya saṃsparśaḥ yaḥ ca manaḥ saṃsparśaḥ yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ
translated: And whatever is tongue contact, whatever is body contact, whatever is mind contact, and whatever is a bodhisattva,

original: yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: and whatever is the perfection of wisdom and whatever is seeking,

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: all those dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined, they are formless, they are unimpeded, they have one mark, which is to say, they are without marks.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā🔽na śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ  na śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, a bodhisattva great being should not seek the perfection of wisdom in the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact, nor should he seek it apart from the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact.🔽He should not seek it in the feeling that arises from the condition of ear contact, nor should he seek it apart from the feeling that arises from the condition of ear contact.

original: na ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā 🔽gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ  gaveṣitavyā
translated: He should not seek it in the feeling that arises from the condition of nose contact, nor should he seek it apart from the feeling that arises from the condition of nose contact.

original: na jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: He should not seek it in the feeling that arises from the condition of tongue contact, nor should he seek it apart from the feeling that arises from the condition of tongue contact.🔽He should not seek it in the feeling that arises from the condition of body contact, nor should he seek it apart from the feeling that arises from the condition of body contact.

original: na kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: The feeling that arises from contact with the body should not be sought, nor should it be sought anywhere other than the feeling that arises from contact with the body.

original: na manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The feeling that arises from contact with the mind should not be sought, nor should it be sought anywhere other than the feeling that arises from contact with the mind. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yā ca cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanā yā ca śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanā
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yā ca cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā yā ca śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā
translated: Because, Kauśika, the feeling that arises from contact with the eye, the feeling that arises from contact with the ear,

original: yā ca ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanā yā ca jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanā yā ca kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanā
analyzed: yā ca ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā yā ca jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā yā ca kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā
translated: the feeling that arises from contact with the nose, the feeling that arises from contact with the tongue, the feeling that arises from contact with the body,

original: yā ca manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanā yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: yā ca manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: and the feeling that arises from contact with the mind, the bodhisattva, the perfection of wisdom, and the seeking—

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: all these dharmas are neither bound nor liberated, are formless, are not shown, do not obstruct, and have one mark, which is to say, no mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na pṛthivīdhātor gaveṣitavyā nānyatra pṛthivīdhātor gaveṣitavyā /🔽nābdhātor gaveṣitavyā nānyatrābdhātor gaveṣitavyā /🔽na tejodhātor gaveṣitavyā nānyatra tejodhātor gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na pṛthivī dhātoḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra pṛthivī dhātoḥ gaveṣitavyā  na ap dhātoḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra ap dhātoḥ gaveṣitavyā  na tejaḥ dhātoḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra tejaḥ dhātoḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should not search for the perfection of wisdom in the earth element, nor should he search for it apart from the earth element.🔽He should not search for it in the water element, nor should he search for it apart from the water element.🔽He should not search for it in the fire element, nor should he search for it apart from the fire element.

original: na vāyudhātor gaveṣitavyā nānyatra vāyudhātor gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na vāyu dhātoḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra vāyu dhātoḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: He should not search for it in the wind element, nor should he search for it apart from the wind element.

original: nākāśadhātor gaveṣitavyā nānyatrākāśadhātor gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na ākāśa dhātoḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra ākāśa dhātoḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: He should not search for it in the space element, nor should he search for it apart from the space element.

original: na vijñānadhātor gaveṣitavyā nānyatra vijñānadhātor gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na vijñāna dhātoḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra vijñāna dhātoḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: He should not search for it in the consciousness element, nor should he search for it apart from the consciousness element. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yaś ca pṛthivīdhātur yaś cābdhātur yaś ca tejodhātur yaś ca vāyudhātur
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yaḥ ca pṛthivī dhātuḥ yaḥ ca ap dhātuḥ yaḥ ca tejaḥ dhātuḥ yaḥ ca vāyu dhātuḥ
translated: Because, Kauśika, the earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the wind element,

original: yaś cākāśadhātur yaś ca vijñānadhātur yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: yaḥ ca ākāśa dhātuḥ yaḥ ca vijñāna dhātuḥ yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: the space element, the consciousness element, the bodhisattva, the perfection of wisdom, and the searching—🔽all these dharmas are neither conjoined nor disjoined, they are formless, undistinguishable, without support, and are described as having a single characteristic.

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: All these dharmas are neither bound nor liberated, are formless, are not visible, are unimpeded, and have one characteristic, which is that they are without characteristics.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā nāvidyāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatrāvidyāyā gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na avidyāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra avidyāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should not search for the perfection of wisdom in ignorance, nor should he search for it apart from ignorance.

original: na saṃskārebhyo gaveṣitavyā nānyatra saṃskārebhyo gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na saṃskārebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra saṃskārebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: He should not search for it in the formative predispositions, nor should he search for it apart from the formative predispositions.

original: na vijñānād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra vijñānād gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na vijñānāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra vijñānāt gaveṣitavyā
translated: He should not search for it in consciousness, nor should he search for it apart from consciousness.

original: na nāmarūpād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra nāmarūpād gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na nāma rūpāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra nāma rūpāt gaveṣitavyā
translated: He should not search for it in name and form, nor should he search for it apart from name and form.

original: na ṣaḍāyatanād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra ṣaḍāyatanād gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na ṣaṣ āyatanāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra ṣaṣ āyatanāt gaveṣitavyā
translated: He should not search for it in the six sense fields, nor should he search for it apart from the six sense fields.

original: na sparśād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra sparśād gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na sparśāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra sparśāt gaveṣitavyā
translated: He should not search for it in contact, nor should he search for it apart from contact.

original: na vedanāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra vedanāyā gaveṣitavyā /🔽na tṛṣṇāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra tṛṣṇāyā gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na vedanāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra vedanāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā  na tṛṣṇāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra tṛṣṇāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: He should not search for it in feeling, nor should he search for it apart from feeling.🔽He should not search for it in craving, nor should he search for it apart from craving.

original: nopādānād gaveṣitavyā nānyatropādānād gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na upādānāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra upādānāt gaveṣitavyā
translated: He should not search for it in clinging, nor should he search for it apart from clinging.

original: na bhavād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra bhavād gaveṣitavyā /🔽na jāter gaveṣitavyā nānyatra jāter gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na bhavāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra bhavāt gaveṣitavyā  na jāteḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra jāteḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: It should not be sought in becoming, nor should it be sought apart from becoming.🔽It should not be sought in birth, nor should it be sought apart from birth.

original: na jarāmaraṇād gaveṣitavyā nānyatra jarāmaraṇād gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na jarā maraṇāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra jarā maraṇāt gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: It should not be sought in old age and death, nor should it be sought apart from old age and death. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yā cāvidyā ye ca saṃskārā yac ca vijñānaṃ yac ca nāmarūpaṃ yac ca ṣaḍāyatanaṃ yaś
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yā ca avidyā ye ca saṃskārāḥ yat ca vijñānam yat ca nāma rūpam yat ca ṣaṣ āyatanam yaḥ
translated: Kauśika, it is because ignorance, the volitional formations, consciousness, name and form, the six sense sources,

original: ca sparśo yā ca vedanā yā ca tṛṣṇā yac copādānaṃ yaś ca bhavo yā ca jātir yac ca jarāmaraṇaṃ yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca
analyzed: ca sparśaḥ yā ca vedanā yā ca tṛṣṇā yat ca upādānam yaḥ ca bhavaḥ yā ca jātiḥ yat ca jarā maraṇam yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca
translated: contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, the bodhisattva, the perfection of wisdom, and

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: all these dharmas are neither bound nor liberated, are formless, invisible, non-resisting, and have one mark, which is no mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na dānapāramitāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra dānapāramitāyā gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na dāna pāramitāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra dāna pāramitāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, the bodhisattva mahasattva should not seek the perfection of wisdom in the perfection of generosity, nor should he seek it apart from the perfection of generosity.

original: na śīlapāramitāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra śīlapāramitāyā gaveṣitavyā /🔽na kṣāntipāramitāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra kṣāntipāramitāyā gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na śīla pāramitāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra śīla pāramitāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā  na kṣānti pāramitāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra kṣānti pāramitāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: The perfection of morality should not be sought for, nor should it be sought for other than the perfection of morality.🔽The perfection of patience should not be sought for, nor should it be sought for other than the perfection of patience.

original: na vīryapāramitāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra vīryapāramitāyā gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na vīrya pāramitāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra vīrya pāramitāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: The perfection of perseverance should not be sought for, nor should it be sought for other than the perfection of perseverance.

original: na dhyānapāramitāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra dhyānapāramitāyā gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na dhyāna pāramitāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra dhyāna pāramitāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: The perfection of concentration should not be sought for, nor should it be sought for other than the perfection of concentration.

original: na prajñāpāramitāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra prajñāpāramitāyā gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na prajñāpāramitāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra prajñāpāramitāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfection of wisdom should not be sought for, nor should it be sought for other than the perfection of wisdom. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yā ca dānapāramitā yā ca śīlapāramitā yā ca kṣāntipāramitā yā ca
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yā ca dāna pāramitā yā ca śīla pāramitā yā ca kṣānti pāramitā yā ca
translated: Because, Kauśika, the perfection of generosity, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience,

original: vīryapāramitā yā ca dhyānapāramitā yā ca prajñāpāramitā yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca
analyzed: vīrya pāramitā yā ca dhyāna pāramitā yā ca prajñāpāramitā yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca
translated: the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom, and the bodhisattva,

original: prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: and the perfection of wisdom, and the seeking,

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: all these dharmas are neither bound nor liberated, are formless, are not shown, do not obstruct, and have one mark, which is to say, no mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā nādhyātmaśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatrādhyātmaśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā /🔽na bahirdhāśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra bahirdhāśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na adhyātma śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra adhyātma śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā  na bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should not search for the perfection of wisdom within the emptiness of internal phenomena, nor should he search for it apart from the emptiness of internal phenomena.🔽He should not search for it within the emptiness of external phenomena, nor should he search for it apart from the emptiness of external phenomena.

original: nādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatrādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: He should not search for it within the emptiness of internal and external phenomena, nor should he search for it apart from the emptiness of internal and external phenomena.

original: na śūnyatāśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra śūnyatāśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na śūnyatā aśūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra śūnyatā aśūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: He should not search for it within the emptiness of emptiness, nor should he search for it apart from the emptiness of emptiness.

original: na mahāśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra mahāśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā /🔽na paramārthaśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra paramārthaśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā /🔽na saṃskṛtaśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra saṃskṛtaśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na mahāśūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra mahāśūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā  na paramārtha śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra paramārtha śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā  na saṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra saṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: He should not search for it within great emptiness, nor should he search for it apart from great emptiness.🔽He should not search for it within ultimate emptiness, nor should he search for it apart from ultimate emptiness.🔽He should not search for it within the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, nor should he search for it apart from the emptiness of conditioned phenomena.

original: nāsaṃskṛtaśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatrāsaṃskṛtaśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na asaṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra asaṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: He should not search for it within the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, nor should he search for it apart from the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena.

original: nātyantaśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatrātyantaśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā /🔽nānavarāgraśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatrānavarāgraśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā /🔽nānavakāraśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatrānavakāraśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na atyanta śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra atyanta śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā  na anavara agra śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra anavara agra śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā  na anavakāraśūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra anavakāraśūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: The extreme emptiness should not be sought for, nor should it be sought for anywhere other than the extreme emptiness.🔽The emptiness of no beginning and no end should not be sought for, nor should it be sought for anywhere other than the emptiness of no beginning and no end.🔽The emptiness of non-dispersal should not be sought for, nor should it be sought for anywhere other than the emptiness of non-dispersal.

original: na prakṛtiśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra prakṛtiśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na prakṛti śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra prakṛti śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: The emptiness of nature should not be sought for, nor should it be sought for anywhere other than the emptiness of nature.

original: na sarvadharmaśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra sarvadharmaśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na sarva dharma śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra sarva dharma śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena should not be sought for, nor should it be sought for anywhere other than the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: na svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā /🔽nānupalambhaśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā nanyatrānupalambhaśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: na sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā  na anupalambha śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra anupalambha śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: The emptiness of specific characteristics should not be sought for, nor should it be sought for anywhere other than the emptiness of specific characteristics.🔽The emptiness of non-apprehension should not be sought for, nor should it be sought for anywhere other than the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: nābhāvaśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatrābhāvaśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā / na
analyzed: na abhāva śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra abhāva śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na
translated: The emptiness of non-existence should not be sought for, nor should it be sought for anywhere other than the emptiness of non-existence.

original: svabhāvaśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra svabhāvaśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: The emptiness of own-nature should not be sought for, nor should it be sought for anywhere other than the emptiness of own-nature.

original: nābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatrābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyā gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The emptiness of the own-being of non-existence should not be sought in the perfection of wisdom, nor should it be sought elsewhere. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yā cādhyātmaśūnyatā yā ca bahirdhāśūnyatā yā cādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatā🔽yā ca śūnyatāśūnyatā yā ca mahāśūnyatā yā ca paramārthaśūnyatā yā ca saṃskṛtaśūnyatā
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yā ca adhyātma śūnyatā yā ca bahirdhā śūnyatā yā ca adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā  yā ca śūnyatā aśūnyatā yā ca mahā śūnyatā yā ca paramārtha śūnyatā yā ca saṃskṛta śūnyatā
translated: Because, Kauśika, the emptiness of the internal, the emptiness of the external, the emptiness of the internal and external,🔽the emptiness of emptiness, the great emptiness, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of the conditioned,

original: yā cāsaṃskṛtaśūnyatā yā cātyantaśūnyatā yā cānavarāgraśūnyatā yā cānavakāraśūnyatā
analyzed: yā ca asaṃskṛta śūnyatā yā ca atyanta śūnyatā yā ca an avara agra śūnyatā yā ca anavakāra śūnyatā
translated: the emptiness of the unconditioned, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of the primordial, the emptiness of the manifold,

original: yā ca prakṛtiśūnyatā yā ca sarvadharmaśūnyatā yā ca svalakṣaṇaśūnyatā yā cānupalambhaśūnyatā
analyzed: yā ca prakṛti śūnyatā yā ca sarva dharma śūnyatā yā ca sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā yā ca anupalambha śūnyatā
translated: the emptiness of nature, the emptiness of all dharmas, the emptiness of specific characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension,

original: yā cābhāvaśūnyatā yā ca svabhāvaśūnyatā yā cābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā yaś ca bodhisattvo
analyzed: yā ca abhāva śūnyatā yā ca svabhāva śūnyatā yā ca abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ
translated: the emptiness of non-existence, the emptiness of own-being, and the emptiness of the own-being of non-existence, and the bodhisattva,

original: yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: and the perfection of wisdom, and the seeking -

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: all these dharmas are neither conjoined nor disjoined, they are formless, they cannot be shown, they have no obstruction, they have one mark, which is to say, they are without mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na smṛtyupasthānebhyo gaveṣitavyā nānyatra smṛtyupasthānebhyo gaveṣitavyā / tat
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na smṛti upasthānebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra smṛti upasthānebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā tat
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, the bodhisattva great being should not search for the perfection of wisdom in the applications of mindfulness, nor should he search for it apart from the applications of mindfulness.

original: kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yāni ca smṛtyupasthānāni yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yāni ca smṛti upasthānāni yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: Kauśika, it is because those applications of mindfulness, that bodhisattva, that perfection of wisdom, and that search -

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: all those dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined, they are formless, they cannot be pointed out, they do not obstruct, they have one mark, which is to say, no mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na samyakprahāṇānebhyo gaveṣitavyā nānyatra samyakprahāṇānebhyo gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na samyak prahāṇā anebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra samyak prahāṇā anebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, the bodhisattva great being should not search for the perfection of wisdom in the right efforts, nor should he search for it apart from the right efforts.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yāni ca samyakprahāṇāni yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yāni ca samyak prahāṇāni yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: Kauśika, it is because those right efforts, that bodhisattva, that perfection of wisdom, and that search -

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: All these dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined, they are formless, cannot be shown, do not obstruct, have one mark, that is, no mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā narddhipādebhyo gaveṣitavyā nānyatrarddhipādebhyo gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika ye carddhipādāḥ yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na ṛddhipādebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra ṛddhipādebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika ye ca ṛddhipādāḥ yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom should be sought in the bases of supernatural power, and should not be sought apart from the bases of supernatural power. Why is that?

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: Kauśika, it is because the bases of supernatural power, the bodhisattva, the perfection of wisdom, and the search—all these dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined, they are formless, cannot be shown, do not obstruct, have one mark, that is, no mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā nendriyebhyo gaveṣitavyā nānyatrendriyebhyo gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na indriyebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra indriyebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom should be sought in the faculties, and should not be sought apart from the faculties. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yāni cendriyāni yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yāni ca indriyāni yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: Kauśika, it is because the faculties, the bodhisattva, the perfection of wisdom, and the search—

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /🔽punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ  punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā
translated: All these dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined, they are formless, cannot be shown, do not obstruct, have one mark, that is, no mark.

original: na balebhyo gaveṣitavyā nānyatra balebhyo gavesitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na balebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra balebhyaḥ gavesitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, the bodhisattva great being should not search for the perfection of wisdom in the powers, nor should he search for it apart from the powers. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika yāni ca balāni yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yāni ca balāni yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: Because, Kauśika, those powers, that bodhisattva, that perfection of wisdom, and that search—

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: all these dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined, they are formless, cannot be shown, do not obstruct, have one mark, that is, no mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na bodhyaṅgebhyo gaveṣitavyā nānyatra bodhyaṅgebhyo gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na bodhyaṅgebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra bodhyaṅgebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, the bodhisattva great being should not search for the perfection of wisdom in the limbs of awakening, nor should he search for it apart from the limbs of awakening. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika yāni ca bodhyaṅgāni yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yāni ca bodhyaṅgāni yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: Because, Kauśika, those limbs of awakening, that bodhisattva, that perfection of wisdom, and that search—

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: All these dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined, they are formless, cannot be shown, do not obstruct, have one mark, i.e. no mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā nāryāṣṭāṅgamārgād gaveṣitavyā nānyatrāryāṣṭāṅgamārgād gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na ārya aṣṭāṅga mārgāt gaveṣitavyā na anyatra ārya aṣṭāṅga mārgāt gaveṣitavyā tat kasya
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom by the bodhisattva great being should be sought in the noble eightfold path, and should be sought nowhere else than the noble eightfold path. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika yaś cāryāṣṭāṅgamārgo yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yaḥ ca ārya aṣṭāṅga mārgaḥ yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: Because, Kauśika, the noble eightfold path, the bodhisattva, the perfection of wisdom, and the seeking,

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /🔽punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā nāryasatyebhyo gaveṣitavyā nānyatrāryasatyebhyo gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ  punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na ārya satyebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra ārya satyebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: all these dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined, they are formless, cannot be shown, do not obstruct, have one mark, i.e. no mark.🔽Furthermore, Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom by the bodhisattva great being should be sought in the noble truths, and should be sought nowhere else than the noble truths. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika yāni cāryasatyāni yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yāni ca ārya satyāni yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: Because, Kauśika, the noble truths, the bodhisattva, the perfection of wisdom, and the seeking,

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: All these dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined, they are formless, cannot be shown, do not obstruct, have one mark, that is, no mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na dhyānebhyo gaveṣitavyā nānyatra dhyānebhyo gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na dhyānebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra dhyānebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom should not be sought in the concentrations, nor should it be sought apart from the concentrations. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yāni ca dhyānāni yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yāni ca dhyānāni yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: Because, Kauśika, those concentrations, that bodhisattva, that perfection of wisdom, and that search—

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: all these dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined, they are formless, cannot be shown, do not obstruct, have one mark, that is, no mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā nāpramāṇebhyo gaveṣitavyā nānyatrāpramāṇebhyo gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na apramāṇebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra apramāṇebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom should not be sought in the formless [absorptions], nor should it be sought apart from the formless [absorptions]. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yāni cāpramāṇāni yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yāni ca apramāṇāni yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: Because, Kauśika, those formless [absorptions], that bodhisattva, that perfection of wisdom, and that search—

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: All these dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined, they are formless, cannot be shown, do not obstruct, have one mark, that is, no mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā nārūpyasamāpattibhyo gaveṣitavyā nārūpyasamāpattibhyo gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na ārūpya samāpattibhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā na ārūpya samāpattibhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom by the bodhisattva great being should not be sought in the formless attainments, nor should it be sought apart from the formless attainments. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yāś cārūpyasamāpattayo yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yāḥ ca ārūpya samāpattayaḥ yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: Because, Kauśika, those formless attainments, that bodhisattva, that perfection of wisdom, and that seeking—

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: all these dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined, they are formless, cannot be shown, do not obstruct, have one mark, that is, no mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na vimokṣebhyo gaveṣitavyā na vimokṣebhyo gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na vimokṣebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā na vimokṣebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom by the bodhisattva great being should not be sought in the liberations, nor should it be sought apart from the liberations. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika ye ca vimokṣā yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika ye ca vimokṣāḥ yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: Because, Kauśika, those liberations, that bodhisattva, that perfection of wisdom, and that seeking—

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: All these dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined, they are formless, invisible, nonresisting, with a single defining mark, that is, they are without defining marks.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā nānupūrvavihārasamāpattibhyo gaveṣitavyā nānyatrānupūrvavihārasamāpattibhyo 🔽gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika yāś cānupūrvavihārasamāpattayo yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na anupūrva vihāra samāpattibhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra anupūrva vihāra samāpattibhyaḥ  gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika yāḥ ca anupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, the bodhisattva great being should not search for the perfection of wisdom in the successive absorptions, nor should he search for it apart from the successive absorptions. Why is that?

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: Kauśika, it is because the successive absorptions, the bodhisattva, the perfection of wisdom, and the search—all these dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined, they are formless, invisible, nonresisting, with a single defining mark, that is, they are without defining marks.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhebhyo
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhebhyaḥ
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, the bodhisattva great being should not search for the perfection of wisdom in the doors of liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness,

original: gaveṣitavyā nānyatra śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhebhyo gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: gaveṣitavyā na anyatra śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: nor should he search for it apart from the doors of liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yāni ca śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhāni yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yāni ca śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhāni yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: For, Kauśika, the doors to liberation—emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness—and the bodhisattva, and the perfection of wisdom, and the search—

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: all these dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined, they are formless, they cannot be pointed out, they do not obstruct, they have one mark, that is, no mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā nābhijñāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatrābhijñāyā gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na abhijñāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra abhijñāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom should not be sought in the superknowledges, nor should it be sought apart from the superknowledges. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yāś cābhijñā yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yāḥ ca abhijñāḥ yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: For, Kauśika, the superknowledges, and the bodhisattva, and the perfection of wisdom, and the search—

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: all these dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined, they are formless, they cannot be pointed out, they do not obstruct, they have one mark, that is, no mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na samādhibhyo gaveṣitavyā nānyatra samādhibhyo gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na samādhibhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra samādhibhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom should not be sought in the concentrations, nor should it be sought apart from the concentrations. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yāś ca samādhayo yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yāḥ ca samādhayaḥ yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: Because, Kauśika, the meditative stabilities, the bodhisattva, the perfection of wisdom, and the search—

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: all these dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined, they are formless, they cannot be pointed out, they do not obstruct, they have one mark, which is to say, no mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na dhāraṇīmukhebhyo gaveṣitavyā nānyatra dhāraṇīmukhebhyo gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na dhāraṇī mukhebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra dhāraṇī mukhebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom should not be sought in the dhāraṇī gateways, nor should it be sought apart from the dhāraṇī gateways. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yāni ca dhāraṇīmukhāni yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yāni ca dhāraṇīmukhāni yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: Because, Kauśika, the dhāraṇī gateways, the bodhisattva, the perfection of wisdom, and the search—

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: all these dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined, they are formless, they cannot be pointed out, they do not obstruct, they have one mark, which is to say, no mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na tathāgatabalebhyo gaveṣitavyā nānyatra tathāgatabalebhyo gaveṣitavyā / tat
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na tathāgata balebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra tathāgata balebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā tat
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom should not be sought in the powers of the Tathāgata, nor should it be sought apart from the powers of the Tathāgata. Why is that?

original: kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yāni ca tathāgatabalāni yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yāni ca tathāgata balāni yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: To illustrate, Kauśika, the powers of the Tathāgata, the bodhisattva, the perfection of wisdom, and the search—

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: all these dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined, they are formless, they cannot be pointed out, they do not obstruct, they have one mark, which is to say, no mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na vaiśāradyebhyo gaveṣitavyā nānyatra vaiśāradyebhyo gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na vaiśāradyebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra vaiśāradyebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom should not be sought in the fearlessnesses, nor should it be sought apart from the fearlessnesses. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yāni ca vaiśāradyāni yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yāni ca vaiśāradyāni yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: To illustrate, Kauśika, the fearlessnesses, the bodhisattva, the perfection of wisdom, and the search—

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: all these dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined, they are formless, they cannot be pointed out, they do not obstruct, they have one mark, which is to say, no mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na pratisaṃvidbhyo gaveṣitavyā na pratisaṃvidbhyo gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na pratisaṃvidbhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā na pratisaṃvidbhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom should not be sought in the detailed and thorough knowledges, nor should it be sought apart from the detailed and thorough knowledges. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yāś ca pratisaṃvido yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yāḥ ca pratisaṃvidaḥ yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: To illustrate, Kauśika, the analytical knowledges, the bodhisattva, the perfection of wisdom, and the search—

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: all these dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined; they are formless, unimpeded, and have a single defining mark, which is that they are without defining marks.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na mahāmaitryā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra mahāmaitryā gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na mahā maitryā gaveṣitavyā na anyatra mahā maitryā gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, the bodhisattva great being should not search for the perfection of wisdom in the great love or outside the great love. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yā ca mahāmaitrī yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yā ca mahā maitrī yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: To illustrate, Kauśika, the great love, the bodhisattva, the perfection of wisdom, and the search—

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: all these dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined; they are formless, unimpeded, and have a single defining mark, which is that they are without defining marks.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na mahākaruṇāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra mahākaruṇāyā gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na mahā karuṇāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra mahā karuṇāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, the bodhisattva great being should not search for the perfection of wisdom in the great compassion or outside the great compassion. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yā ca mahākaruṇā yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yā ca mahā karuṇā yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: To illustrate, Kauśika, great compassion, the bodhisattva, the perfection of wisdom, and the search—

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: all these dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined, they are formless, they cannot be pointed out, they do not obstruct, they have one mark, which is to say, no mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā nāveṇikabuddhadharmebhyo gaveṣitavyā nānyatrāveṇikabuddhadharmebhyo gaveṣitavyā /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na āveṇika buddha dharmebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra āveṇika buddha dharmebhyaḥ gaveṣitavyā
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom should not be sought for in the unshared qualities of a buddha, nor should it be sought for other than in the unshared qualities of a buddha.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika ye cāveṇikabuddhadharmā yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika ye ca āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: To illustrate, Kauśika, the unshared qualities of a buddha, the bodhisattva, the perfection of wisdom, and the search—

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: all these dharmas are not conjoined and not disjoined, they are formless, they cannot be pointed out, they do not obstruct, they have one mark, which is to say, no mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na sarvajñatāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra sarvajñatāyā gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na sarvajña tāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra sarvajña tāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom should not be sought for in the knowledge of all aspects, nor should it be sought for other than in the knowledge of all aspects. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yā ca sarvajñatā yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yā ca sarvajña tā yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca
translated: Because, Kauśika, the knowledge of all aspects, the bodhisattva,

original: prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: the perfection of wisdom, and the search—

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: all these dharmas are not conjoined or disjoined, they are formless, cannot be pointed out, do not obstruct, and have one mark, which is no mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na mārgākārajñatāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra mārgākārajñatāyā gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na mārga ākāra jña tāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra mārga ākāra jña tāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, a bodhisattva great being should not search for the perfection of wisdom in the knowledge of path aspects, nor should he search for it apart from the knowledge of path aspects. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yā ca mārgākārajñatā yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yā ca mārga ākāra jña tā yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: Because, Kauśika, the knowledge of path aspects, the bodhisattva, the perfection of wisdom, and the search—

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: all these dharmas are not conjoined or disjoined, they are formless, cannot be pointed out, do not obstruct, and have one mark, which is no mark.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na sarvākārajñatāyā gaveṣitavyā nānyatra sarvākārajñatāyā gaveṣitavyā / tat kasya
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā na sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā na anyatra sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ gaveṣitavyā tat kasya
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, a bodhisattva great being should not search for the perfection of wisdom in the knowledge of all aspects, nor should he search for it apart from the knowledge of all aspects. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika yā ca sarvākārajñatā yaś ca bodhisattvo yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika yā ca sarva ākāra jña tā yaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ yā ca prajñāpāramitā yā ca gaveṣaṇā
translated: For example, Kauśika, the knowledge of all aspects, the bodhisattva, the perfection of wisdom, and the search—

original: sarva ete dharmā na saṃyuktā na visaṃyuktā arūpiṇo 'nidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ete dharmāḥ na saṃyuktāḥ na visaṃyuktāḥ arūpiṇaḥ nidarśanāḥ apratighāḥ eka lakṣaṇāḥ yat uta alakṣaṇāḥ
translated: all these dharmas are neither bound nor liberated, are formless, are not shown, do not obstruct, and have one mark, which is to say, no mark.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi na rūpaṃ prajñāpāramitā nānyatra rūpāt prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi na rūpam prajñāpāramitā na anyatra rūpāt prajñāpāramitā
translated: Why is that?🔽For thus, form is not the perfection of wisdom, nor is the perfection of wisdom other than form.

original: na rūpatathatā prajñāpāramitā nānyatra rūpatathatāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: na rūpa tathatā prajñāpāramitā na anyatra rūpa tathatāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā
translated: The suchness of form is not the perfection of wisdom, nor is the perfection of wisdom other than the suchness of form.

original: na rūpadharmatā prajñāpāramitā nānyatra rūpadharmatāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā /🔽na vedanā prajñāpāramitā nānyatra vedanāyā prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: na rūpa dharma tā prajñāpāramitā na anyatra rūpa dharma tāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā  na vedanā prajñāpāramitā na anyatra vedanāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā
translated: The dharma-constituent of form is not the perfection of wisdom, nor is the perfection of wisdom other than the dharma-constituent of form.🔽Feeling is not the perfection of wisdom, nor is the perfection of wisdom other than feeling.

original: na vedanātathatā prajñāpāramitā nānyatra vedanātathatāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: na vedanā tathatā prajñāpāramitā na anyatra vedanā tathatāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā
translated: The suchness of feeling is not the perfection of wisdom, nor is the perfection of wisdom other than the suchness of feeling.

original: na vedanādharmatā prajñāpāramitā nānyatra vedanādharmatāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: na vedanā dharma tā prajñāpāramitā na anyatra vedanā dharma tāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā
translated: The dharma-constituent of feeling is not the perfection of wisdom, nor is the perfection of wisdom other than the dharma-constituent of feeling.

original: na saṃjñā prajñāpāramitā nānyatra saṃjñāyā prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: na saṃjñā prajñāpāramitā na anyatra saṃjñāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā
translated: Perception is not the perfection of wisdom, nor is the perfection of wisdom other than perception.

original: na saṃjñātathatā prajñāpāramitā nānyatra saṃjñātathatāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: na saṃjñā tathatā prajñāpāramitā na anyatra saṃjñā tathatāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā
translated: The suchness of perception is not the perfection of wisdom, nor is the perfection of wisdom elsewhere than the suchness of perception.

original: na saṃjñādharmatā prajñāpāramitā nānyatra saṃjñādharmatāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: na saṃjñā dharma tā prajñāpāramitā na anyatra saṃjñā dharma tāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā
translated: The true dharmic nature of perception is not the perfection of wisdom, nor is the perfection of wisdom elsewhere than the true dharmic nature of perception.

original: na saṃskārāḥ prajñāpāramitā nānyatra saṃskārebhyaḥ prajñāpāramitā /🔽na saṃskāratathatā prajñāpāramitā nānyatra saṃskāratathatāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: na saṃskārāḥ prajñāpāramitā na anyatra saṃskārebhyaḥ prajñāpāramitā  na saṃskāra tathatā prajñāpāramitā na anyatra saṃskāra tathatāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā
translated: Formations are not the perfection of wisdom, nor is the perfection of wisdom elsewhere than formations.🔽The suchness of formations is not the perfection of wisdom, nor is the perfection of wisdom elsewhere than the suchness of formations.

original: na saṃskāradharmatā prajñāpāramitā nānyatra saṃskāradharmatāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: na saṃskāra dharma tā prajñāpāramitā na anyatra saṃskāra dharma tāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā
translated: The true dharmic nature of formations is not the perfection of wisdom, nor is the perfection of wisdom elsewhere than the true dharmic nature of formations.

original: na vijñānaṃ prajñāpāramitā nānyatra vijñānāt prajñāpāramitā /🔽na vijñānatathatā prajñāpāramitā nānyatra vijñānatathatāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: na vijñānam prajñāpāramitā na anyatra vijñānāt prajñāpāramitā  na vijñāna tathatā prajñāpāramitā na anyatra vijñāna tathatāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā
translated: Consciousness is not the perfection of wisdom, nor is the perfection of wisdom elsewhere than consciousness.🔽The suchness of consciousness is not the perfection of wisdom, nor is the perfection of wisdom elsewhere than the suchness of consciousness.

original: na vijñānadharmatā prajñāpāramitā nānyatra vijñānadharmatāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: na vijñāna dharmatā prajñāpāramitā na anyatra vijñāna dharmatāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā
translated: The true dharmic nature of consciousness is not the perfection of wisdom, nor is the perfection of wisdom elsewhere than the true dharmic nature of consciousness.

original: na cakṣuḥ prajñāpāramitā nānyatra cakṣuṣaḥ prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: na cakṣuḥ prajñāpāramitā na anyatra cakṣuṣaḥ prajñāpāramitā
translated: The eye is not the perfection of wisdom, nor is the perfection of wisdom elsewhere than the eye.

original: na cakṣustathatā prajñāpāramitā nānyatra cakṣustathatāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: na cakṣuḥ tathatā prajñāpāramitā na anyatra cakṣuḥ tathatāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā
translated: The suchness of the eye is not the perfection of wisdom, nor is the perfection of wisdom elsewhere than the suchness of the eye.

original: na cakṣurdharmatā prajñāpāramitā nānyatra cakṣurdharmatāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā /
