analyzed: dhyāna pāramitā mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattvas, the great beings, is a great perfection because of the greatness of the perfection of concentration. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika dhyānapāramitāyā na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika dhyāna pāramitāyāḥ na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the perfection of concentration is not apprehended as an end,

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: is not apprehended as a beginning, and is not apprehended as a middle.

original: prajñāpāramitāmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattvas, the great beings, is a great perfection because of the greatness of the perfection of wisdom. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika prajñāpāramitāyā na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika prajñāpāramitāyāḥ na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended as an end,

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: The later limit is not apprehended, nor is a middle apprehended.

original: adhyātmaśūnyatāmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: adhyātma śūnyatā mahadgata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is the great perfection of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, because of the greatness of the emptiness of internal phenomena. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśikādhyātmaśūnyatāyā na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika adhyātma śūnyatāyāḥ na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is because the prior limit of the emptiness of internal phenomena is not apprehended,

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: the later limit is not apprehended, nor is a middle apprehended.

original: bahirdhāśūnyatāmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: bahirdhā śūnyatā mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is the great perfection of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, because of the greatness of the emptiness of external phenomena. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika bahirdhāśūnyatāyā na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is because the prior limit of the emptiness of external phenomena is not apprehended,

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: the later limit is not apprehended, nor is a middle apprehended.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is the great perfection of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, because of the greatness of the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśikādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāyā 🔽na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ  na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is because the prior limit of the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena🔽is not apprehended,

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: the later limit is not apprehended, nor is a middle apprehended.

original: śūnyatāśūnyatāmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: śūnyatā aśūnyatā mahadgata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is it so?

original: tathā hi kauśika śūnyatāśūnyatāyā na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika śūnyatā aśūnyatāyāḥ na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the emptiness of emptiness is not apprehended as a beforetime,

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: is not apprehended as an aftertime, and is not apprehended as a present time.🔽The great emptiness is great because of the greatness of space, Kauśika.

original: mahāśūnyatāmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: mahā śūnyatā mahadgata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is it so?

original: tathā hi kauśika mahāśūnyatāyā na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika mahāśūnyatāyāḥ na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the great emptiness is not apprehended as a beforetime,

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: is not apprehended as an aftertime, and is not apprehended as a present time.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is great because of the greatness of space, Kauśika.

original: paramārthaśūnyatāmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: paramārtha śūnyatā mahadgata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is it so?

original: tathā hi kauśika paramārthaśūnyatāyā na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika paramārtha śūnyatāyāḥ na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the emptiness of the ultimate is not apprehended as a beforetime,

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: is not apprehended as an aftertime, and is not apprehended as a present time.

original: saṃskṛtaśūnyatāmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: saṃskṛta śūnyatā mahadgata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The great perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is due to the greatness of the emptiness of conditioned phenomena. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika saṃskṛtaśūnyatāyā na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika saṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the limit of the past is not apprehended in the emptiness of conditioned phenomena.

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: The limit of the future is not apprehended. The middle is not apprehended.

original: asaṃskṛtaśūnyatāmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: asaṃskṛta śūnyatā mahadgata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The great perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is due to the greatness of the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśikāsaṃskṛtaśūnyatāyā na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika asaṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the limit of the past is not apprehended in the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena.

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: The limit of the future is not apprehended. The middle is not apprehended.

original: atyantaśūnyatāmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: atyanta śūnyatā mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The great perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is due to the greatness of the emptiness of ultimate reality. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśikātyantaśūnyatāyā na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika atyanta śūnyatāyāḥ na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the limit of the past is not apprehended in the emptiness of ultimate reality.

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: The limit of the future is not apprehended. The middle is not apprehended.

original: anavarāgraśūnyatāmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: an avara agra śūnyatā mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because the emptiness of what is not to be discarded is infinite, Kauśika, this is the great vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśikānavarāgraśūnyatāyā na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika an avara agra śūnyatāyāḥ na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the emptiness of what is not to be discarded is not apprehended in the past,

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: is not apprehended in the future, and is not apprehended in the present.🔽Because the emptiness of the ultimate is infinite, Kauśika, this is the great vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings. And why?

original: anavakāraśūnyatāmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: an avakāra śūnyatā mahadgata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because, Kauśika, the emptiness of the ultimate is not apprehended in the past,🔽is not apprehended in the future, and is not apprehended in the present.🔽Because the emptiness of conditioned phenomena is infinite, Kauśika, this is the great vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśikānavakāraśūnyatāyā na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika anavakāra śūnyatāyāḥ na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena is not apprehended in the past,

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: is not apprehended in the future, and is not apprehended in the present.

original: prakṛtiśūnyatāmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatā mahadgata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena is infinite, Kauśika, this is the great vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika prakṛtiśūnyatāyā na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika prakṛti śūnyatāyāḥ na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena is not apprehended in the past,

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: is not apprehended in the future, and is not apprehended in the present.

original: sarvadharmaśūnyatāmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: sarva dharma śūnyatā mahadgata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The great perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is due to the vastness of the emptiness of all phenomena. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika sarvadharmaśūnyatāyā na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika sarva dharma śūnyatāyāḥ na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the emptiness of all phenomena is not apprehended in the past,

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: is not apprehended in the future, and is not apprehended in the present.

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā mahadgata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The great perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is due to the vastness of the emptiness of its own mark, Kauśika. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāyā na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatāyāḥ na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the emptiness of its own mark is not apprehended in the past,

original: nāparānta upalabhyate
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: is not apprehended in the future,

original: na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: and is not apprehended in the present.

original: anupalambhaśūnyatāmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: anupalambha śūnyatā mahadgata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The great perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is due to the vastness of the emptiness of non-apprehension, Kauśika. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśikānupalambhaśūnyatāyā na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika anupalambha śūnyatāyāḥ na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the emptiness of non-apprehension is not apprehended in the past,

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: is not apprehended in the future, and is not apprehended in the present.

original: abhāvaśūnyatāmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: abhāva śūnyatā mahadgata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The great perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is due to the greatness of the emptiness of non-existence. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśikābhāvaśūnyatāyā na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika abhāva śūnyatāyāḥ na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the limit of the past is not apprehended in the emptiness of non-existence.

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: The limit of the future is not apprehended. The middle is not apprehended.

original: svabhāvaśūnyatāmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: svabhāva śūnyatā mahadgata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The great perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is due to the greatness of the emptiness of own-nature. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika svabhāvaśūnyatāyā na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the limit of the past is not apprehended in the emptiness of own-nature.

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: The limit of the future is not apprehended. The middle is not apprehended.

original: abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The great perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is due to the greatness of the emptiness of the own-nature of non-existence. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśikābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyā na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the limit of the past is not apprehended in the emptiness of the own-nature of non-existence.

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: The limit of the future is not apprehended. The middle is not apprehended.

original: smṛtyupasthānamahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: smṛti upasthāna mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The great extent of the applications of mindfulness, Kauśika, is this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika smṛtyupasthānānāṃ na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika smṛti upasthānānām na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: For, Kauśika, no prior limit of the applications of mindfulness is apprehended.

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: No later limit is apprehended. No middle is apprehended.

original: samyakprahāṇamahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: samyak prahāṇa mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The great extent of the right efforts, Kauśika, is this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika samyakprahāṇānāṃ na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika samyakprahāṇānām na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: For, Kauśika, no prior limit of the right efforts is apprehended.

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: No later limit is apprehended. No middle is apprehended.

original: ṛddhipādamahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: ṛddhipāda mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The great extent of the bases of supernatural power, Kauśika, is this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśikarddhipādānāṃ na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika ṛddhi pādānām na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: For, Kauśika, no prior limit of the bases of supernatural power is apprehended.

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: No later limit is apprehended. No middle is apprehended.

original: indriyamahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: indriya mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The great extent of the faculties, Kauśika, is this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśikendriyāṇāṃ na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika indriyāṇām na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: For, Kauśika, the beginning of the faculties is not perceived.

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: The end is not perceived. The middle is not perceived.

original: balamahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: bala mahadgata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattvas, the great beings, is great because of the greatness of the powers. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika balānāṃ na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika balānām na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: For, Kauśika, the beginning of the powers is not perceived.

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: The end is not perceived. The middle is not perceived.

original: bodhyaṅgamahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: bodhyaṅga mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattvas, the great beings, is great because of the greatness of the limbs of enlightenment. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika bodhyaṅgānāṃ na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika bodhyaṅgānām na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: For, Kauśika, the beginning of the limbs of enlightenment is not perceived.

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: The end is not perceived. The middle is not perceived.

original: āryāṣṭāṅgamārgamahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: ārya aṣṭāṅga mārga mahadgata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattvas, the great beings, is great because of the greatness of the noble eightfold path. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśikāryāṣṭāṅgamārgasya na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika ārya aṣṭāṅga mārgasya na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: For, Kauśika, the beginning of the noble eightfold path is not perceived.

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: The end is not perceived. The middle is not perceived.

original: āryasatyamahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ
analyzed: ārya satya mahadgata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is great because of the greatness of the noble truths.

original: mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is it so?

original: tathā hi kauśikāryasatyānāṃ na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika ārya satyānām na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is because the prior limit of the noble truths is not apprehended,

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: the later limit is not apprehended, and the middle is not apprehended.🔽Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is great because of the greatness of the concentrations.

original: dhyānamahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: dhyāna mahadgata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is it so?

original: tathā hi kauśika dhyānānāṃ na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika dhyānānām na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is because the prior limit of the concentrations is not apprehended,

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: the later limit is not apprehended, and the middle is not apprehended.🔽Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is great because of the greatness of the immeasurables.

original: apramāṇamahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: apramāṇa mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is it so?

original: tathā hi kauśikāpramāṇānāṃ na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśikāpramāṇānām na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is because the prior limit of the immeasurables is not apprehended,

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: the later limit is not apprehended, and the middle is not apprehended.🔽Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is great because of the greatness of the formless absorptions.

original: ārūpyasamāpattimahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: ārūpya samāpatti mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is it so?

original: tathā hi kauśikārūpyasamāpattīnāṃ na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika ārūpya samāpattīnām na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: For, Kauśika, the beginning of the formless attainments is not perceived.

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: The end is not perceived, nor is the middle perceived.

original: vimokṣamahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: vimokṣa mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is great because of the greatness of the liberations. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika vimokṣāṇāṃ na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika vimokṣāṇām na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: For, Kauśika, the beginning of the liberations is not perceived.

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: The end is not perceived, nor is the middle perceived.

original: anupūrvavihārasamāpattimahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: anupūrva vihāra samāpatti mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is great because of the greatness of the successive meditative stabilizations. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśikānupūrvavihārasamāpattīnāṃ na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika anupūrva vihāra samāpattīnām na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: For, Kauśika, the beginning of the successive meditative stabilizations is not perceived.

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: The end is not perceived, nor is the middle perceived.

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhamahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukha mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is great because of the greatness of the doors of liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhānāṃ na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhānām na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the emptiness, signless, and wishless gateways to liberation are not apprehended in the past,

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: are not apprehended in the future, and are not apprehended in the present.

original: abhijñāmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: abhijñā mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is a great perfection because of the greatness of the higher knowledges. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśikābhijñānāṃ na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika abhijñānām na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the higher knowledges are not apprehended in the past,

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: are not apprehended in the future, and are not apprehended in the present.

original: samādhimahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: samādhi mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is a great perfection because of the greatness of the meditative stabilizations. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika samādhīnāṃ na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika samādhīnām na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the meditative stabilizations are not apprehended in the past,

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: are not apprehended in the future, and are not apprehended in the present.

original: dhāraṇīmukhamahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: dhāraṇī mukha mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is a great perfection because of the greatness of the dhāraṇī gateways. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika dhāraṇīmukhānāṃ na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika dhāraṇī mukhānām na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the dhāraṇī gateways are not apprehended in the past,

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: the later limit is not apprehended, nor is the middle apprehended.

original: tathāgatabalamahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tathāgata bala mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is the great perfection of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, because of the greatness of the powers of the Tathāgata. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika tathāgatabalānāṃ na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika tathāgata balānām na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is because the limit of the past of the powers of the Tathāgata is not apprehended,

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: the later limit is not apprehended, nor is the middle apprehended.

original: vaiśāradyamahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: vaiśāradya mahadgata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is the great perfection of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, because of the greatness of the fearlessnesses of the Tathāgata. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika
translated: Kauśika, it is because

original: vaiśāradyānāṃ na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: vaiśāradyānām na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: the limit of the past of the fearlessnesses is not apprehended,

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: the later limit is not apprehended, nor is the middle apprehended.

original: pratisaṃvidmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: pratisaṃvid mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is the great perfection of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, because of the greatness of the detailed and thorough knowledges. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika pratisaṃvidāṃ na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika pratisaṃvidām na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is because the limit of the past of the detailed and thorough knowledges is not apprehended,

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: the later limit is not apprehended, nor is the middle apprehended.

original: mahāmaitrīmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānam / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: mahā maitrī mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānam tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings is a great perfection because of the greatness of great friendliness. Why is it so?

original: tathā hi kauśika mahāmaitryā na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika mahāmaitryāḥ na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the limit of the past is not apprehended in great friendliness.

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: The limit of the future is not apprehended. The middle is not apprehended.

original: mahākaruṇāmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā mahadgata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings is a great perfection because of the greatness of great compassion. Why is it so?

original: tathā hi kauśika mahākaruṇāyā na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika mahā karuṇāyāḥ na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the limit of the past is not apprehended in great compassion.

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: The limit of the future is not apprehended. The middle is not apprehended.

original: āveṇikabuddhadharmamahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: āveṇika buddha dharma mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings is a great perfection because of the greatness of the great special qualities of a buddha. Why is it so?

original: tathā hi kauśikāveṇikabuddhadharmāṇāṃ na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika āveṇika buddha dharmāṇām na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the limit of the past is not apprehended in the great special qualities of a buddha.

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: The limit of the future is not apprehended. The middle is not apprehended.

original: sarvajñatāmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: sarvajña tā mahadgata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The great perfection of wisdom is a great perfection because of the greatness of omniscience, said Subhuti.

original: tathā hi kauśika sarvajñatāyā na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika sarvajña tāyāḥ na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because the beginning of omniscience is not apprehended, said Subhuti.

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: The middle is not apprehended, and the end is not apprehended.

original: mārgākārajñatāmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tā mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The great perfection of wisdom is a great perfection because of the greatness of the knowledge of path aspects, said Subhuti.

original: tathā hi kauśika mārgākārajñatāyā na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika mārga ākāra jña tāyāḥ na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because the beginning of the knowledge of path aspects is not apprehended, said Subhuti.

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: The middle is not apprehended, and the end is not apprehended.

original: sarvākārajñatāmahadgatatayā kauśika mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā mahat gata tayā kauśika mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The great perfection of wisdom is a great perfection because of the greatness of the knowledge of all aspects, said Subhuti.

original: tathā hi kauśika sarvākārajñatāyā na pūrvānta upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ na pūrva antaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Because the beginning of the knowledge of all aspects is not apprehended, said Subhuti.

original: nāparānta upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na apara antaḥ upalabhyate na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: The middle is not apprehended, and the end is not apprehended.

original: anena kauśika paryāyeṇa mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ yad uta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: anena kauśika paryāyeṇa mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: For this reason, Kausika, the perfection of wisdom is the great perfection of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings.

original: rūpāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: rūpa apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the immeasurability of form, Kauśika, this is the immeasurably great perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika rūpasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika rūpasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the measure of form is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the measure of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika rūpasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika rūpasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the measure of form is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā rūpāparimāṇatā rūpāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā rūpa aparimāṇa tā rūpa aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because of the immeasurability of space, the immeasurability of form, and the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom because of the immeasurability of form.

original: vedanāparimāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: vedanā parimāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the immeasurability of feeling, Kauśika, this is the immeasurably great perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika vedanāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika vedanāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the measure of feeling is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the measure of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika vedanāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika vedanāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the measure of feeling is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā vedanāparimāṇatā
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā vedanā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because of the immeasurability of space, the immeasurability of feeling,

original: vedanāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: vedanā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: and the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom because of the immeasurability of feeling.

original: saṃjñāparimāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: saṃjñā parimāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom is the immeasurableness because of the immeasurableness of perception. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika saṃjñāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika saṃjñāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the measurableness of perception is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the measurableness of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika saṃjñāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika saṃjñāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the measurableness of perception is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā saṃjñāparimāṇatā saṃjñāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā saṃjñā parimāṇa tā saṃjñā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The immeasurableness of perception is due to the immeasurableness of space. The immeasurableness of the perfection of wisdom is due to the immeasurableness of perception.

original: saṃskārāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika saṃskārāṇāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: saṃskāra apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom is the immeasurableness because of the immeasurableness of volitional formations. And why?🔽Because, Kauśika, the measurableness of volitional formations is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the measurableness of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika saṃskārāṇāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika saṃskārāṇām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the measurableness of volitional formations is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā saṃskārāparimāṇatā saṃskārāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā saṃskāra aparimāṇa tā saṃskāra aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The immeasurableness of volitional formations is due to the immeasurableness of space. The immeasurableness of the perfection of wisdom is due to the immeasurableness of volitional formations.

original: vijñānāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: vijñāna apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the immeasurability of consciousness, Kauśika, this perfection is the immeasurable perfection of bodhisattva great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika vijñānasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika vijñānasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the measurability of consciousness is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the measurability of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika vijñānasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika vijñānasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the measurability of consciousness is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā vijñānāparimāṇatā vijñānāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā vijñāna aparimāṇa tā vijñāna aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because of the immeasurability of consciousness, the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.

original: cakṣurapramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the immeasurability of the eye, Kauśika, this perfection is the immeasurable perfection of bodhisattva great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika cakṣuṣaḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika cakṣuṣaḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the measurability of the eye is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the measurability of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika cakṣuṣaḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika cakṣuṣaḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the measurability of the eye is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā cakṣuraparimāṇatā cakṣuraparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā cakṣuḥ aparimāṇa tā cakṣuḥ aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because of the immeasurability of the eye, the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.

original: śrotrāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: śrotra apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is a limitless perfection because of the limitless ear. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika śrotrasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika śrotrasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is because the measure of the ear is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is just as the measure of space is not apprehended.

original: evam eva kauśika śrotrasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika śrotrasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the measure of the ear is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā śrotrāparimāṇatā śrotrāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā śrotra aparimāṇa tā śrotra aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The ear is limitless because of the limitless space. The perfection of wisdom is limitless because of the limitlessness of the ear.

original: ghrāṇāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: ghrāṇa apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is a limitless perfection because of the limitless nose. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika ghrāṇasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika ghrāṇasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is because the measure of the nose is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is just as the measure of space is not apprehended.

original: evam eva kauśika ghrāṇasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika ghrāṇasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the measure of the nose is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā ghrāṇāparimāṇatā ghrāṇāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā ghrāṇa aparimāṇa tā ghrāṇa aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The nose is limitless because of the limitless space. The perfection of wisdom is limitless because of the limitlessness of the nose.

original: jihvāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: jihvā pramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of the tongue. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika ghrāṇasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika ghrāṇasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the measurability of the tongue is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: It is just as, Kauśika, the measurability of space is not apprehended.

original: evam eva kauśika jihvāyāḥ
analyzed: evam eva kauśika jihvāyāḥ
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the measurability of the tongue

original: pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā jihvāparimāṇatā jihvāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā jihvā parimāṇa tā jihvā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because of the immeasurability of space, the immeasurability of the tongue; because of the immeasurability of the tongue, the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.

original: kāyāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: kāya apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of the body. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika kāyasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika kāyasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the measurability of the body is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: It is just as, Kauśika, the measurability of space is not apprehended.🔽In the same way, Kauśika, the measurability of the body

original: evam eva kauśika kāyasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika kāyasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā kāyāparimāṇatā kāyāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā kāya aparimāṇa tā kāya aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because of the immeasurability of space, the immeasurability of the body; because of the immeasurability of the body, the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.

original: manopramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ pramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the immeasurability of the mind, Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom is the immeasurable perfection of bodhisattva great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika manasaḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika manasaḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the measure of the mind is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the measure of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika manasaḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika manasaḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the measure of the mind is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā manoparimāṇatā manoparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā manaḥ parimāṇa tā manaḥ parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because of the immeasurability of space, the immeasurability of the mind; because of the immeasurability of the mind, the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.

original: rūpāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: rūpa apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the immeasurability of form, Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom is the immeasurable perfection of bodhisattva great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika rūpasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika rūpasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the measure of form is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the measure of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika rūpasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika rūpasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the measure of form is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā rūpāparimāṇatā rūpāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā rūpa aparimāṇa tā rūpa aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because of the immeasurability of space, the immeasurability of form; because of the immeasurability of form, the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.

original: śabdāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: śabda apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom is an unlimited perfection for the bodhisattva great beings because of the unlimitedness of sound. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika śabdasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika śabdasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the measure of sound is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate

original: evam eva kauśika ghrāṇasaṃsparśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika ghrāṇa saṃsparśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the extent of tongue contact is nowhere to be apprehended.🔽Because the extent of tongue contact is not apprehended, therefore, Kauśika, the extent of the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended.🔽Because the extent of tongue contact is not apprehended, therefore, Kauśika, the extent of the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā ghrāṇasaṃsparśāparimāṇatā ghrāṇasaṃsparśāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /🔽jihvāsaṃsparśāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā ghrāṇa saṃsparśa aparimāṇa tā ghrāṇa saṃsparśa aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā  jihvā saṃsparśa apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because the extent of body contact is not apprehended, therefore, Kauśika, the extent of the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended.🔽Because the extent of mind contact is not apprehended, therefore, Kauśika, the extent of the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended.🔽Because the extent of mind contact is not apprehended, therefore, Kauśika, the extent of the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended.🔽Because the extent of mind contact is not apprehended, therefore, Kauśika, the extent of the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended.

original: tathā hi kauśika jihvāsaṃsparśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika jihvā saṃsparśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because the extent of mind contact is not apprehended, therefore, Kauśika, the extent of the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /🔽evam eva kauśika jihvāsaṃsparśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate  evam eva kauśika jihvā saṃsparśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because the extent of mind contact is not apprehended, therefore, Kauśika, the extent of the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended.🔽Because the extent of mind contact is not apprehended, therefore, Kauśika, the extent of the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended.🔽Because the extent of mind contact is not apprehended, therefore, Kauśika, the extent of the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended.🔽Because the extent of mind contact is not apprehended, therefore, Kauśika, the extent of the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā jihvāsaṃsparśāparimāṇatā jihvāsaṃsparśāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā jihvā saṃsparśa aparimāṇa tā jihvā saṃsparśa aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because the extent of mind contact is not apprehended, therefore, Kauśika, the extent of the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended.🔽Because the extent of mind contact is not apprehended, therefore

original: kāyasaṃsparśāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: kāya saṃsparśa apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the immeasurability of the body sense field, Kauśika, this is the immeasurably great perfection of the bodhisattva great beings. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika kāyasaṃsparśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika kāya saṃsparśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the body sense field is not apprehended as measurable.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: It is just as, Kauśika, space is not apprehended as measurable.

original: evam eva kauśika kāyasaṃsparśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika kāya saṃsparśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the body sense field is not apprehended as measurable.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā kāyasaṃsparśāparimāṇatā kāyasaṃsparśāparimāṇatayā
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā kāya saṃsparśa aparimāṇa tā kāya saṃsparśa aparimāṇa tayā
translated: Because of the immeasurability of the body sense field, the immeasurability of space is shown.

original: prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because of the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.

original: manaḥsaṃsparśāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ saṃsparśa apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the immeasurability of the mind sense field, Kauśika, this is the immeasurably great perfection of the bodhisattva great beings. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika manaḥsaṃsparśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika manaḥ saṃsparśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the mind sense field is not apprehended as measurable.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: It is just as, Kauśika, space is not apprehended as measurable.

original: evam eva kauśika manaḥsaṃsparśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika manaḥ saṃsparśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the mind sense field is not apprehended as measurable.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā manaḥsaṃsparśāparimāṇatā manaḥsaṃsparśāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā manaḥ saṃsparśa aparimāṇa tā manaḥ saṃsparśa aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The immeasurability of mind contact is due to the immeasurability of space. The immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom is due to the immeasurability of mind contact.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā pramāṇa tayā kauśika a pramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is a perfection of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas that is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is because a measure of the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, just as a measure of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, a measure of the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāparimāṇatā cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā parimāṇa tā cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The immeasurability of the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact is due to the immeasurability of space. The immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom is due to the immeasurability of the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact.

original: śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā pramāṇa tayā kauśika a pramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is a perfection of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas that is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of the feeling that arises from the condition of ear contact. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the extent of ear-contact as a condition for feeling is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is just as the extent of space is not apprehended.

original: evam eva kauśika śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the extent of ear-contact as a condition for feeling is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāparimāṇatā śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā parimāṇa tā śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because the extent of ear-contact as a condition for feeling is not apprehended, the extent of the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended.

original: ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā pramāṇa tayā kauśika a pramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings is the immeasurable because of the immeasurability of nose-contact as a condition for feeling. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the extent of nose-contact as a condition for feeling is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is just as the extent of space is not apprehended.

original: evam eva kauśika ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the extent of nose-contact as a condition for feeling is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāparimāṇatā ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā parimāṇa tā ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The vastness of the nose-contact-as-condition-for-feeling is the vastness of the perfection of wisdom.

original: jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā pramāṇa tayā kauśika a pramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is the vast extent of the perfection of wisdom for the bodhisattva great beings, because the extent of the nose-contact-as-condition-for-feeling is not apprehended.🔽Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: tathā hi kauśika jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the extent of nose-contact-as-condition-for-feeling is not apprehended.🔽The vastness of the nose-contact-as-condition-for-feeling is the vastness of the perfection of wisdom.🔽Kauśika, this is the vast extent of the perfection of wisdom for the bodhisattva great beings, because the extent of tongue-contact-as-condition-for-feeling is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the extent of tongue-contact-as-condition-for-feeling is not apprehended.🔽The vastness of the tongue-contact-as-condition-for-feeling is the vastness of the perfection of wisdom.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāparimāṇatā jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā parimāṇa tā jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Kauśika, this is the vast extent of the perfection of wisdom for the bodhisattva great beings, because the extent of body-contact-as-condition-for-feeling is not apprehended.🔽Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāpramāṇatayā 🔽kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā pramāṇa tayā 🔽kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the extent of body-contact-as-condition-for-feeling is not apprehended.

original: tathā hi kauśika kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the extent of the feeling that arises from the contact with the body is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is just as the extent of space is not apprehended.

original: evam eva kauśika kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the extent of the feeling that arises from the contact with the body is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāparimāṇatā kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā parimāṇa tā kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because the feeling that arises from the contact with the body is limitless due to space being limitless, and the perfection of wisdom is limitless due to the feeling that arises from the contact with the body being limitless.

original: manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā pramāṇa tayā kauśika a pramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattvas, the great beings, is a limitless perfection due to the limitless feeling that arises from the contact with the mind. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the extent of the feeling that arises from the contact with the eye is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is just as the extent of space is not apprehended.

original: evam eva kauśika cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the extent of the feeling that arises from the contact with the eye is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāparimāṇatā cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā parimāṇa tā cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of the eye-contact-produced feeling is the extent of the perfection of wisdom.

original: pṛthivīdhātvapramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika pṛthivīdhātoḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: pṛthivī dhātu apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika pṛthivī dhātoḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, this is the extent of the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings because the earth element is immeasurable. Why is that?🔽Kauśika, it is because a measure of the earth element is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, just as a measure of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika pṛthivīdhātoḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika pṛthivī dhātoḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, a measure of the earth element is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā pṛthivīdhātvaparimāṇatā pṛthivīdhātvaparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā pṛthivī dhātu aparimāṇa tā pṛthivī dhātu aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of the earth element is the extent of the perfection of wisdom.

original: abdhātvapramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśikābdhātoḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: ap dhātu apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika ap dhātoḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, this is the extent of the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings because the water element is immeasurable. Why is that?🔽Kauśika, it is because a measure of the water element is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, just as a measure of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśikābdhātoḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika ap dhātoḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the extent of the water element is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā abdhātvaparimāṇatā abdhātvaparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā ap dhātu aparimāṇa tā ap dhātu aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The water element is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of space. The perfection of wisdom is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of the water element.

original: tejodhātvapramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika tejodhātoḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tejaḥ dhātu apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika tejaḥ dhātoḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, for the bodhisattva great beings, this is a perfection of immeasurability because of the immeasurability of the fire element. Why is that?🔽Kauśika, it is because the extent of the fire element is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika tejodhātoḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika tejaḥ dhātoḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the extent of the fire element is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā tejodhātvaparimāṇatā tejodhātvaparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā tejaḥ dhātu aparimāṇa tā tejaḥ dhātu aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The fire element is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of space. The perfection of wisdom is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of the fire element.

original: vāyudhātvapramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika vāyudhātoḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: vāyu dhātu apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika vāyu dhātoḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, for the bodhisattva great beings, this is a perfection of immeasurability because of the immeasurability of the wind element. Why is that?🔽Kauśika, it is because the extent of the wind element is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika vāyudhātoḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika vāyu dhātoḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, no extent of the wind element is apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā vāyudhātvaparimāṇatā vāyudhātvaparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /🔽ākāśadhātvapramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā vāyu dhātu aparimāṇa tā vāyu dhātu aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā  ākāśa dhātu apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam
translated: The wind element is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of space. The perfection of wisdom is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of the wind element.

original: bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika ākāśadhātoḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśike ākāśa dhātoḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, this perfection is immeasurable for the bodhisattva great beings because of the immeasurability of the space element. Why is that?🔽Kauśika, it is because no extent of the space element is apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, no extent of space is apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśikākāśadhātoḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika ākāśa dhātoḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, no extent of the space element is apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā ākāśadhātvaparimāṇatā ākāśadhātvaparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā ākāśa dhātu aparimāṇa tā ākāśa dhātu aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The space element is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of space. The perfection of wisdom is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of the space element.

original: vijñānadhātvapramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika vijñānadhātoḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: vijñāna dhātu apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika vijñāna dhātoḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, this perfection is immeasurable for the bodhisattva great beings because of the immeasurability of the consciousness element. Why is that?🔽Kauśika, it is because no extent of the consciousness element is apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, no extent of space is apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika vijñānadhātoḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika vijñāna dhātoḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the extent of the consciousness element is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā vijñānadhātvaparimāṇatā vijñānadhātvaparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā vijñāna dhātu aparimāṇa tā vijñāna dhātu aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of the consciousness element is the extent of the perfection of wisdom.

original: avidyāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśikāvidyāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: avidyā pramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika avidyāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, this is the immeasurable perfection of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, because of the immeasurability of ignorance. Why is that?🔽Kauśika, it is because the extent of ignorance is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśikāvidyāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
