analyzed: evam eva kauśika avidyāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the extent of ignorance is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā avidyāparimāṇatā avidyāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā avidyā parimāṇa tā avidyā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The immeasurability of ignorance is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.

original: saṃskārāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika saṃskārāṇāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: saṃskāra apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika saṃskārāṇām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, this is the immeasurable perfection of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, because of the immeasurability of volitional formations. Why is that?🔽Kauśika, it is because the extent of volitional formations is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika saṃskārāṇāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika saṃskārāṇām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the extent of the formative predispositions is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā saṃskārāparimāṇatā saṃskārāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā saṃskāra aparimāṇa tā saṃskāra aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of the formative predispositions is the extent of the perfection of wisdom, because of the infinitude of the formative predispositions.

original: vijñānāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: vijñāna apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is a perfection of the bodhisattva great beings that is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of consciousness. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika vijñānasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika vijñānasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: It is because the extent of consciousness is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika vijñānasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika vijñānasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the extent of consciousness is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā vijñānāparimāṇatā vijñānāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā vijñāna aparimāṇa tā vijñāna aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The infinitude of consciousness is the infinitude of the perfection of wisdom, because of the infinitude of consciousness.

original: nāmarūpāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānam / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika nāmarūpasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: nāma rūpa apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānam tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika nāma rūpasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, this is a perfection of the bodhisattva great beings that is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of name and form. And why?🔽It is because the extent of name and form is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika nāmarūpasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika nāma rūpasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the extent of name and form is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā nāmarūpāparimāṇatā nāmarūpāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā nāma rūpa aparimāṇa tā nāma rūpa aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā aparimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of name and form is the extent of the perfection of wisdom.

original: ṣaḍāyatanāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: ṣaṣ āyatana apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is a perfection of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas that is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of the six sense bases. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika ṣaḍāyatanasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika ṣaṣ āyatanasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is because the extent of the six sense bases is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika ṣaḍāyatanasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /🔽ākāśāparimāṇatayā
analyzed: evam eva kauśika ṣaṣ āyatanasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate  ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the extent of the six sense bases is not apprehended.

original: ṣaḍāyatanāparimāṇatā ṣaḍāyatanāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ṣaṣ āyatana aparimāṇa tā ṣaṣ āyatana aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of the six sense bases is the extent of the perfection of wisdom.

original: sparśāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika sparśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: sparśa apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika sparśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, this is a perfection of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas that is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of contact. Why is that?🔽Kauśika, it is because the extent of contact is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika sparśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika sparśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the extent of contact is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā sparśāparimāṇatā sparśāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā sparśa aparimāṇa tā sparśa aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of contact is the extent of the perfection of wisdom.

original: vedanāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: vedanā pramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is the unlimited perfection of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas because of the unlimitedness of feeling. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika vedanāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika vedanāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the extent of feeling is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika vedanāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika vedanāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the extent of feeling is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā vedanāparimāṇatā vedanāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā vedanā parimāṇa tā vedanā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of feeling is the extent of the perfection of wisdom.

original: tṛṣṇāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika tṛṣṇāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā pramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika tṛṣṇāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, this is the unlimited perfection of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas because of the unlimitedness of craving. Why is that?🔽Because, Kauśika, the extent of craving is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika tṛṣṇāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika tṛṣṇāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the extent of craving is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā tṛṣṇāparimāṇatā tṛṣṇāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā tṛṣṇā aparimāṇa tā tṛṣṇā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of craving is due to the immeasurability of space. The extent of the perfection of wisdom is due to the extent of craving.

original: upādānāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśikopādānasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: upādāna apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika upādānasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, this is the immeasurable perfection of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas due to the immeasurability of grasping. Why is that?🔽It is because the extent of grasping is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśikopādānasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika upādānasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the extent of grasping is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā upādānāparimāṇatā upādānāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā upādāna aparimāṇa tā upādāna aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of the perfection of wisdom is due to the extent of grasping.

original: bhavāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika bhavasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /🔽tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: bhava apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika bhavasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate  tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, this is the immeasurable perfection of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas due to the immeasurability of becoming. Why is that?🔽It is because the extent of becoming is not apprehended.🔽Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika bhavasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika bhavasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the extent of becoming is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā bhavāparimāṇatā bhavāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā bhava aparimāṇa tā bhava aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The immeasurability of existence is due to the immeasurability of space. The immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom is due to the immeasurability of existence.

original: jātyapramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika jāteḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: jāti apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika jāteḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, this is the immeasurable perfection of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas due to the immeasurability of birth. Why is that?🔽It is because the measure of birth is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the measure of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika jāteḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika jāteḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the measure of birth is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā jātyaparimāṇatā jātyaparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā jāti aparimāṇa tā jāti aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The immeasurability of birth is due to the immeasurability of space. The immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom is due to the immeasurability of birth.

original: jarāmaraṇāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoh /🔽tathā hi kauśika jarāmaranasya pramāṇaṃ
analyzed: jarā maraṇa apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya  tathā hi kauśika jarā maranasya pramāṇam
translated: Kauśika, this is the immeasurable perfection of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas due to the immeasurability of old age and death. Why is that?

original: nopalabhyate /🔽tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: na upalabhyate  tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: It is because the measure of old age and death is not apprehended.🔽Just as, Kauśika, the measure of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika jarāmaraṇasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika jarā maraṇasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the measure of old age and death is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā jarāmaraṇāparimāṇatā jarāmaraṇāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā jarā maraṇa aparimāṇa tā jarā maraṇa aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The immeasurability of old age and death is due to the immeasurability of space. The immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom is due to the immeasurability of old age and death.

original: dānapāramitāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: dāna pāramitā pramāṇa tayā kauśika a pramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is the immeasurable perfection of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, due to the immeasurability of the perfection of giving. Why is it so?

original: tathā hi kauśika dānapāramitāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika dāna pāramitāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: It is because the measure of the perfection of giving is not perceived.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the measure of space is not perceived,

original: evam eva kauśika dānapāramitāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika dāna pāramitāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the measure of the perfection of giving is not perceived.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā dānapāramitāparimāṇatā dānapāramitāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā dāna pāramitā parimāṇa tā dāna pāramitā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The immeasurability of the perfection of giving is due to the immeasurability of space. The immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom is due to the immeasurability of the perfection of giving.

original: śīlapāramitāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika śīlapāramitāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: śīla pāramitā pramāṇa tayā kauśika a pramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika śīla pāramitāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, this is the immeasurable perfection of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, due to the immeasurability of the perfection of morality. Why is it so?🔽It is because the measure of the perfection of morality is not perceived.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the measure of space is not perceived,

original: evam eva kauśika śīlapāramitāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika śīla pāramitāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Similarly, Kauśika, the extent of the perfection of morality is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā śīlapāramitāparimāṇatā śīlapāramitāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā śīla pāramitā parimāṇa tā śīla pāramitā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of the perfection of morality is the extent of the perfection of wisdom, due to the infinitude of space.

original: kṣāntipāramitāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: kṣānti pāramitā apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is an immeasurable perfection due to the immeasurability of the perfection of patience. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika kṣāntipāramitāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika kṣānti pāramitāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is because the extent of the perfection of patience is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is just as the extent of space is not apprehended.

original: evam eva kauśika kṣāntipāramitāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika kṣānti pāramitāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Similarly, Kauśika, the extent of the perfection of patience is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā kṣāntipāramitāparimāṇatā kṣāntipāramitāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā kṣānti pāramitā parimāṇa tā kṣānti pāramitā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of the perfection of patience is the extent of the perfection of wisdom, due to the infinitude of space.

original: vīryapāramitāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: vīrya pāramitā pramāṇa tayā kauśika a pramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is an immeasurable perfection due to the immeasurability of the perfection of effort. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika vīryapāramitāyaḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika vīrya pāramitā ayaḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is because the extent of the perfection of effort is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /🔽evam eva kauśika vīryapāramitāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate  evam eva kauśika vīrya pāramitāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,🔽just so, Kauśika, the extent of the perfection of perseverance is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā vīryapāramitāparimāṇatā vīryapāramitāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā vīrya pāramitā parimāṇa tā vīrya pāramitā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of the perfection of perseverance is not apprehended because of the infinitude of space. The extent of the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended because of the infinitude of the perfection of perseverance.

original: dhyānapāramitāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitā apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is an unlimited perfection because of the unlimitedness of the perfection of concentration. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika dhyānapāramitāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika dhyāna pāramitāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the extent of the perfection of concentration is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika dhyānapāramitāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika dhyāna pāramitāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: just so, Kauśika, the extent of the perfection of concentration is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā dhyānapāramitāparimāṇatā dhyānapāramitāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā dhyāna pāramitā parimāṇa tā dhyāna pāramitā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of the perfection of concentration is not apprehended because of the infinitude of space. The extent of the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended because of the infinitude of the perfection of concentration.

original: prajñāpāramitāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā pramāṇa tayā kauśika a pramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is an unlimited perfection because of the unlimitedness of the perfection of wisdom. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the measure of the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the measure of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /🔽ākāśāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate  ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the measure of the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended.🔽The immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom is due to the immeasurability of space.

original: adhyātmaśūnyatāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: adhyātma śūnyatā apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas is an immeasurable perfection because of the immeasurability of internal emptiness. Why is it so?

original: tathā hi kauśikādhyātmaśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika adhyātma śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the measure of internal emptiness is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the measure of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśikādhyātmaśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika adhyātma śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the measure of internal emptiness is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā adhyātmaśūnyatāparimāṇatā adhyātmaśūnyatāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā adhyātma śūnyatā parimāṇa tā adhyātma śūnyatā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom is due to the immeasurability of internal emptiness.

original: bahirdhāśūnyatāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: bahirdhā śūnyatā apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the immeasurability of external emptiness, Kauśika, this perfection is the immeasurable perfection of bodhisattva great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika bahirdhāśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because the measure of external emptiness is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the measure of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika bahirdhāśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: just so, Kauśika, the measure of external emptiness is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā bahirdhāśūnyatāparimāṇatā bahirdhāśūnyatāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā bahirdhā śūnyatā parimāṇa tā bahirdhā śūnyatā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because of the immeasurability of space, the immeasurability of external emptiness, and because of the immeasurability of external emptiness, the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the immeasurability of internal and external emptiness, Kauśika, this perfection is the immeasurable perfection of bodhisattva great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśikādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam nā upalabhyate
translated: Because the measure of internal and external emptiness is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the measure of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśikādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: just so, Kauśika, the measure of internal and external emptiness is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāparimāṇatā adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /🔽śūnyatāśūnyatāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā parimāṇa tā adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā  śūnyatā aśūnyatā apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The immeasurability of the emptiness of both internal and external is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.

original: tathā hi kauśika śūnyatāśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /🔽tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /🔽evam eva kauśika śūnyatāśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika śūnyatā aśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate  tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate  evam eva kauśika śūnyatā aśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: The immeasurability of the emptiness of emptiness is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The immeasurability of the emptiness of the great is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The immeasurability of the emptiness of the ultimate is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The immeasurability of the emptiness of the conditioned is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The immeasurability of the emptiness of the unconditioned is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The immeasurability of the emptiness of the infinite is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The immeasurability of the emptiness of the beginningless is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The immeasurability of the emptiness of the endless is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The immeasurability of the emptiness of nature is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The immeasurability of the emptiness of all phenomena is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The immeasurability of the emptiness of non-apprehension is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The immeasurability of the emptiness of inherent nature is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The immeasurability of the emptiness of non-existence is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The immeasurability of the emptiness of existence is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The immeasurability of the emptiness of essence is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The immeasurability of the emptiness of non-things is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.🔽The immeasurability of the emptiness of self-existence is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā śūnyatāśūnyatāparimāṇatā śūnyatāśūnyatāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /🔽mahāśūnyatāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika mahāśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /🔽tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā śūnyatā aśūnyatā parimāṇa tā śūnyatā śūnyatā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā  mahā śūnyatā apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika mahāśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate  tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam
translated: The immeasurability of the emptiness of other-existence is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.

original: nopalabhyate /
analyzed: na upalabhyate
translated: The im

original: evam eva kauśika mahāśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika mahāśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the extent of the great emptiness is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā mahāśūnyatāparimāṇatā mahāśūnyatāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā mahā śūnyatā parimāṇa tā mahā śūnyatā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of the great emptiness is the extent of the perfection of wisdom,

original: paramārthaśūnyatāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: paramārtha śūnyatā apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: because of the extent of ultimate emptiness, Kauśika, this is the immeasurable perfection of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika paramārthaśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika paramārtha śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: It is because the extent of ultimate emptiness is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika paramārthaśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika paramārtha śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the extent of ultimate emptiness is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā paramārthaśūnyatāparimāṇatā paramārthaśūnyatāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā paramārtha śūnyatā parimāṇa tā paramārtha śūnyatā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of ultimate emptiness is the extent of the perfection of wisdom,

original: saṃskṛtaśūnyatāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: saṃskṛta śūnyatā pramāṇa tayā kauśika a pramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: because of the extent of conditioned emptiness, Kauśika, this is the immeasurable perfection of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika saṃskṛtaśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika saṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: It is because the extent of conditioned emptiness is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika saṃskṛtaśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika saṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: just so, Kauśika, the extent of the emptiness of conditioned phenomena is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā saṃskṛtaśūnyatāparimāṇatā saṃskṛtaśūnyatāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā saṃskṛta śūnyatā parimāṇa tā saṃskṛta śūnyatā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of the emptiness of conditioned phenomena is the extent of the perfection of wisdom.

original: asaṃskṛtaśūnyatāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: asaṃskṛta śūnyatā pramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings is of unlimited extent because of the unlimited extent of the emptiness of the unconditioned. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśikāsaṃskṛtaśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika asaṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is because the extent of the emptiness of the unconditioned is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśikāsaṃskṛtaśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika asaṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: just so, Kauśika, the extent of the emptiness of the unconditioned is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā asaṃskṛtaśūnyatāparimāṇatā asaṃskṛtaśūnyatāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā asaṃskṛta śūnyatā parimāṇa tā asaṃskṛta śūnyatā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of the emptiness of the unconditioned is the extent of the perfection of wisdom.

original: atyantaśūnyatāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: atyanta śūnyatā apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings is of unlimited extent because of the unlimited extent of the emptiness of the ultimate. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśikātyantaśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika atyanta śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the extent of ultimate emptiness is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśikātyantaśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika atyanta śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the extent of ultimate emptiness is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimaṇatayā atyantaśūnyatāparimāṇatā atyantaśūnyatāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimaṇa tayā atyanta śūnyatā parimāṇa tā atyanta śūnyatā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because of the infinitude of space, the infinitude of ultimate emptiness; because of the infinitude of ultimate emptiness, the infinitude of the perfection of wisdom.

original: anavarāgraśūnyatāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: an avara agra śūnyatā apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings is an immeasurable perfection because of the immeasurability of the emptiness of no beginning or end. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśikānavarāgraśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika an avara agra śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the extent of the emptiness of no beginning or end is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśikānavarāgraśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika an avara agra śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the extent of the emptiness of no beginning or end is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā anavarāgraśūnyatāparimāṇatā anavarāgraśūnyatāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā anavara agra śūnyatā parimāṇa tā anavara agra śūnyatā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because of the infinitude of space, the infinitude of the emptiness of no beginning or end; because of the infinitude of the emptiness of no beginning or end, the infinitude of the perfection of wisdom.

original: anavakāraśūnyatāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: an avakāra śūnyatā apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is immeasurable because the emptiness of non-rejection is immeasurable. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśikānavakāraśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika anavakāra śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam nā upalabhyate
translated: It is because the measure of the emptiness of non-rejection is not perceived.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the measure of space is not perceived,

original: evam eva kauśikānavakāraśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika anavakāra śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam nā upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the measure of the emptiness of non-rejection is not perceived.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā anavakāraśūnyatāparimāṇatā anavakāraśūnyatāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā anavakāra śūnyatā parimāṇa tā anavakāra śūnyatā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The measure of the perfection of wisdom is immeasurable because the measure of the emptiness of non-rejection is immeasurable.

original: prakṛtiśūnyatāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika prakṛtiśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /🔽tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatā apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika prakṛti śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate  tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: The perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is immeasurable because the emptiness of inherent nature is immeasurable. Why is that?🔽It is because the measure of the emptiness of inherent nature is not perceived.🔽Just as, Kauśika, the measure of space is not perceived,

original: evam eva kauśika prakṛtiśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika prakṛti śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the measure of the emptiness of inherent nature is not perceived.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā prakṛtiśūnyatāparimāṇatā prakṛtiśūnyatāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā prakṛti śūnyatā parimāṇa tā prakṛti śūnyatā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom is due to the immeasurability of the emptiness of inherent nature.

original: sarvadharmaśūnyatāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: sarva dharma śūnyatā apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is the immeasurable perfection of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, due to the immeasurability of the emptiness of all phenomena. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika sarvadharmaśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika sarva dharma śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the measure of the emptiness of all phenomena is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the measure of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika sarvadharmaśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika sarva dharma śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the measure of the emptiness of all phenomena is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā sarvadharmaśūnyatāparimāṇatā sarvadharmaśūnyatāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā sarva dharma śūnyatā parimāṇa tā sarva dharma śūnyatā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom is due to the immeasurability of the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is the immeasurable perfection of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, due to the immeasurability of the emptiness of specific characteristics. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the measure of the emptiness of specific characteristics is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: just so, Kauśika, the extent of the emptiness of its own marks is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāparimāṇatā svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā parimāṇa tā sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of the emptiness of its own marks is the extent of the perfection of wisdom.

original: anupalambhaśūnyatāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: anupalambha śūnyatā apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings is an immeasurable perfection because of the immeasurability of the emptiness of non-apprehension. Why is it so?

original: tathā hi kauśikānupalambhaśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika anupalambha śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the extent of the emptiness of non-apprehension is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśikānupalambhaśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika anupalambha śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: just so, Kauśika, the extent of the emptiness of non-apprehension is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā anupalambhaśūnyatāparimāṇatā anupalambhaśūnyatāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā anupalambha śūnyatā parimāṇa tā anupalambha śūnyatā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of the emptiness of non-apprehension is the extent of the perfection of wisdom.

original: abhāvaśūnyatāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: abhāva śūnyatā apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of the emptiness of non-existence. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśikāabhāvaśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika abhāva śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the measure of the emptiness of non-existence is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: It is just as, Kauśika, the measure of space is not apprehended.

original: evam eva kauśikābhāvaśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika abhāva śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the measure of the emptiness of non-existence is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā abhāvaśūnyatāparimāṇatā abhāvaśūnyatāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā abhāva śūnyatā parimāṇa tā abhāva śūnyatā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because the immeasurability of space is the immeasurability of the emptiness of non-existence. The immeasurability of the emptiness of non-existence is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.

original: svabhāvaśūnyatāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: svabhāva śūnyatā apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of the emptiness of own-nature. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika svabhāvaśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the measure of the emptiness of own-nature is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: It is just as, Kauśika, the measure of space is not apprehended.

original: evam eva kauśika svabhāvaśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the measure of the emptiness of own-nature is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā svabhāvaśūnyatāparimāṇatā svabhāvaśūnyatāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā svabhāva śūnyatā parimāṇa tā svabhāva śūnyatā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The immeasurability of the emptiness of inherent nature is due to the immeasurability of space. The immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom is due to the immeasurability of the emptiness of inherent nature.

original: abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is a perfection of the bodhisattva great beings that is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of the emptiness of the nature of non-existence. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśikābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam nā upalabhyate
translated: It is because the measure of the emptiness of the nature of non-existence is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, just as the measure of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśikābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ pramāṇam nā upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the measure of the emptiness of the nature of non-existence is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāparimāṇatā adhyātmaśūnyatāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā parimāṇa tā adhyātma śūnyatā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The immeasurability of the emptiness of the nature of non-existence is due to the immeasurability of space. The immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom is due to the immeasurability of the emptiness of internal phenomena.

original: smṛtyupasthānāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: smṛti upasthāna apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is a perfection of the bodhisattva great beings that is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of the applications of mindfulness. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika smṛtyupasthānānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika smṛti upasthānānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: It is because the measure of the applications of mindfulness is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika smṛtyupasthānānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika smṛti upasthānānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: just so, Kauśika, the extent of the applications of mindfulness is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā smṛtyupasthānāparimāṇatā smṛtyupasthānāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā smṛti upasthāna aparimāṇa tā smṛti upasthāna aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of the applications of mindfulness is not apprehended because of the infinitude of space. The extent of the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended because of the infinitude of the applications of mindfulness.

original: samyakprahāṇāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika samyakprahāṇānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: samyak prahāṇa apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika samyakprahāṇānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, this is the perfection of the bodhisattva great beings, the infinitude because of the infinitude of the right efforts. Why is that?🔽Kauśika, it is because the extent of the right efforts is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika samyakprahāṇānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika samyakprahāṇānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: just so, Kauśika, the extent of the right efforts is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā samyakprahāṇāparimāṇatā samyakprahāṇāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā samyak prahāṇa aparimāṇa tā samyak prahāṇa aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of the right efforts is not apprehended because of the infinitude of space. The extent of the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended because of the infinitude of the right efforts.

original: ṛddhipādāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: ṛddhipāda apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is the perfection of the bodhisattva great beings, the infinitude because of the infinitude of the bases of supernatural power. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika ṛddhipādāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika ṛddhipādām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the measure of the bases of supernatural power is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is just as the measure of space is not apprehended.

original: evam eva kauśika ṛddhipādānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika ṛddhipādānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the measure of the bases of supernatural power is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā ṛddhipādāparimāṇatā ṛddhipādāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /🔽indriyāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā ṛddhipāda aparimāṇa tā ṛddhipāda aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā  indriya apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām
translated: Because of the infinitude of space, the bases of supernatural power are infinite. Because of the infinitude of the bases of supernatural power, the perfection of wisdom is infinite.

original: mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is a perfection of the bodhisattva great beings that is immeasurable because of the immeasurable faculties. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśikendriyāṇāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika indriyāṇām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the measure of the faculties is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is just as the measure of space is not apprehended.

original: evam eva kauśikendriyāṇāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika indriyāṇām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the measure of the faculties is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā indriyāparimāṇatā indriyāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā indriya aparimāṇa tā indriya aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because of the infinitude of space, the faculties are infinite. Because of the infinitude of the faculties, the perfection of wisdom is infinite.

original: balāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: bala apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is a perfection of the bodhisattva great beings that is immeasurable because of the immeasurable powers. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika balānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /🔽tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika balānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate  tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, no extent can be found for the powers.🔽Kauśika, it is just as no extent can be found for space.

original: evam eva kauśika balānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika balānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, no extent can be found for the powers.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā balāparimāṇatā balāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā bala aparimāṇa tā bala aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because the extent of space is not apprehended, the extent of the powers is not apprehended. Because the extent of the powers is not apprehended, the extent of the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended.

original: bodhyaṅgāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: bodhyaṅga apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is the perfection of the bodhisattva great beings because of the immeasurability of the factors of awakening. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika bodhyaṅgānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika bodhyaṅgānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, no measure can be found for the factors of awakening.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is just as no measure can be found for space.

original: evam eva kauśika bodhyaṅgānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika bodhyaṅgānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, no measure can be found for the factors of awakening.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā bodhyaṅgāparimāṇatā bodhyaṅgāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā bodhyaṅga aparimāṇa tā bodhyaṅga aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because the measure of space is not apprehended, the measure of the factors of awakening is not apprehended. Because the measure of the factors of awakening is not apprehended, the measure of the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended.

original: āryāṣṭāṅgamārgāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: ārya aṣṭāṅga mārga apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is the perfection of the bodhisattva great beings because of the immeasurability of the noble eightfold path. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśikāryāṣṭāṅgamārgasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika ārya aṣṭāṅga mārgasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, no extent is found for the noble eightfold path.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, just as no extent is found for space,

original: evam eva kauśikāryāṣṭāṅgasya mārgasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /🔽ākāśāparimāṇatayā āryāṣṭāṅgamārgāparimāṇatā āryāṣṭāṅgamārgāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika ārya aṣṭāṅgasya mārgasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate  ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā ārya aṣṭāṅga mārga aparimāṇa tā ārya aṣṭāṅga mārga aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: just so, Kauśika, no extent is found for the noble eightfold path.🔽Because the extent of the noble eightfold path is not apprehended. Because the noble eightfold path is endless, its extent is not apprehended. Because its extent is not apprehended, it is said, ‘The noble eightfold path is immeasurable.’

original: āryasatyāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: ārya satya apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: tathā hi kauśikāryasatyānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika ārya satyānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, no extent is found for the noble truths.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, just as no extent is found for space,

original: evam eva kauśikāryasatyānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika ārya satyānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: just so, Kauśika, no extent is found for the noble truths.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā āryasatyāparimāṇatā āryasatyāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā ārya satya aparimāṇa tā ārya satya aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because the extent of the noble truths is not apprehended. Because the noble truths are endless, its extent is not apprehended. Because its extent is not apprehended, it is said, ‘The noble truths are immeasurable.’🔽Kauśika, this is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: dhyānāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika dhyānānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: dhyāna apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika dhyānānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of the concentrations. And why?🔽Because, Kauśika, no measure of the concentrations is apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, no measure of space is apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika dhyānānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika dhyānānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, no measure of the concentrations is apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā dhyānāparimāṇatā dhyānāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā dhyāna aparimāṇa tā dhyāna aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because of the immeasurability of space, the concentrations are immeasurable. Because of the immeasurability of the concentrations, the perfection of wisdom is immeasurable.

original: apramāṇāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśikāpramāṇānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: apramāṇa apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika apramāṇānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of the immeasurables. And why?🔽Because, Kauśika, no measure of the immeasurables is apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, no measure of space is apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśikāpramāṇānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika apramāṇānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, no measure of the immeasurables is apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā apramāṇāparimāṇatā apramāṇāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā apramāṇa aparimāṇa tā apramāṇa aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because of the immeasurability of space, the immeasurables are immeasurable. Because of the immeasurability of the immeasurables, the perfection of wisdom is immeasurable.

original: ārūpyasamāpattyapramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: ārūpya samāpatti apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the immeasurability of the formless attainments, Kauśika, this is the immeasurably great perfection of the bodhisattva great beings. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśikārūpyasamāpattīnāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika ārūpya samāpattīnām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: It is because a measure of the formless attainments is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, a measure of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśikārūpyasamāpattīnāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika ārūpya samāpattīnām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: just so, Kauśika, a measure of the formless attainments is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā ārūpyasamāpattyāparimāṇatā ārūpyasamāpattyaparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā ārūpya samāpattyā aparimāṇa tā ārūpya samāpatti aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because of the immeasurability of space, there is the immeasurability of the formless attainments. Because of the immeasurability of the formless attainments, there is the immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom.

original: aṣṭavimokṣāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭa vimokṣa apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the immeasurability of the eight liberations, Kauśika, this is the immeasurably great perfection of the bodhisattva great beings. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśikāṣṭavimokṣāṇāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika aṣṭa vimokṣāṇām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: It is because a measure of the eight liberations is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, a measure of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśikāṣṭavimokṣāṇāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika aṣṭa vimokṣāṇām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: just so, Kauśika, a measure of the eight liberations is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā vimokṣāparimāṇatā vimokṣāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā vimokṣa aparimāṇa tā vimokṣa aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The liberation is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of space. The perfection of wisdom is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of liberation.

original: anupūrvavihārasamāpattyapramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: anupūrva vihāra samāpatti apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is the immeasurable perfection of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas because of the immeasurability of the successive absorptions. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśikānupūrvavihārasamāpattīnāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika anupūrva vihāra samāpattīnām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: It is because a measure of the successive absorptions is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, a measure of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśikānupūrvavihārasamāpattīnāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika anupūrva vihāra samāpattīnām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, a measure of the successive absorptions is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā anupūrvavihārasamāpattyāparimāṇatā anupūrvavihārasamāpattyaparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā anupūrva vihāra samāpattyā aparimāṇa tā anupūrva vihāra samāpatti aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā aparimāṇa tā
translated: The successive absorptions are immeasurable because of the immeasurability of space. The perfection of wisdom is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of the successive absorptions.

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukha apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is the immeasurable perfection of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas because of the immeasurability of the doors to liberation that are emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: It is because a measure of the doors to liberation that are emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: just so, Kauśika, the extent of the emptiness, signless, and wishless gates to liberation is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhāparimāṇatā śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukha aparimāṇa tā śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukha aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The emptiness, signless, and wishless gates to liberation are immeasurable because of the immeasurability of space. The perfection of wisdom is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of the emptiness, signless, and wishless gates to liberation.

original: abhijñāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: abhijñā pramāṇa tayā kauśika a pramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the immeasurable is for the bodhisattva mahāsattvas because of the immeasurability of the superknowledges. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśikābhijñānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika abhijñānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: It is because the superknowledges are not apprehended as having an extent.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśikābhijñānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika abhijñānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: just so, Kauśika, the superknowledges are not apprehended as having an extent.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā abhijñāparimāṇatā abhijñāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā abhijñā parimāṇa tā abhijñā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The superknowledges are immeasurable because of the immeasurability of space. The perfection of wisdom is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of the superknowledges.

original: samādhyapramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: samādhi apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the immeasurable is for the bodhisattva mahāsattvas because of the immeasurability of the meditative absorptions. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika samādhīnāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika samādhīnām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the extent of the meditative stabilities is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is just as the extent of space is not apprehended.

original: evam eva kauśika samādhīnāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika samādhīnām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the extent of the meditative stabilities is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā samādhyaparimāṇatā samādhyāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā samādhi aparimāṇa tā samādhya aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because of the infinitude of space, the meditative stabilities are infinite. Because of the infinitude of the meditative stabilities, the perfection of wisdom is infinite.

original: dhāraṇīmukhāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: dhāraṇī mukha apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is a perfection of bodhisattva great beings that is infinite because of the infinitude of the dhāraṇī gateways. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika dhāraṇīmukhānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika dhāraṇī mukhānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the extent of the dhāraṇī gateways is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is just as the extent of space is not apprehended.

original: evam eva kauśika dhāraṇīmukhānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika dhāraṇī mukhānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the extent of the dhāraṇī gateways is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā dhāraṇīmukhāparimāṇatā dhāraṇīmukhāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā dhāraṇīmukha aparimāṇa tā dhāraṇīmukha aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because of the infinitude of space, the dhāraṇī gateways are infinite. Because of the infinitude of the dhāraṇī gateways, the perfection of wisdom is infinite.

original: tathāgatabalāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tathāgata bala apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is a perfection of bodhisattva great beings that is infinite because of the infinitude of the powers of the tathāgatas. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika tathāgatabalānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika tathāgata balānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, no extent is apprehended of the powers of the Tathāgata.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is just as no extent is apprehended of space.

original: evam eva kauśika tathāgatabalānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika tathāgata balānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, no extent is apprehended of the powers of the Tathāgata.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā tathāgatabalāparimāṇatā tathāgatabalāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā tathāgata bala aparimāṇa tā tathāgata bala aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because of the infinitude of space, the powers of the Tathāgata are infinite. Because of the infinitude of the powers of the Tathāgata, the perfection of wisdom is infinite.

original: vaiśāradyāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: vaiśāradya apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is the immeasurable perfection of the bodhisattva great beings because of the immeasurability of the fearlessnesses. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika vaiśāradyānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /🔽tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika vaiśāradyānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate  tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, no measure is apprehended of the fearlessnesses.🔽Kauśika, it is just as no measure is apprehended of space.

original: evam eva kauśika vaiśāradyānāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika vaiśāradyānām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, no measure is apprehended of the fearlessnesses.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā vaiśāradyāparimāṇatā vaiśāradyāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā vaiśāradya aparimāṇa tā vaiśāradya aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: Because of the infinitude of space, the fearlessnesses are infinite. Because of the infinitude of the fearlessnesses, the perfection of wisdom is infinite.

original: pratisaṃvidapramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika pratisaṃvidāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: pratisaṃvid apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika pratisaṃvidām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: The perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas is immeasurable due to the immeasurability of the analytical knowledges. Why is that?🔽It is because the measure of the analytical knowledges is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the measure of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika pratisaṃvidāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika pratisaṃvidām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the measure of the analytical knowledges is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā pratisaṃvidaparimāṇatā pratisaṃvidaparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā pratisaṃvid aparimāṇa tā pratisaṃvid aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The immeasurability of the analytical knowledges is due to the immeasurability of space. The immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom is due to the immeasurability of the analytical knowledges.

original: mahāmaitryapramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: mahā maitrī apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas is immeasurable due to the immeasurability of great loving-kindness. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika mahāmaitryāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika mahāmaitryāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: It is because the measure of great loving-kindness is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
