translated: Just as, Kauśika, the measure of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika mahāmaitryāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika mahāmaitryāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the measure of great loving-kindness is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā mahāmaitryaparimāṇatā mahāmaitryaparimāṇatayā
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā mahāmaitrī aparimāṇa tā mahāmaitrī aparimāṇa tayā
translated: The immeasurability of great loving-kindness is due to the immeasurability of space. The immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom is due to the immeasurability of great loving-kindness.

original: prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The perfection of wisdom is immeasurable.

original: mahākaruṇāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā pramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of great compassion. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika mahākaruṇāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika mahā karuṇāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, no measure of great compassion can be apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is just as no measure of space can be apprehended.

original: evam eva kauśika mahākaruṇāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika mahā karuṇāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, no measure of great compassion can be apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā mahākaruṇāparimāṇatā mahākaruṇāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā mahā karuṇā parimāṇa tā mahā karuṇā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The perfection of wisdom is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of great compassion, which is itself immeasurable because of the immeasurability of space.

original: muditāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: mudita apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of sympathetic joy. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika muditāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika muditāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, no measure of sympathetic joy can be apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is just as no measure of space can be apprehended.

original: evam eva kauśika muditāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika muditāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, no measure of sympathetic joy can be apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā muditāparimāṇatā muditāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā muditā aparimāṇa tā muditā aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā aparimāṇa tā
translated: The perfection of wisdom is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of sympathetic joy, which is itself immeasurable because of the immeasurability of space.

original: upekṣāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika upekṣāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: upekṣā pramāṇa tayā kauśika a pramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika upekṣāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: “Kauśika, this is the perfection of the bodhisattva great beings’ immeasurable equanimity. Why is it so?🔽It is because the extent of equanimity is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is just as the extent of space is not apprehended.

original: evam eva kauśika upekṣāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika upekṣāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the extent of equanimity is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā upekṣāparimāṇatā upekṣāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā upekṣā parimāṇa tā upekṣā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of equanimity is the extent of the perfection of wisdom.

original: āveṇikabuddhadharmāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: āveṇika buddha dharma apramāṇa tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this is the perfection of the bodhisattva great beings’ immeasurable special qualities of a buddha. Why is it so?

original: tathā hi kauśikāveṇikabuddhadharmāṇāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika āveṇika buddha dharmāṇām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: It is because the extent of the special qualities of a buddha is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is just as the extent of space is not apprehended.

original: evam eva kauśikāveṇikabuddhadharmāṇāṃ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika āveṇika buddha dharmāṇām pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the extent of the special qualities of a buddha is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā āveṇikabuddhadharmāparimāṇatā āveṇikabuddhadharmāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā āveṇika buddha dharma aparimāṇa tā āveṇika buddha dharma aparimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The immeasurability of the unshared qualities of the Buddha is due to the immeasurability of space. The immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom is due to the immeasurability of the unshared qualities of the Buddha.

original: sarvajñatāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: sarvajña tā pramāṇa tayā kauśika a pramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this is an immeasurably great perfection for the bodhisattva mahāsattvas because of the immeasurability of omniscience. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika sarvajñatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika sarvajña tāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the measure of omniscience is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the measure of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika sarvajñatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika sarvajña tāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the measure of omniscience is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā sarvajñatāparimāṇatā sarvajñatāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā sarvajña tā parimāṇa tā sarvajña tā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The immeasurability of omniscience is due to the immeasurability of space. The immeasurability of the perfection of wisdom is due to the immeasurability of omniscience.

original: mārgākārajñatāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika mārgākārajñatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tā pramāṇa tayā kauśika a pramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika mārga ākāra jña tāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, this is an immeasurably great perfection for the bodhisattva mahāsattvas because of the immeasurability of the knowledge of the aspects of the path. Why is that?🔽Because, Kauśika, the measure of the knowledge of the aspects of the path is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the measure of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika mārgākārajñatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ
analyzed: evam eva kauśika mārga ākāra jña tāyāḥ pramāṇam
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, the extent of the knowledge of the aspects of the path

original: nopalabhyate /
analyzed: na upalabhyate
translated: is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā mārgākārajñatāparimāṇatā mārgākārajñatāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā mārga ākāra jña tā parimāṇa tā mārga ākāra jña tā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of the knowledge of the aspects of the path is the extent of the perfection of wisdom,

original: sarvākārajñatāpramāṇatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām /
analyzed: sarva ākārajña tā pramāṇa tayā kauśika a pramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām
translated: because of the infinitude of the knowledge of all aspects, Kauśika, this is a perfection of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas that is infinite.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: tathā hi kauśika sarvākārajñatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the extent of the knowledge of all aspects is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, the extent of space is not apprehended,

original: evam eva kauśika sarvākārajñatāyāḥ pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: in the same way, Kauśika, the extent of the knowledge of all aspects is not apprehended.

original: ākāśāparimāṇatayā sarvākārajñatāparimāṇatā sarvākārajñatāparimāṇatayā prajñāpāramitāparimāṇatā /
analyzed: ākāśa aparimāṇa tayā sarva ākārajña tā parimāṇa tā sarva ākārajña tā parimāṇa tayā prajñāpāramitā parimāṇa tā
translated: The extent of the knowledge of all aspects is the extent of the perfection of wisdom,

original: anena kauśika paryāyeṇāparimāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ yad uta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: anena kauśika paryāyeṇa aparimāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: because of the infinitude of space, Kauśika, this is a perfection of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas that is infinite.

original: rūpānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: rūpa ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is an infinite perfection because of the infinity of form. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika rūpasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika rūpasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, you cannot apprehend a middle or end of form.

original: vedanānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: vedanā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is an infinite perfection because of the infinity of feeling. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika vedanāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika vedanāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, you cannot apprehend a middle or end of feeling.

original: saṃjñāparimāṇatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: saṃjñā parimāṇa tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is an infinite perfection because of the finiteness of perception. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika saṃjñāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika saṃjñāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, you cannot apprehend a middle or end of perception.

original: saṃskārānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: saṃskāra ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is an infinite perfection because of the infinity of volitional factors. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika saṃskārāṇāṃ nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika saṃskārāṇām na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, you cannot apprehend a middle or end of volitional factors.

original: vijñānānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: vijñāna ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is an infinite perfection because of the infinity of consciousness. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika vijñānasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika vijñānasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: To illustrate, Kauśika, no end or middle of consciousness is apprehended.

original: cakṣuranantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection is the infinite perfection of bodhisattva great beings because the eye is infinite. Why is it so?

original: tathā hi kauśika cakṣuṣo nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika cakṣuṣaḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: To illustrate, Kauśika, no end or middle of the eye is apprehended.

original: śrotrānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: śrotra ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection is the infinite perfection of bodhisattva great beings because the ear is infinite. Why is it so?

original: tathā hi kauśika śrotrasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika śrotrasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: To illustrate, Kauśika, no end or middle of the ear is apprehended.

original: ghrāṇānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: ghrāṇa ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection is the infinite perfection of bodhisattva great beings because the nose is infinite. Why is it so?

original: tathā hi kauśika ghrāṇasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika ghrāṇasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: To illustrate, Kauśika, no end or middle of the nose is apprehended.

original: jihvānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: jihvā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection is the infinite perfection of bodhisattva great beings because the tongue is infinite. Why is it so?

original: tathā hi kauśika ghrāṇasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika ghrāṇasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: To illustrate, Kauśika, no end or middle of the tongue is apprehended.

original: kāyānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: kāya ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the infinity of the body, Kauśika, this is the perfection of the bodhisattvas, the great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika kāyasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika kāyasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the end and middle of the body are not apprehended.

original: mano'nantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ nanta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the infinity of the mind, Kauśika, this is the perfection of the bodhisattvas, the great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika manasaḥ
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika manasaḥ
translated: Because, Kauśika, the end and middle of the mind

original: nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: are not apprehended.

original: rūpānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: rūpa ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the infinity of form, Kauśika, this is the perfection of the bodhisattvas, the great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika rūpasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika rūpasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the end and middle of form are not apprehended.

original: śabdānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: śabda ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the infinity of sound, Kauśika, this is the perfection of the bodhisattvas, the great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika śabdasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika śabdasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, the end and middle of sound are not apprehended.

original: gandhānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: gandha ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the infinity of smell, Kauśika, this is the perfection of the bodhisattvas, the great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika gandhasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika gandhasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of smell is not apprehended.

original: rasānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: rasa ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection is an endless perfection of bodhisattva great beings because of the endlessness of taste. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika rasasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika rasasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of taste is not apprehended.

original: sparśānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: sparśa ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection is an endless perfection of bodhisattva great beings because of the endlessness of feeling. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika sparśasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika sparśasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of feeling is not apprehended.

original: dharmānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: dharma ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection is an endless perfection of bodhisattva great beings because of the endlessness of phenomena. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika dharmāṇāṃ nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika dharmāṇām na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of phenomena is not apprehended.

original: cakṣurvijñānānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ vijñāna ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection is an endless perfection of bodhisattva great beings because of the endlessness of eye consciousness. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika cakṣurvijñānasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika cakṣuḥ vijñānasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of eye consciousness is not apprehended.

original: śrotravijñānānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: śrotra vijñāna ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinity of the ear consciousness. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika śrotravijñānasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika śrotra vijñānasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end and a middle of the ear consciousness are not apprehended.

original: ghrāṇavijñānānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: ghrāṇa vijñāna ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinity of the nose consciousness. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika ghrāṇavijñānasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika ghrāṇa vijñānasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end and a middle of the nose consciousness are not apprehended.

original: jihvāvijñānānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: jihvā vijñāna ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinity of the tongue consciousness. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika jihvāvijñānasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika jihvā vijñānasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end and a middle of the tongue consciousness are not apprehended.

original: kāyavijñānānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: kāya vijñāna ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinity of the body consciousness. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika kāyavijñānasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika kāya vijñānasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end and a middle of the body consciousness are not apprehended.

original: manovijñānānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñāna ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the infinity of the mind consciousness, Kauśika, this perfection is the infinite perfection of bodhisattva great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika manovijñānasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika manaḥ vijñānasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of the mind consciousness is not apprehended.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the infinity of eye contact, Kauśika, this perfection is the infinite perfection of bodhisattva great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika cakṣuḥsaṃsparśasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika cakṣuḥ saṃsparśasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of eye contact is not apprehended.

original: śrotrasaṃsparśānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: śrotra saṃsparśa ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the infinity of ear contact, Kauśika, this perfection is the infinite perfection of bodhisattva great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika śrotrasaṃsparśasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika śrotra saṃsparśasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of ear contact is not apprehended.

original: ghrāṇasaṃsparśānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām /
analyzed: ghrāṇa saṃsparśa ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām
translated: Because of the infinity of nose contact, Kauśika, this perfection is the infinite perfection of bodhisattva great beings.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika ghrāṇasaṃsparśasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika ghrāṇa saṃsparśasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of nose contact is not apprehended.

original: jihvāsaṃsparśānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: jihvā saṃsparśa ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinity of tongue contact. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika jihvāsaṃsparśasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika jihvā saṃsparśasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of tongue contact is not perceived.

original: kāyasaṃsparśānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: kāya saṃsparśa ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinity of body contact. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika kāyasaṃsparśasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika kāya saṃsparśasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of body contact is not perceived.

original: manaḥsaṃsparśānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ saṃsparśa ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinity of mind contact. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika manaḥsaṃsparśasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika manaḥ saṃsparśasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of mind contact is not perceived.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinity of the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact is not perceived.

original: śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfection of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is infinite because of the infinity of the feeling that arises from the contact with the ear. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end and a middle are not discerned in the feeling that arises from the contact with the ear.

original: ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfection of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is infinite because of the infinity of the feeling that arises from the contact with the nose. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end and a middle are not discerned in the feeling that arises from the contact with the nose.

original: jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfection of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is infinite because of the infinity of the feeling that arises from the contact with the tongue. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end and a middle are not discerned in the feeling that arises from the contact with the tongue.

original: kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfection of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is infinite because of the infinity of the feeling that arises from the contact with the body. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, no end or middle is perceived in the consciousness that arises dependent on the contact of the body.

original: manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinity of the feeling that arises dependent on the contact of the mind. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, no end or middle is perceived in the feeling that arises dependent on the contact of the eye.

original: pṛthivīdhātvanantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivī dhātu ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinity of the earth element. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika pṛthivīdhātor nāntaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika pṛthivī dhātoḥ na antam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end of the earth element is not perceived.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: It is just as, Kauśika, an end or middle of space is not perceived.

original: abdhātvanantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśikābdhātor nāntaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: ap dhātu ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika ap dhātoḥ na antam na upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinity of the water element. Why is that?🔽Because, Kauśika, an end of the water element is not perceived.

original: tad yathāpi nāma kauśikākāśasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika ākāśasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: It is just as, Kauśika, an end or middle of space is not perceived.

original: tejodhātvanantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika tejodhātor nānto na madhyam
analyzed: tejaḥ dhātu ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika tejaḥ dhātoḥ na antaḥ na madhyam
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because the fire element is infinite. And why?

original: upalabhyate /
analyzed: upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of the fire element is not apprehended.

original: vāyudhātvanantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: vāyu dhātu ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because the wind element is infinite. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika vāyudhātor nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika vāyu dhātoḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of the wind element is not apprehended.

original: ākāśadhātvanantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: ākāśa dhātu ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because the space element is infinite. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika ākāśadhātor nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśike ākāśa dhātoḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of the space element is not apprehended.

original: vijñānadhātvanantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: vijñāna dhātu ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because the consciousness element is infinite. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika vijñānadhātor nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika vijñāna dhātoḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of the consciousness element is not apprehended.

original: avidyānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: avidyā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because nescience is infinite. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśikāvidyāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika avidyāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: For, Kauśika, the end and middle of ignorance are not apprehended.

original: saṃskārānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: saṃskāra ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection is infinite for bodhisattva great beings because of the infinity of formative predispositions. What is the reason for that?

original: tathā hi kauśika saṃskārāṇāṃ nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika saṃskārāṇām na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: For, Kauśika, the end and middle of formative predispositions are not apprehended.

original: vijñānānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: vijñāna ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection is infinite for bodhisattva great beings because of the infinity of consciousness. What is the reason for that?

original: tathā hi kauśika vijñānasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika vijñānasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: For, Kauśika, the end and middle of consciousness are not apprehended.

original: nāmarūpānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: nāma rūpa ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection is infinite for bodhisattva great beings because of the infinity of name and form. What is the reason for that?

original: tathā hi kauśika nāmarūpasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika nāma rūpasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: For, Kauśika, the end and middle of name and form are not apprehended.

original: ṣaḍāyatanānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: ṣaṣ āyatana ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection is infinite for bodhisattva great beings because of the infinity of the six sense spheres. What is the reason for that?

original: tathā hi kauśika ṣaḍāyatanasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika ṣaṣ āyatanasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: For, Kauśika, the end and middle of the six sense spheres are not apprehended.

original: sparśānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: sparśa ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection is an infinite perfection for bodhisattva great beings because of the infinity of contact. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika sparśasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika sparśasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of contact is not apprehended.

original: vedanānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: vedanā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection is an infinite perfection for bodhisattva great beings because of the infinity of feeling. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika vedanāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika vedanāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of feeling is not apprehended.

original: tṛṣṇānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection is an infinite perfection for bodhisattva great beings because of the infinity of craving. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika tṛṣṇāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika tṛṣṇāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of craving is not apprehended.

original: upādānānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: upādāna ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection is an infinite perfection for bodhisattva great beings because of the infinity of grasping. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśikopādānasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika upādānasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of grasping is not apprehended.

original: bhavānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: bhava ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection is an infinite perfection for bodhisattva great beings because of the infinity of becoming. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika bhavasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika bhavasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: For, Kauśika, no end or middle of existence is apprehended.

original: jātyanantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: jāti ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection is infinite for bodhisattva great beings because of the infinity of birth. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika jāter nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika jāteḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: For, Kauśika, no end or middle of birth is apprehended.

original: jarāmaraṇānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: jarā maraṇa ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection is infinite for bodhisattva great beings because of the infinity of old age and death. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika jarāmaraṇasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /🔽dānapāramitānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika jarā maraṇasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate  dāna pāramitā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām
translated: For, Kauśika, no end or middle of old age and death is apprehended.

original: mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection is infinite for bodhisattva great beings because of the infinity of the perfection of giving. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika dānapāramitāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika dāna pāramitāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: For, Kauśika, no end or middle of the perfection of giving is apprehended.

original: śīlapāramitānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: śīla pāramitā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection is infinite for bodhisattva great beings because of the infinity of the perfection of morality. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika śīlapāramitāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika śīla pāramitāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: For, Kauśika, no end or middle of the perfection of morality is apprehended.

original: kṣāntipāramitānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: kṣānti pāramitā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfection of patience is infinite, Kauśika, because of the infinitude of the perfection of patience. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika kṣāntipāramitāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika kṣānti pāramitāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: For thus, Kauśika, the end and the middle of the perfection of patience are not apprehended.

original: vīryapāramitānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: vīrya pāramitā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfection of perseverance is infinite, Kauśika, because of the infinitude of the perfection of perseverance. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika viryapāramitāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika virya pāramitāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: For thus, Kauśika, the end and the middle of the perfection of perseverance are not apprehended.

original: dhyānapāramitānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfection of concentration is infinite, Kauśika, because of the infinitude of the perfection of concentration. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika dhyānapāramitāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika dhyāna pāramitāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: For thus, Kauśika, the end and the middle of the perfection of concentration are not apprehended.

original: prajñāpāramitānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfection of wisdom is infinite, Kauśika, because of the infinitude of the perfection of wisdom. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika prajñāpāramitāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika prajñāpāramitāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: For thus, Kauśika, the end and the middle of the perfection of wisdom are not apprehended.

original: adhyātmaśūnyatānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: adhyātma śūnyatā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinity of inner emptiness. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśikādhyātmaśūnyatāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika adhyātma śūnyatāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of inner emptiness is not apprehended.

original: bahirdhāśūnyatānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: bahirdhā śūnyatā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinity of outer emptiness. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika bahirdhāśūnyatāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of outer emptiness is not apprehended.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinity of inner and outer emptiness. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśikādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of inner and outer emptiness is not apprehended.

original: śūnyatāśūnyatānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: śūnyatā aśūnyatā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinity of the emptiness of emptiness. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika śūnyatāśūnyatāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika śūnyatā aśūnyatāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of the emptiness of emptiness is not apprehended.

original: mahāśūnyatānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: mahā śūnyatā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the infinity of the great emptiness, Kauśika, this perfection is the infinite perfection of bodhisattva great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika mahāśūnyatāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika mahā śūnyatāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end and a middle of the great emptiness are not apprehended.

original: paramārthaśūnyatānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: paramārtha śūnyatā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the infinity of the emptiness of ultimate reality, Kauśika, this perfection is the infinite perfection of bodhisattva great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika paramārthaśūnyatāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika paramārtha śūnyatāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end and a middle of the emptiness of ultimate reality are not apprehended.

original: saṃskṛtaśūnyatānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: saṃskṛta śūnyatā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the infinity of the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, Kauśika, this perfection is the infinite perfection of bodhisattva great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika saṃskṛtaśūnyatāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika saṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end and a middle of the emptiness of conditioned phenomena are not apprehended.

original: asaṃskṛtaśūnyatānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: asaṃskṛta śūnyatā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the infinity of the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, Kauśika, this perfection is the infinite perfection of bodhisattva great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśikāsaṃskṛtaśūnyatāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika asaṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end and a middle of the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena are not apprehended.

original: atyantaśūnyatānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: atyanta śūnyatā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the endlessness of the emptiness of ultimate reality, Kauśika, this perfection is the infinite perfection of the bodhisattva great beings. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśikātyantaśūnyatāyā
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika atyanta śūnyatāyāḥ
translated: Because, Kauśika, the emptiness of ultimate reality

original: nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: is not apprehended as having an end or a middle.

original: anavarāgraśūnyatānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: an avara agra śūnyatā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the endlessness of the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, Kauśika, this perfection is the infinite perfection of the bodhisattva great beings. And why?🔽Because, Kauśika, the emptiness of the beginningless and endless

original: tathā hi kauśikānavarāgraśūnyatāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika an avara agra śūnyatāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: is not apprehended as having an end or a middle.

original: anavakāraśūnyatānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: an avakāra śūnyatā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the endlessness of the emptiness of non-apprehension, Kauśika, this perfection is the infinite perfection of the bodhisattva great beings. And why?🔽Because, Kauśika, the emptiness of non-apprehension

original: tathā hi kauśikānavakāraśūnyatāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika anavakāra śūnyatāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: is not apprehended as having an end or a middle.

original: prakṛtiśūnyatānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the endlessness of the emptiness of own-marks, Kauśika, this perfection is the infinite perfection of the bodhisattva great beings. And why?🔽Because, Kauśika, the emptiness of own-marks

original: tathā hi kauśika prakṛtiśūnyatāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika prakṛti śūnyatāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: is not apprehended as having an end or a middle.

original: sarvadharmaśūnyatānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: sarva dharma śūnyatā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinity of the emptiness of all phenomena. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika sarvadharmaśūnyatāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika sarva dharma śūnyatāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of the emptiness of all phenomena is not apprehended.

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyatānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinity of the emptiness of its own mark. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of the emptiness of its own mark is not apprehended.

original: anupalambhaśūnyatānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: anupalambha śūnyatā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinity of the emptiness of non-apprehension. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśikānupalambhaśūnyatāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika anupalambha śūnyatāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of the emptiness of non-apprehension is not apprehended.

original: abhāvaśūnyatānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: abhāva śūnyatā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinity of the emptiness of non-things. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśikābhāvaśūnyatāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika abhāva śūnyatāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of the emptiness of non-things is not apprehended.

original: svabhāvaśūnyatānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika svabhāvaśūnyatāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /🔽abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvanāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: svabhāva śūnyatā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate  abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvanām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinity of the emptiness of its own mark. If you ask why, it is because, Kauśika, an end or middle of the emptiness of its own mark is not apprehended.

original: tathā hi kauśikābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinity of the emptiness that is a nonexistence of its own mark. If you ask why, it is because, Kauśika, an end or middle of the emptiness that is a nonexistence of its own mark is not apprehended.

original: smṛtyupasthānānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika smṛtyupasthānānāṃ nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /🔽samyakprahāṇānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: smṛti upasthāna ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika smṛti upasthānānām na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate  samyak prahāṇa ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinity of the applications of mindfulness. If you ask why, it is because, Kauśika, an end or middle of the applications of mindfulness is not apprehended.

original: tathā hi kauśika samyakprahāṇānāṃ nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika samyakprahāṇānām na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinity of the right efforts. If you ask why, it is because, Kauśika, an end or middle of the right efforts is not apprehended.🔽“Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinity of the legs of miraculous power.

original: ṛddhipādānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: ṛddhipāda ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika,” he replied, “the perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is endless because the bases of miraculous power are endless. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika ṛddhipādāṃ nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika ṛddhipādām na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of the bases of miraculous power is not apprehended.

original: indriyānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: indriya ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika,” he replied, “the perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is endless because the faculties are endless. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśikendriyāṇāṃ nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika indriyāṇām na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of the faculties is not apprehended.

original: balānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāni mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi kauśika balānāṃ nānto na
analyzed: bala ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika balānām na antaḥ na
translated: “Kauśika,” he replied, “the perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is endless because the powers are endless. And why?

original: madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of the powers is not apprehended.

original: bodhyaṅgānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: bodhyaṅga ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika,” he replied, “the perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is endless because the limbs of awakening are endless. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika bodhyaṅgānāṃ nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika bodhyaṅgānām na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end or middle of the limbs of awakening is not apprehended.

original: āryāṣṭāṅgamārgānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: ārya aṣṭāṅga mārga ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika,” he replied, “the perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is endless because the path is endless. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśikāryāṣṭāṅgamārgasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika ārya aṣṭāṅga mārgasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: To illustrate, Kauśika, the noble eightfold path is not apprehended as having an end or a middle.

original: āryasatyānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: ārya satya ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinitude of the noble truths. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśikāryasatyānāṃ nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika ārya satyānām na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: To illustrate, Kauśika, the noble truths are not apprehended as having an end or a middle.

original: dhyānānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: dhyāna ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinitude of the meditative stabilizations. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika dhyānānāṃ nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika dhyānānām na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: To illustrate, Kauśika, the meditative stabilizations are not apprehended as having an end or a middle.

original: apramāṇānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: a pramāṇa ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinitude of the immeasurables. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśikāpramāṇānāṃ nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśikāpramāṇānām na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: To illustrate, Kauśika, the immeasurables are not apprehended as having an end or a middle.

original: ārūpyasamāpattyanantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: ārūpya samāpatti ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is infinite because of the infinitude of the formless meditative stabilizations. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśikārūpyasamāpattīnāṃ nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika ārūpya samāpattīnām na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: To illustrate, Kauśika, the formless meditative stabilizations are not apprehended as having an end or a middle.

original: aṣṭavimokṣānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭa vimokṣa ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings is endless because of the endlessness of the eight liberations. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśikāṣṭavimokṣāṇāṃ nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika aṣṭa vimokṣāṇām na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end and a middle of the eight liberations are not apprehended.

original: anupūrvavihārasamāpattyanantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: anupūrva vihāra samāpatti ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings is endless because of the endlessness of the nine serial absorptions. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśikānupūrvavihārasamāpattīnāṃ nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika anupūrva vihāra samāpattīnām na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end and a middle of the nine serial absorptions are not apprehended.

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhānantatayā kauśikāpramāṇapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukha ananta tayā kauśika apramāṇa pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings is endless because of the endlessness of the emptiness, signless, and wishless gateways to liberation. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhānāṃ nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhānām na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end and a middle of the emptiness, signless, and wishless gateways to liberation are not apprehended.

original: abhijñānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: abhijñā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: “Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings is endless because of the endlessness of the clairvoyances. And why?

original: tathā hi kauśikābhijñānāṃ nāntaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika abhijñānām na antam na upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, an end of the clairvoyances is not apprehended.

original: tad yathāpi nama kauśikākāśasya nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api kauśika ākāśasya na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Just as, Kauśika, no end or middle is apprehended in space,

original: samādhyanantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: samādhi ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: because of the infinity of meditative absorption, Kauśika, this is the infinite perfection of the bodhisattva great beings. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika samādhīnāṃ nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika samādhīnām na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, no end or middle of meditative absorptions is apprehended.

original: dhāraṇīmukhānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: dhāraṇī mukha ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the infinity of the dhāraṇī gateways, Kauśika, this is the infinite perfection of the bodhisattva great beings. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika dhāraṇīmukhānāṃ nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika dhāraṇī mukhānām na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, no end or middle of the dhāraṇī gateways is apprehended.

original: tathāgatabalānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tathāgata bala ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the infinity of the powers of the tathāgatas, Kauśika, this is the infinite perfection of the bodhisattva great beings. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika tathāgatabalānāṃ nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika tathāgata balānām na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, no end or middle of the powers of the tathāgatas is apprehended.

original: vaiśāradyānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: vaiśāradya ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because of the infinity of the fearlessnesses, Kauśika, this is the infinite perfection of the bodhisattva great beings. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika vaiśāradyānāṃ nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika vaiśāradyānām na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Because, Kauśika, no end or middle of the fearlessnesses is apprehended.

original: pratisaṃvidanantatayā
analyzed: pratisaṃvid ananta tayā
translated: Because of the infinity of the detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: This perfection is infinite because of the infinity of the analytical knowledges.

original: tathā hi kauśika pratisaṃvidāṃ nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika pratisaṃvidām na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is because the end and the middle of the analytical knowledges are not apprehended.

original: mahāmaitryanantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: mahā maitrī ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection is infinite because of the infinity of great love. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika mahāmaitryāḥ nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika mahāmaitryāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is because the end and the middle of great love are not apprehended.

original: mahākaruṇānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection is infinite because of the infinity of great compassion. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika mahākaruṇāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika mahā karuṇāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is because the end and the middle of great compassion are not apprehended.

original: āveṇikabuddhadharmānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: āveṇika buddha dharma ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection is infinite because of the infinity of the distinct attributes of a buddha. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśikāveṇikabuddhadharmāṇāṃ nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika āveṇika buddha dharmāṇām na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: Kauśika, it is because the end and the middle of the distinct attributes of a buddha are not apprehended.

original: sarvajñatānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: sarvajña tā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection is infinite because of the infinity of omniscience. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika sarvajñatāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika sarvajña tāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: For thus, Kauśika, the end and middle of omniscience are not apprehended.

original: mārgākārajñatānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattvas, the great beings, is an infinite perfection because of the infinity of the knowledge of the aspects of the path. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika mārgākārajñatāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika mārga ākāra jña tāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: For thus, Kauśika, the end and middle of the knowledge of the aspects of the path are not apprehended.

original: sarvākārajñatānantatayā kauśikānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā ananta tayā kauśika ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattvas, the great beings, is an infinite perfection because of the infinity of the knowledge of all aspects. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika sarvākārajñatāyā nānto na madhyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ na antaḥ na madhyam upalabhyate
translated: For thus, Kauśika, the end and middle of the knowledge of all aspects are not apprehended.

original: anena kauśika paryāyeṇānantapāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ yad uta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: anena kauśika paryāyeṇa ananta pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of the bodhisattvas, the great beings, is an infinite perfection, namely, the perfection of wisdom, because of this method.

original: rūpānantatām upādāya /🔽vedanānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: rūpa ananta tām upādāya  vedanā ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because of the infinity of form.🔽Because of the infinity of feeling.

original: saṃjñānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: saṃjñā ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because of the infinity of perception.

original: saṃskārānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: saṃskāra ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because of the infinity of volitional formations.

original: vijñānānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: vijñāna ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because of the infinity of consciousness.

original: cakṣuranantatām upādāya /🔽śrotrānantatām upādāya /🔽ghrāṇānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ ananta tām upādāya  śrotra ananta tām upādāya  ghrāṇa ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because of the infinity of the eye.🔽Because of the infinity of the ear.🔽Because of the infinity of the nose.

original: jihvānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: jihvā ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because of the infinity of the tongue.

original: kāyānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: kāya ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because of the infinity of the body.

original: manonantatām upādāya /
analyzed: manaḥ nanta tām upādāya
translated: Because of the infinity of the mind.

original: rūpānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: rūpa ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because of the infinity of form.

original: śabdānantatām upādāya /🔽gandhānantatām upādāya /🔽rasānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: śabda ananta tām upādāya  gandha ananta tām upādāya  rasa ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because of the infinity of sound.🔽Because of the infinity of smell.🔽Because of the infinity of taste.

original: sparśānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: sparśa ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because of the infinity of touch.

original: dharmānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: dharma ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because of the infinity of mental objects.

original: cakṣurvijñānānantatām upādāya /🔽śrotravijñānānantatām upādāya /🔽ghrāṇavijñānānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ vijñāna ananta tām upādāya  śrotra vijñāna ananta tām upādāya  ghrāṇa vijñāna ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because of the infinity of eye consciousness.🔽Because of the infinity of ear consciousness.🔽Because of the infinity of nose consciousness.

original: jihvāvijñānānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: jihvā vijñāna ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because of the infinity of tongue consciousness.

original: kāyavijñānānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: kāya vijñāna ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because of the infinity of body consciousness.

original: manovijñānānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñāna ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because of the infinity of mind consciousness.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśānantatām upādāya /🔽śrotrasaṃsparśānantatām upādāya /🔽ghrāṇasaṃsparśānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa ananta tām upādāya  śrotra saṃsparśa ananta tām upādāya  ghrāṇa saṃsparśa ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because of the infinity of eye contact.🔽Because of the infinity of ear contact.🔽Because of the infinity of nose contact.

original: jihvāsaṃsparśānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: jihvā saṃsparśa ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because of the infinity of tongue contact.

original: kāyasaṃsparśānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: kāya saṃsparśa ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because of the infinity of body contact.

original: manaḥsaṃsparśānantatām upādāya /🔽cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: manaḥ saṃsparśa ananta tām upādāya  cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because of the infinity of mind contact.🔽Because of the infinity of the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact.

original: śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because of the infinity of the feeling that arises from the condition of ear contact.

original: ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because the feeling that arises from the contact with the nose is infinite.

original: jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because the feeling that arises from the contact with the tongue is infinite.

original: kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because the feeling that arises from the contact with the body is infinite.

original: manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because the feeling that arises from the contact with the mind is infinite.

original: pṛthivīdhātvanantatām upādāya /🔽abdhātvanantatām upādāya /🔽tejodhātvanantatām upādāya /
analyzed: pṛthivī dhātu ananta tām upādāya  ap dhātu ananta tām upādāya  tejaḥ dhātu ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because the earth element is infinite.🔽Because the water element is infinite.🔽Because the fire element is infinite.

original: vāyudhātvanantatām upādāya /
analyzed: vāyu dhātu ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because the wind element is infinite.

original: ākāśadhātvanantatām upādāya /🔽vijñānadhātvanantatām upādāya /
analyzed: ākāśa dhātu ananta tām upādāya  vijñāna dhātu ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because the space element is infinite.🔽Because the consciousness element is infinite.

original: avidyānantatām upādāya /
analyzed: avidyā ananta tām upādāya
translated: Because ignorance is infinite.
