translated: The emptiness of specific characteristics, because it is not appropriated and not abandoned.🔽The emptiness of non-apprehension, because it is not appropriated and not abandoned.

original: abhāvaśūnyatāyā aparigrahānutsargayogena /🔽svabhāvaśūnyatāyā aparigrahānutsargayogena /
analyzed: abhāva śūnyatāyāḥ a parigraha anutsarga yogena  svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ a parigraha an utsarga yogena
translated: The emptiness of non-existence, because it is not appropriated and not abandoned.🔽The emptiness of own-nature, because it is not appropriated and not abandoned.

original: abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyā aparigrahānutsargayogena /🔽smṛtyupasthānānām aparigrahānutsargayogena /
analyzed: abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ a parigraha anutsarga yogena  smṛti upasthānānām a parigraha an utsarga yogena
translated: The emptiness of the own-nature of non-existence, because it is not appropriated and not abandoned.🔽The applications of mindfulness, because they are not appropriated and not abandoned.

original: samyakprahāṇānām aparigrahānutsargayogena /
analyzed: samyakprahāṇānām a parigraha an utsarga yogena
translated: The right efforts, because they are not appropriated and not abandoned.

original: ṛddhipādānām aparigrahānutsargayogena /🔽indriyāṇām aparigrahānutsargayogena /
analyzed: ṛddhipādānām a parigraha an utsarga yogena  indriyāṇām a parigraha an utsarga yogena
translated: The bases of psychic power, by way of non-appropriation and non-relinquishment.🔽The faculties, by way of non-appropriation and non-relinquishment.

original: balānām aparigrahānutsargayogena /
analyzed: balānām a parigraha an utsarga yogena
translated: The powers, by way of non-appropriation and non-relinquishment.

original: bodhyaṅgānām aparigrahānutsargayogena /🔽āryāṣṭāṅgasya mārgasyāparigrahānutsargayogena /
analyzed: bodhyaṅgānām a parigraha an utsarga yogena  ārya aṣṭāṅgasya mārgasya a parigraha an utsarga yogena
translated: The branches of enlightenment, by way of non-appropriation and non-relinquishment.🔽The noble eightfold path, by way of non-appropriation and non-relinquishment.

original: āryasatyānām aparigrahānutsargayogena /
analyzed: ārya satyānām a parigraha an utsarga yogena
translated: The noble truths, by way of non-appropriation and non-relinquishment.

original: dhyānānām aparigrahānutsargayogena /🔽apramāṇānām aparigrahānutsargayogena /
analyzed: dhyānānām a parigraha an utsarga yogena  apramāṇānām a parigraha an utsarga yogena
translated: The concentrations, by way of non-appropriation and non-relinquishment.🔽The immeasurables, by way of non-appropriation and non-relinquishment.

original: ārūpyasamāpattīnām aparigrahānutsargayogena /
analyzed: ārūpya samāpattīnām a parigraha an utsarga yogena
translated: The formless concentrations, by way of non-appropriation and non-relinquishment.

original: aṣṭau vimokṣāṇām aparigrahānutsargayogena /
analyzed: aṣṭau vimokṣāṇām a parigraha an utsarga yogena
translated: The eight liberations, by way of non-appropriation and non-relinquishment.

original: navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīnām aparigrahānutsargayogena /
analyzed: nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīnām a parigraha an utsarga yogena
translated: The nine successive concentrations, by way of non-appropriation and non-relinquishment.

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhānām aparigrahānutsargayogena /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhānām a parigraha an utsarga yogena
translated: The doors of liberation: emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, by way of non-appropriation and non-relinquishment.

original: abhijñānām aparigrahānutsargayogena /🔽samādhīnām aparigrahānutsargayogena /
analyzed: abhijñānām a parigraha an utsarga yogena  samādhīnām a parigraha an utsarga yogena
translated: The higher knowledges, by way of non-appropriation and non-relinquishment.🔽The concentrations, by way of non-appropriation and non-relinquishment.

original: dhāraṇīmukhānām aparigrahānutsargayogena /
analyzed: dhāraṇī mukhānām a parigraha an utsarga yogena
translated: The dhāraṇī gateways, by way of non-appropriation and non-relinquishment.

original: tathāgatabalānām aparigrahānutsargayogena /
analyzed: tathāgata balānām a parigraha an utsarga yogena
translated: The powers of the Tathāgata, by way of non-appropriation and non-relinquishment.

original: vaiśāradyānām aparigrahānutsargayogena /
analyzed: vaiśāradyānām a parigraha an utsarga yogena
translated: of the fearlessnesses, by way of not grasping and not rejecting;

original: pratisaṃvidām aparigrahānutsargayogena /🔽mahāmaitryā aparigrahānutsargayogena /
analyzed: pratisaṃvidām a parigraha an utsarga yogena  mahāmaitryāḥ a parigraha an utsarga yogena
translated: of the detailed and thorough knowledges, by way of not grasping and not rejecting;🔽of great love, by way of not grasping and not rejecting;

original: mahākaruṇānām aparigrahānutsargayogena /
analyzed: mahā karuṇānām a parigraha an utsarga yogena
translated: of great compassion, by way of not grasping and not rejecting;

original: aṣṭādaśāveṇikabuddhadharmāṇām aparigrahānutsargayogena /
analyzed: aṣṭādaśa āveṇika buddha dharmāṇām a parigraha an utsarga yogena
translated: of the eighteen distinct attributes of a Buddha, by way of not grasping and not rejecting;

original: sarvajñatānām aparigrahānutsargayogena /
analyzed: sarvajña tānām a parigraha an utsarga yogena
translated: of the knowledge of all aspects, by way of not grasping and not rejecting;

original: mārgākārajñatānām aparigrahānutsargayogena /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tānām a parigraha an utsarga yogena
translated: of the knowledge of path aspects, by way of not grasping and not rejecting;

original: sarvākārajñatānām aparigrahānutsargayogena /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tānām a parigraha an utsarga yogena
translated: of the knowledge of all aspects, by way of not grasping and not rejecting.🔽Then the Blessed One addressed the fourfold assembly of monks, nuns, male and female lay followers,

original: atha bhagavāṃś catasraḥ parṣado bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikān bodhisattvān mahāsattvāṃś
analyzed: atha bhagavān catasraḥ parṣadaḥ bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān
translated: bodhisattva great beings,

original: cāturmahārājakāyikāṃś ca devaputrāṃ trāyastriṃśāṃś ca devaputrān upamāṃś ca devaputrāṃs
analyzed: cāturmahārājakāyikān ca deva putrān trāyastriṃśān ca deva putrān upamān ca deva putrān
translated: sons of gods in the realm of the Four Great Kings, sons of gods in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, sons of gods in the Heaven of Yāma,

original: tuṣitāṃś ca devaputrān nirmāṇaratiś ca devaputrāś ca devaputrān paranirmitavaśavartiś
analyzed: tuṣitān ca devaputrān nirmāṇaratiḥ ca devaputrāḥ ca devaputrān paranirmitavaśavartiḥ
translated: sons of gods in the Heaven of Joy, sons of gods in the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, sons of gods in the Heaven of Making Use of Others' Emanations,

original: ca devaputrā brahmakāyikāś ca devaputrā brahmapurohitāṃś ca devaputrān brahmapārṣadyāś
analyzed: ca deva putrāḥ brahmakāyikāḥ ca deva putrāḥ brahmapurohitān ca deva putrān brahma pārṣadyāḥ
translated: sons of gods in the realm of Brahmā, sons of gods in the Heaven of Brahmā's Ministers, sons of gods in the retinue of Brahmā,

original: ca devaputrān mahābrahmāṇaś ca devaputrān ābhāś ca devaputrān parīttābhāṃś ca devaputrān
analyzed: ca devaputrān mahābrahmāṇaḥ ca devaputrān ābhāḥ ca devaputrān parīttābhān ca devaputrān
translated: the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings, the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods, the gods of the Brahma world, the Mahā-Brahmā gods, the Ābhā gods, the Apramāṇābhā gods,

original: apramāṇābhāṃś ca devān ābhāsvarāṃś ca devān śubhāṃś ca devān parīttaśubhāṃś ca devān
analyzed: apramāṇa ābhān ca devān ābhāsvarān ca devān śubhān ca devān parītta śubhān ca devān
translated: the Mahābrahmā gods, the Ābhā gods, the Apramāṇābhā gods, the Ābhāsvara gods, the Śubha gods, the Parīttaśubha gods,

original: pramāṇaśubhāṃś ca devān śubhakṛtṣṇāṃś ca devān bṛhāś ca devān parīttabṛhāś ca devān🔽pramāṇabṛhāṃś ca devān bṛhatphalāṃś ca devān avṛhāś ca devān atapāṃś ca devān sadṛśāś
analyzed: pramāṇaśubhān ca devān śubhakṛtṣṇān ca devān bṛhāḥ ca devān parīttabṛhāḥ ca devān  pramāṇabṛhān ca devān bṛhatphalān ca devān avṛhāḥ ca devān atapān ca devān sadṛśāś
translated: the Apramāṇaśubha gods, the Śubhakṛtsna gods, the Bṛhat gods, the Parītta­bṛhat gods,

original: ca devān sudarśanāṃś ca devān akaniṣṭhāṃś ca devān saṃnipatitāṃ saṃniṣaṇṇāṃ viditvā
analyzed: ca devān sudarśanān ca devān akaniṣṭhān ca devān saṃnipatitām saṃniṣaṇṇām viditvā
translated: the Apramāṇabṛhat gods, the Bṛhatphala gods, the Avṛha gods, the Atapa gods, the Sudarśana gods, and the Akaniṣṭha gods, having assembled and sat down,

original: tān sarvāṃ sākṣiṇaṃ kṛtvā śakradevānām indram āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: tān sarvām sākṣiṇam kṛtvā śakra devānām indram āmantrayate sma
translated: having made them all witnesses, he addressed Śakra, Lord of the Gods:

original: ye kecit kauśika bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopasikāḥ kulaputrāḥ
analyzed: ye kecid kauśika bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upasikāḥ kula putrāḥ
translated: Whatever bodhisattva mahāsattvas, monks, nuns, male and female lay followers, sons of good family,

original: kuladuhitaro vā devaputrā devakanyā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti
analyzed: kula duhitaraḥ vā deva putrāḥ deva kanyāḥ vā imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti
translated: daughters of good family, sons of gods, or daughters of gods, Kauśika, will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind,

original: paryavāpsyanti bhāvayiṣyanti parebhyaś ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyanti /
analyzed: paryavāpsyanti bhāvayiṣyanti parebhyaḥ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyanti
translated: They will master it, meditate on it, and explain it extensively to others.

original: sarvākārajñatācittena cāvirahitā bhaviṣyanti / na teṣāṃ mārapāpīyāṃ mārakāyikā devatā avatāraṃ lapsyate /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā cittena ca avirahitāḥ bhaviṣyanti na teṣām mārapāpīyām māra kāyikā devatā avatāram lapsyate
translated: They will never be separated from the mind of omniscience, and Māra, the evil one, and the devas in Māra’s retinue will not find an opportunity to harm them.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi taiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhiś ca rūpaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽vedanāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tathā hi taiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ ca rūpa śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  vedanā śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: It is because those sons of a good family and those daughters of a good family will have well taken up just the emptiness of form.🔽They will have well taken up just the emptiness of feeling.

original: saṃjñāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: saṃjñā śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: They will have well taken up just the emptiness of perception.

original: saṃskārāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: saṃskāra a śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: They will have well taken up just the emptiness of formative predispositions.

original: vijñānaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: vijñāna śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: They will have well taken up just the emptiness of consciousness. Why is that?

original: tathā hi na śūnyatā śūnyatāyā avatāraṃ labhate /🔽nānimittam ānimittasyāvatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: tathā hi na śūnyatā śūnyatāyāḥ avatāram labhate  na animittam ā animittasya avatāram labhate
translated: It is because emptiness does not find an opportunity in emptiness.🔽Signlessness does not find an opportunity in signlessness.

original: nāpraṇihitam apraṇihitasyāvatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: na apraṇihitam apraṇihitasya avatāram labhate
translated: Wishlessness does not find an opportunity in wishlessness.

original: tathā hi taiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhir vā cakṣuḥśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tathā hi taiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ vā cakṣuḥ śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: It is because those sons of a good family and those daughters of a good family will have well taken up just the emptiness of the eyes.

original: śrotraśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽ghrāṇaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: śrotra śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  ghrāṇa śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: The emptiness of the ear will be well-established.🔽The emptiness of the nose will be well-established.

original: jihvāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: jihvā śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: The emptiness of the tongue will be well-established.

original: kāyaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: kāya śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: The emptiness of the body will be well-established.

original: manaḥśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The emptiness of the mind will be well-established. Why is that?

original: tathā hi na śūnyatā śūnyatāyā avatāraṃ labhate /🔽nānimittam ānimittasyāvatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: tathā hi na śūnyatā śūnyatāyāḥ avatāram labhate  na animittam ā animittasya avatāram labhate
translated: Because emptiness does not find entry into emptiness.🔽The signless does not find entry into the signless.

original: nāpraṇihitam apraṇihitasyāvatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: na apraṇihitam apraṇihitasya avatāram labhate
translated: The wishless does not find entry into the wishless.

original: tathā hi taiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhir vā rūpaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā 🔽bhaviṣyati /🔽śabdaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tathā hi taiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ vā rūpa śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā  bhaviṣyati  śabda śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: Because those sons of a good family and those daughters of a good family will have well-established the emptiness of form,🔽they will have well-established the emptiness of sound,

original: gandhaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽rasasūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: gandha śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  rasa sūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: they will have well-established the emptiness of smell,🔽they will have well-established the emptiness of taste,

original: sparśaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: sparśa śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: they will have well-established the emptiness of feeling,

original: dharmaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: dharma śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: they will have well-established the emptiness of dharmas. Why is that?

original: tathā hi na śūnyatā śūnyatāyā avatāraṃ labhate /🔽nānimittam ānimittasyāvatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: tathā hi na śūnyatā śūnyatāyāḥ avatāram labhate  na animittam ā animittasya avatāram labhate
translated: For emptiness does not find entry into emptiness,🔽signlessness does not find entry into signlessness,

original: nāpraṇihitam apraṇihitasyāvatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: na apraṇihitam apraṇihitasya avatāram labhate
translated: wishlessness does not find entry into wishlessness.

original: tathā hi taiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhir vā cakṣurvijñānasūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽śrotravijñānaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽ghrāṇavijñānaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tathā hi taiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ vā cakṣuḥ vijñāna sūnya tā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  śrotra vijñāna śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  ghrāṇa vijñāna śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: For those sons of good family or daughters of good family have well-established the emptiness of eye consciousness,🔽have well-established the emptiness of ear consciousness,🔽have well-established the emptiness of nose consciousness,

original: jihvāvijñānaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: jihvā vijñāna śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: have well-established the emptiness of tongue consciousness,

original: kāyavijñānaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: kāya vijñāna śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: have well-established the emptiness of body consciousness,

original: manovijñānaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñāna śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: have well-established the emptiness of mind consciousness. Why is that?

original: tathā hi na sūnyatā śūnyatāyā avatāraṃ labhate /🔽nānimittam ānimittasyāvatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: tathā hi na sūnyatā śūnyatāyāḥ avatāram labhate  na animittam ā animittasya avatāram labhate
translated: For emptiness does not find entry into emptiness,🔽signlessness does not find entry into signlessness,

original: nāpraṇihitam apraṇihitasyāvatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: na apraṇihitam apraṇihitasya avatāram labhate
translated: wishlessness does not find entry into wishlessness.

original: tathā hi taiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhir vā cakṣuḥsaṃsparśaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽śrotrasaṃsparśaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽ghrāṇasaṃsparśaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tathā hi taiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ vā cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  śrotra saṃsparśa śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  ghrāṇa saṃsparśa śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: For, those sons or daughters of good family will have well-ascended the emptiness of eye contact.🔽They will have well-ascended the emptiness of ear contact.🔽They will have well-ascended the emptiness of nose contact.

original: jihvāvijñānaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: jihvā vijñāna śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: They will have well-ascended the emptiness of tongue consciousness.

original: kāyasaṃsparśaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: kāya saṃsparśa śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: They will have well-ascended the emptiness of body contact.

original: manaḥsaṃsparśaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ saṃsparśa śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: They will have well-ascended the emptiness of mind contact. Why is that?

original: tathā hi na śūnyatā śūnyatāyā avatāraṃ labhate /🔽nānimittam ānimittasyāvatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: tathā hi na śūnyatā śūnyatāyāḥ avatāram labhate  na animittam ā animittasya avatāram labhate
translated: For, emptiness does not find entry into emptiness.🔽The signless does not find entry into the signless.

original: nāpraṇihitam apraṇihitasyāvatāraṃ labhate /🔽tathā hi taiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhir vā cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: na apraṇihitam apraṇihitasya avatāram labhate  tathā hi taiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ vā cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: The wishless does not find entry into the wishless.🔽For, those sons or daughters of good family will have well-ascended the emptiness of the feeling that arises from eye contact as a condition.

original: śrotrasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: śrotra saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: They will have well-ascended the emptiness of the feeling that arises from ear contact as a condition.

original: ghrāṇasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ghrāṇa saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: The emptiness of the feeling that arises from the contact of the nose will be well-postulated.

original: jihvāsaṃsparśapratyayavedanā sūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽kāyasaṃsparśapratyayavedanāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: jihvā saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā sūnya tā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  kāya saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: The emptiness of the feeling that arises from the contact of the tongue will be well-postulated.🔽The emptiness of the feeling that arises from the contact of the body will be well-postulated.

original: manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāsūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā sūnya tā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: The emptiness of the feeling that arises from the contact of the mind will be well-postulated.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi na śūnyatā śūnyatāyā avatāraṃ labhate /🔽nānimittam ānimittasyāvatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: tathā hi na śūnyatā śūnyatāyāḥ avatāram labhate  na animittam ā animittasya avatāram labhate
translated: Because emptiness does not find entry into emptiness.🔽The signless does not find entry into the signless.

original: nāpraṇihitam apraṇihitasyāvatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: na apraṇihitam apraṇihitasya avatāram labhate
translated: The wishless does not find entry into the wishless.

original: tathā hi taiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhir vā pṛthivīdhātuśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽abdhātuśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tathā hi taiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ vā pṛthivī dhātu śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  ap dhātu śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: Because those sons of a good family and those daughters of a good family will have well-postulated the emptiness of the earth element itself.🔽They will have well-postulated the emptiness of the water element itself.

original: tejodhātuśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽vāyudhātuśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tejaḥ dhātu śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  vāyu dhātu śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: They will have well-postulated the emptiness of the fire element itself.🔽They will have well-postulated the emptiness of the wind element itself.

original: ākāśadhātuśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ākāśa dhātu śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: They will have well-postulated the emptiness of the space element itself.

original: vijñānadhātuśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi na śūnyatā
analyzed: vijñānadhātu śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi na śūnyatā
translated: The emptiness of the consciousness element will be well-established. Why is that?🔽Because emptiness

original: śūnyatāyā avatāraṃ labhate /🔽nānimittam ānimittasyāvatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: śūnyatāyāḥ avatāram labhate  na animittam ā animittasya avatāram labhate
translated: does not find entry into emptiness.🔽The signless does not find entry into the signless.

original: nāpraṇihitam apraṇihitasyāvatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: na apraṇihitam apraṇihitasya avatāram labhate
translated: The wishless does not find entry into the wishless.

original: tathā hi taiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhir vāvidyāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tathā hi taiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ vā avidyā śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: Because those sons of good family or daughters of good family will have well-established the emptiness of ignorance.

original: saṃskārāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: saṃskāra a śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: They will have well-established the emptiness of volitional factors.

original: vijñānaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: vijñāna śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: They will have well-established the emptiness of consciousness.

original: nāmarūpaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: nāma rūpa śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: They will have well-established the emptiness of name and form.

original: ṣaḍāyatanaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽sparśaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ṣaṣ āyatana śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  sparśa śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: They will have well-established the emptiness of the six sense spheres.🔽They will have well-established the emptiness of contact.

original: vedanāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: vedanā śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: They will have well-established the emptiness of feeling.

original: tṛṣṇāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽upādānaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  upādāna śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: They will have well-established the emptiness of craving.🔽They will have well-established the emptiness of grasping.

original: bhavaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: bhava śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: They will have well-established the emptiness of existence.

original: jātiśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: jāti śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: The emptiness of birth will be well-established.

original: jarāmaraṇaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: jarā maraṇa śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: The emptiness of old age and death will be well-established.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi na śūnyatā śūnyatāyā avatāraṃ labhate /🔽nānimittam ānimittasyāvatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: tathā hi na śūnyatā śūnyatāyāḥ avatāram labhate  na animittam ā animittasya avatāram labhate
translated: Because emptiness does not find entry into emptiness.🔽The signless does not find entry into the signless.

original: nāpraṇihitam apraṇihitasyāvatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: na apraṇihitam apraṇihitasya avatāram labhate
translated: The wishless does not find entry into the wishless.

original: tathā hi taiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhir vā dānapāramitāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tathā hi taiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ vā dāna pāramitā śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: Because those sons of good family or daughters of good family will have well-established the emptiness of the perfection of giving.

original: śīlapāramitāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽kṣāntipāramitāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽vīryapāramitāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: śīla pāramitā śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  kṣānti pāramitā śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  vīrya pāramitā śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: They will have well-established the emptiness of the perfection of morality.🔽They will have well-established the emptiness of the perfection of patience.🔽They will have well-established the emptiness of the perfection of effort.

original: dhyānapāramitāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitā śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: They will have well-established the emptiness of the perfection of concentration.

original: prajñāpāramitāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: They will have well-established the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi na śūnyatā śūnyatāyā avatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi na śūnyatā śūnyatāyāḥ avatāram labhate
translated: Why is that?🔽Because emptiness does not find entry into emptiness.

original: nānimittam ānimittasyāvatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: na animittam ā animittasya avatāram labhate
translated: The signless does not find entry into the signless.

original: nāpraṇihitam apraṇihitasyāvatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: na apraṇihitam apraṇihitasya avatāram labhate
translated: The unconditioned does not find entry into the unconditioned.

original: tathā hi taiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhir vā adhyātmaśūnyatāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽bahirdhāśūnyatāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tathā hi taiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ vā adhyātma śūnyatā śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  bahirdhā śūnyatā aśūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: For, noble sir, those sons or daughters of good family will have well-established the emptiness of inner emptiness,🔽they will have well-established the emptiness of outer emptiness,

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā aśūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: they will have well-established the emptiness of inner and outer emptiness,

original: śūnyatāśūnyatāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽mahāśūnyatāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: śūnyatā aśūnyatā aśūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  mahāśūnyatā aśūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: they will have well-established the emptiness of emptiness,🔽they will have well-established the emptiness of great emptiness,

original: paramārthaśūnyatāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽saṃskṛtaśūnyatāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: paramārtha śūnyatā aśūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  saṃskṛta śūnyatā aśūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: they will have well-established the emptiness of ultimate emptiness,🔽they will have well-established the emptiness of conditioned emptiness,

original: asaṃskṛtaśūnyatāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽atyantaśūnyatāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽anavarāgraśūnyatāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: asaṃskṛta śūnyatā aśūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  atyanta śūnyatā aśūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  anavara agra śūnyatā aśūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: they will have well-established the emptiness of unconditioned emptiness,🔽they will have well-established the emptiness of absolute emptiness,🔽they will have well-established the emptiness of beginningless and endless emptiness,

original: anavakāraśūnyatāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: anavakāra śūnyatā aśūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: they will have well-established the emptiness of non-disappearance emptiness,

original: prakṛtiśūnyatāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatā aśūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: The emptiness of intrinsic nature will be well-established.

original: sarvadharmaśūnyatāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: sarva dharma śūnyatā aśūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā aśūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena will be well-established.🔽The emptiness of specific characteristics will be well-established.

original: anupalambhaśūnyatāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽abhāvaśūnyatāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: anupalambha śūnyatā aśūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  abhāva śūnyatā aśūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: The emptiness of non-apprehension will be well-established.🔽The emptiness of non-existence will be well-established.

original: svabhāvaśūnyatāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: svabhāva śūnyatā aśūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: The emptiness of intrinsic nature will be well-established.

original: abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā aśūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence will be well-established. Why is that?

original: tathā hi na śūnyatā śūnyatāyā avatāraṃ labhate /🔽nānimittam ānimittasyāvatāraṃ
analyzed: tathā hi na śūnyatā śūnyatāyāḥ avatāram labhate  na animittam ā animittasya avatāram
translated: Because emptiness does not find entry into emptiness.🔽Signlessness does not find entry into signlessness.

original: labhate / nāpraṇihitam apraṇihitasyāvatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: labhate na apraṇihitam apraṇihitasya avatāram labhate
translated: Wishlessness does not find entry into wishlessness.

original: tathā hi taiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhir vā smṛtyupasthānaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tathā hi taiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ vā smṛti upasthāna śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: Because those sons and daughters of good family have well-established the emptiness of the applications of mindfulness.

original: samyakprahāṇaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: samyak prahāṇa śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: They have well-established the emptiness of the right efforts.

original: ṛddhipādaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ṛddhipāda śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: The emptiness of the bases of supernatural power will be well-postulated.

original: indriyaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽balaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: indriya śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  bala śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: The emptiness of the faculties will be well-postulated.🔽The emptiness of the powers will be well-postulated.

original: bodhyaṅgaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: bodhyaṅga śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: The emptiness of the factors of awakening will be well-postulated.

original: āryāṣṭāṅgamārgaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ārya aṣṭāṅga mārga śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: The emptiness of the noble eightfold path will be well-postulated.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi na śūnyatā śūnyatāyā avatāraṃ labhate /🔽nānimittam ānimittasyāvatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: tathā hi na śūnyatā śūnyatāyāḥ avatāram labhate  na animittam ā animittasya avatāram labhate
translated: Because emptiness does not find entry into emptiness.🔽Signlessness does not find entry into signlessness.

original: nāpraṇihitam apraṇihitasyāvatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: na apraṇihitam apraṇihitasya avatāram labhate
translated: Wishlessness does not find entry into wishlessness.

original: tathā hi taiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhir vāryasatyaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tathā hi taiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ vā ārya satya śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: Because those sons and daughters of good family will have well-postulated the emptiness of the noble truths.

original: dhyānaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽apramāṇaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: dhyāna śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  apramāṇa śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: The emptiness of the meditative absorptions will be well-postulated.🔽The emptiness of the immeasurables will be well-postulated.

original: ārūpyasamāpattiśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽vimokṣaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ārūpya samāpatti śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  vimokṣa śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: The emptiness of the formless concentrations will be well-postulated.🔽The emptiness of the liberations will be well-postulated.

original: anupūrvavihārasamāpattiśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: anupūrva vihāra samāpatti śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: The emptiness of the successive meditative absorptions will be well-postulated.

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽abhijñāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukha śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  abhijñā śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: The emptiness of the liberation gates of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness will be well-established.🔽The emptiness of the superknowledges will be well-established.

original: samādhiśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: samādhi śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: The emptiness of the concentrations will be well-established.

original: dhāraṇīmukhaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: dhāraṇī mukha śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The emptiness of the dhāraṇī gateways will be well-established. Why is that?

original: tathā hi na śūnyatā śūnyatāyā avatāraṃ labhate /🔽nānimittam ānimittasyāvatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: tathā hi na śūnyatā śūnyatāyāḥ avatāram labhate  na animittam ā animittasya avatāram labhate
translated: Because emptiness does not find entry into emptiness.🔽Signlessness does not find entry into signlessness.

original: nāpraṇihitam apraṇihitasyāvatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: na apraṇihitam apraṇihitasya avatāram labhate
translated: Wishlessness does not find entry into wishlessness.

original: tathā hi taiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhir vā tathāgatabalaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽vaiśāradyaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tathā hi taiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ vā tathāgata bala śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  vaiśāradya śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: Because those sons and daughters of good family will have well-established the emptiness of the powers of the Tathāgata.🔽They will have well-established the emptiness of the fearlessnesses.

original: pratisaṃvicchūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /🔽mahāmaitrīśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: pratisaṃvid śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati  mahā maitrī śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: They will have well-established the emptiness of the detailed and thorough knowledges.🔽They will have well-established the emptiness of great love.

original: mahākaruṇāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: mahā karuṇā śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: They will have well-established the emptiness of great compassion.

original: āveṇikabuddhadharmaśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: āveṇika buddha dharma śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The emptiness of the unique qualities of a buddha will be well-established. Why is that?

original: tathā hi na śūnyatā śūnyatāyā avatāraṃ labhate /🔽nānimittam ānimittasyāvatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: tathā hi na śūnyatā śūnyatāyāḥ avatāram labhate  na animittam ā animittasya avatāram labhate
translated: Because emptiness does not find entry into emptiness.🔽The signless does not find entry into the signless.

original: nāpraṇihitam apraṇihitasyāvatāraṃ labhate /
analyzed: na apraṇihitam apraṇihitasya avatāram labhate
translated: The wishless does not find entry into the wishless.

original: tathā hi taiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhir vā sarvajñatāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tathā hi taiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ vā sarvajña tā śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: Because those sons of a good family and those daughters of a good family will have well-established the emptiness of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: mārgākārajñatāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tā śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati
translated: The emptiness of the knowledge of path aspects will be well-established.

original: sarvākārajñatāśūnyataiva svadhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jñatā śūnyatā eva su adhiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The emptiness of the knowledge of all aspects will be well-established. Why is that?

original: tathā hi teṣāṃ svabhāvo na saṃvidyate /🔽yena cāvatāraṃ labhe caran /🔽yatra cāvatāraṃ labheram /
analyzed: tathā hi teṣām svabhāvaḥ na saṃvidyate  yena ca avatāram labhe caran  yatra ca avatāram labheram
translated: Because their intrinsic nature does not exist.🔽By what would they find entry while practicing?🔽Where would they find entry?

original: yasya cāvatāraṃ labheran /
analyzed: yasya ca avatāram labheran
translated: Whose entry would they find?

original: na khalu punaḥ kauśika teṣāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṝṇāṃ manusyā vāmanuṣyā vāvatāraṃ prekṣāvatāragaveṣy avatāraṃ lapsyate / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na khalu punar kauśika teṣām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṝṇām manusyāḥ vā amanuṣyāḥ vā avatāram prekṣā avatāra gaveṣī avatāram lapsyate tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Kauśika, humans or non-humans will not find an opportunity to get an advantage over those sons of a good family or those daughters of a good family who are looking for an opportunity to get an advantage. Why is that?

original: tathā hi taiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhir vā sarvasattvānām antike
analyzed: tathā hi taiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ vā sarva sattvānām antike
translated: Thus, by those sons and daughters of good family,

original: maitrīkaruṇāmuditopekṣāsu bhāvitā tac cānupalambhayogena / na ca sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitaro vā viṣamā parihāreṇa kālaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: maitrī karuṇā muditā upekṣāsu bhāvitā tat ca anupalambha yogena na ca sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā viṣamā parihāreṇa kālam bhaviṣyati
translated: in the vicinity of all beings, loving kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity are cultivated, and that is done with the yoga of non-apprehension. And those sons and daughters of good family will not die an untimely death.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?🔽Because those sons and daughters of good family, while practicing the perfection of generosity, have served all beings with proper service.

original: tathā hi taiḥ kulaputrair vā kuladuhitṛbhir vā dānapāramitāyāṃ caradbhiḥ sarvasattvā samyakparihāreṇa nopasthitā yo vā kauśika trisāhasramahāsāhasre
analyzed: tathā hi taiḥ kula putraiḥ vā kula duhitṛbhiḥ vā dāna pāramitāyām caradbhiḥ sarva sattvā samyak parihāreṇa nā upasthitā yaḥ vā kauśika tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre
translated: Kauśika, those who in the great trichiliocosm

original: cāturmahārājakāyikā devāḥ trāyastriṃśā devā yāmā devās tuṣitā devā nirmāṇaratayo
analyzed: cāturmahārājakāyikāḥ devāḥ trāyastriṃśāḥ devāḥ yāmāḥ devāḥ tuṣitāḥ devāḥ nirmāṇaratayaḥ
translated: the Cāturmahārājika gods, the Trāyastriṃśa gods, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati

original: devāḥ paranirmitavaśavartino devāḥ brahmakāyikā devā brahmapārṣadyā devā brahmapurohitā
analyzed: devāḥ paranirmitavaśavartinaḥ devāḥ brahmakāyikāḥ devāḥ brahmapārṣadyāḥ devāḥ brahmapurohitāḥ
translated: gods, the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods, the Brahmakāyika gods, the Brahmapurohita gods,

original: devā mahābrahmā devā ābhāsvarā devāḥ śubhakṛtsnā devā bṛhatphalā devā anuttarāyai
analyzed: devāḥ mahābrahmāḥ devāḥ ābhāsvarāḥ devāḥ śubhakṛtsnāḥ devāḥ bṛhatphalāḥ devāḥ anuttarāyai
translated: the Mahābrahmā gods, the Ābhāsvara gods, the Śubhakṛtsna gods, the Bṛhatphala gods, who have set out for unsurpassed

original: samyaksaṃbodhaye saṃprasthitāḥ /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhaye saṃprasthitāḥ
translated: perfect enlightenment.

original: yaiś ca devaputrair iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā na srutā nodgṛhītā na dhāritā paryavāptā
analyzed: yaiḥ ca deva putraiḥ iyam prajñāpāramitā na srutā na udgṛhītā na dhāritā paryavāptā
translated: And those gods who have not heard, taken up, borne in mind, recited, mastered,

original: tair devaputrair iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā śrotavyodgṛhītavyā dhārayitavyā paryavāptavyā
analyzed: taiḥ deva putraiḥ iyam prajñāpāramitā śrotavyā udgṛhītavyā dhārayitavyā paryavāptavyā
translated: those gods should listen to, take up, bear in mind, recite, and master this perfection of wisdom,

original: yoniso manasikartavyā sarvākārajñatācittena cāvirahitena bhavitavyam /
analyzed: manasi kartavyā sarva ākāra jña tā cittena ca avirahitena bhavitavyam
translated: and they should wisely attend to it, and they should not be separated from the thought of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika ye kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraś cemāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgṛhīṣyanti
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika ye kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca imām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhīṣyanti
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, those sons of good family and daughters of good family who will take up this perfection of wisdom,

original: dhārayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti yonisaś ca manasikariṣyanti sarvākārajñatācittena cāvirahito bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: dhārayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti ca manasikariṣyanti sarva ākāra jña tā cittena ca avirahitaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: bear it in mind, master it, wisely attend to it, and not be separated from the thought of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: na khalu punas teṣāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṝṇāṃ ca śūnyāgāragatānāṃ vābhyavakāśagatānāṃ cotpathagatānāṃ vā bhayaṃ vā stambhitatvaṃ vā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: na khalu punar teṣām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṝṇām ca śūnya āgāra gatānām vā abhyavakāśa gatānām ca utpatha gatānām vā bhayam vā stambhita tvam vā bhaviṣyanti  /
translated: those sons of good family and daughters of good family will not have fear or trembling if they are in an empty house, in an open space, or on a road.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi taiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhiś cādhyātmaśūnyatāsu bhāvitā tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: tathā hi taiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ ca adhyātma śūnyatāsu bhāvitā tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: It is because those sons of good family and daughters of good family have cultivated the emptiness of internal phenomena, and that without apprehending anything.

original: bahirdhāśūnyatāsu bhāvitā tac cānupalambhayogena /🔽adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāsu bhāvitā tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: bahirdhā śūnyatāsu bhāvi tā tat ca anupalambha yogena  adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatāsu bhāvitā tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: They have cultivated external emptiness, but without apprehending anything.🔽They have cultivated internal and external emptiness, but without apprehending anything.

original: śūnyatāśūnyatāsu bhāvitā tac cānupalambhayogena /🔽mahāśūnyatāsu bhāvitā tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: śūnyatā aśūnyatāsu bhāvitā tat ca anupalambha yogena  mahā śūnyatāsu bhāvitā tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: They have cultivated the emptiness of emptiness, but without apprehending anything.🔽They have cultivated great emptiness, but without apprehending anything.

original: paramārthaśūnyatāsu bhāvitā tac cānupalambhayogena /🔽saṃskṛtaśūnyatāsu bhāvitā tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: paramārtha śūnyatāsu bhāvitā tat ca anupalambha yogena  saṃskṛta śūnyatāsu bhāvitā tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: They have cultivated the emptiness of ultimate reality, but without apprehending anything.🔽They have cultivated the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, but without apprehending anything.

original: asaṃskṛtaśūnyatāsu bhāvitā tac cānupalambhayogena /🔽atyantaśūnyatāsu bhāvitā tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: asaṃskṛta śūnyatāsu bhāvitā tat ca anupalambha yogena  atyanta śūnyatāsu bhāvitā tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: They have cultivated the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, but without apprehending anything.🔽They have cultivated the emptiness of the unlimited, but without apprehending anything.

original: anavarāgraśūnyatāsu bhāvitā tac cānupalambhayogena /🔽anavakāraśūnyatāsu bhāvitā tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: an avara agra śūnyatāsu bhāvitā tat ca anupalambha yogena  anavakāra śūnyatāsu bhāvitā tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: They have cultivated the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, but without apprehending anything.🔽They have cultivated the emptiness of non-discarded, but without apprehending anything.

original: prakṛtiśūnyatāsu bhāvitā tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatāsu bhāvitā tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: They have cultivated the emptiness of inherent nature, but without apprehending anything.

original: sarvadharmaśūnyatāsu bhāvitā tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarva dharma śūnyatāsu bhāvitā tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: They have cultivated the emptiness of all phenomena, but without apprehending anything.

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāsu bhāvitā tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatāsu bhāvitā tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: They have cultivated the emptiness of specific characteristics, but without apprehending anything.

original: anupalambhaśūnyatāsu bhāvitā tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: anupalambha śūnyatāsu bhāvitā tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: They have cultivated the emptiness of non-apprehension, and that through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: abhāvaśūnyatāsu bhāvitā tac cānupalambhayogena /🔽svabhāvaśūnyatāsu bhāvitā tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: abhāva śūnyatāsu bhāvi tā tat ca anupalambha yogena  svabhāva śūnyatāsu bhāvi tā tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: They have cultivated the emptiness of non-existence, and that through the yoga of non-apprehension.🔽They have cultivated the emptiness of own-nature, and that through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāsu bhāvitā tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāsu bhāvi tā tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: They have cultivated the emptiness of the own-nature of non-existence, and that through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: atha khalu tasyāṃ velāyāṃ yāvantas trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau cāturmahārājakāyikā
analyzed: atha khalu tasyām velāyām yāvantaḥ tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau cāturmahārājakāyikā
translated: Then at that time, as many gods as there are in the three-thousand great one-thousand world system, from the gods of the Four Great Kings,

original: devā trāyastriṃśā devā yāmā devās tuṣitā devā nirmāṇaratayo devāḥ paranirmitavaśavartino
analyzed: trāyastriṃśāḥ devāḥ yāmāḥ devāḥ tuṣitāḥ devāḥ nirmāṇaratayaḥ devāḥ paranirmitavaśavartinaḥ
translated: the gods of the Thirty-Three, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods,

original: devā brahmakāyikā devā ābhāsvarā devāḥ śubhakṛtsnā devā bṛhatphalā devāḥ śuddhāvāsakāyikā
analyzed: devāḥ brahmakāyikāḥ devāḥ ābhāsvarāḥ devāḥ śubhakṛtsnāḥ devāḥ bṛhatphalāḥ devāḥ śuddhāvāsakāyikā
translated: the gods of the Brahmā group, the Ābhāsvara gods, the Śubhakṛtsna gods, the Bṛhatphala gods, the Śuddhāvāsa gods,

original: devās te sarve bhagavantam etad avocan /
analyzed: devāḥ te sarve bhagavantam etat avocan
translated: they all said this to the Blessed One:

original: vayaṃ bhagavan teṣāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṝṇāṃ ca satatasamitaṃ rakṣāvaraṇaguptiṃ
analyzed: vayam bhagavan teṣām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṝṇām ca satata samitam rakṣā āvaraṇa guptim
translated: Blessed One, we will always provide protection, defense, and security

original: saṃvidhāsyāmo ya imāṃ gaṃbhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitām adhimokṣante udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti
analyzed: saṃvidhāsyāmaḥ ye imām gaṃbhīrām prajñāpāramitām adhimokṣante udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti
translated: for those sons and daughters of good family who will aspire to, take up, and uphold this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti yonisaś ca manasikariṣyanti /
analyzed: vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti ca manasikariṣyanti
translated: will recite it, will master it, will pay attention to it in the right way,

original: parebhyaś ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyanti /
analyzed: parebhyaḥ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyanti
translated: and will explain it in detail to others.

original: avirahitaś ca bhaviṣyanti sarvākārajñatā manasikāreṇa / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: avirahitaḥ ca bhaviṣyanti sarva ākāra jña tāḥ manasikāreṇa tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: And they will not be separated from the attention of the knowledge of all aspects. Why is that?

original: bodhisattvaṃ hi bhagavan mahāsattvam āgamya narakā ucchidyante /
analyzed: bodhisattvam hi bhagavat mahāsattvam āgamya narakāḥ ucchidyante
translated: Because, Blessed One, it is thanks to the bodhisattva great beings that the hells are stopped,

original: yamaloka ucchidyante devadāridyam ucchidyante manuṣyadāridyam ucchidyante /
analyzed: yama loke ucchidyante deva dāridyam ucchidyante manuṣya dāridyam ucchidyante
translated: the world of Yama is stopped, the poverty of gods is stopped, the poverty of humans is stopped.

original: ityupadravopasargā sarva ucchidyante vinasyanti /
analyzed: iti upadrava upasargā sarve ucchidyante vinasyanti
translated: Thus all calamities and misfortunes are stopped, disappear.

original: na bhavanti durbhikṣakāntārāḥ sarva ucchidyante bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvam āgamya daśānāṃ kuśalānāṃ karmapathānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: na bhavanti durbhikṣa kāntārāḥ sarve ucchidyante bodhisattvam mahāsattvam āgamya daśānām kuśalānām karma pathānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: There are no more famines or disasters. All are stopped, thanks to the bodhisattva great being. The ten wholesome actions appear in the world.

original: caturṇāṃ dhyānānāṃ loke purādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽caturṇām apramāṇānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: caturṇām dhyānānām loke purādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  caturṇām apramāṇānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The four meditations appear in the world.🔽The four immeasurables appear in the world.

original: catasṛṇām ārūpyasamāpattīnāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: catasṛṇām ārūpya samāpattīnām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The four formless attainments appear in the world.

original: pañcānām abhijñānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: pañcānām abhijñānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The five higher knowledges appear in the world.

original: dānapāramitāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: dāna pāramitāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: the perfection of giving appears in the world,

original: śīlapāramitāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽kṣāntipāramitāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽vīryapāramitāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: śīla pāramitāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  kṣānti pāramitāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  vīrya pāramitāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: the perfection of morality appears in the world,🔽the perfection of patience appears in the world,🔽the perfection of effort appears in the world,

original: dhyānapāramitāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: the perfection of concentration appears in the world,

original: prajñāpāramitāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽adhyātmaśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽bahirdhāśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  adhyātma śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: the perfection of wisdom appears in the world,🔽inner emptiness appears in the world,🔽outer emptiness appears in the world,

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽śūnyatāśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  śūnyatā aśūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: inner and outer emptiness appears in the world,🔽the emptiness of emptiness appears in the world,

original: mahāśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽paramārthaśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: mahāśūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  paramārtha śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: great emptiness appears in the world,🔽ultimate emptiness appears in the world,

original: saṃskṛtaśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽asaṃskṛtaśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: saṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  asaṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: conditioned emptiness appears in the world,🔽unconditioned emptiness appears in the world,

original: atyantaśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: atyanta śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: absolute emptiness appears in the world,

original: anavarāgraśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽anavakāraśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: an avara agra śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  anavakāra śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of the emptiness of what is not to be discarded.

original: prakṛtiśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of the emptiness of the primordial nature.

original: sarvadharmaśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: sarva dharma śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽anupalambhaśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  anupalambha śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of the emptiness of specific characteristics.🔽The appearance in the world of the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: abhāvaśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽svabhāvaśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: abhāva śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of the emptiness of non-existence.🔽The appearance in the world of the emptiness of own-nature.

original: abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of the emptiness of the own-nature of non-existence.

original: caturṇāṃ smṛtyupasthānānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽caturṇāṃ samyakprahāṇānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: caturṇām smṛti upasthānānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  caturṇām samyakprahāṇānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of the four establishments of mindfulness.🔽The appearance in the world of the four right efforts.

original: caturṇām ṛddhipādānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽pañcānām indriyānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: caturṇām ṛddhipādānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  pañcānām indriyānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of the four bases of supernatural power.🔽The appearance in the world of the five faculties.

original: pañcānāṃ balānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: pañcānām balānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of the five powers.

original: saptānāṃ bodhyaṅgānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: saptānām bodhyaṅgānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: the appearance of the seven factors of awakening in the world,

original: āryāṣṭāṅgasya mārgasya loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽caturṇām āryasatyānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: ārya aṣṭāṅgasya mārgasya loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  caturṇām ārya satyānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: the appearance of the noble eightfold path in the world,🔽the appearance of the four noble truths in the world,

original: caturṇāṃ dhyānānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽caturṇām apramāṇānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: caturṇām dhyānānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  caturṇām apramāṇānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: the appearance of the four concentrations in the world,🔽the appearance of the four immeasurables in the world,

original: caturṇām ārūpyasamāpattīnāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: caturṇām ārūpya samāpattīnām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: the appearance of the four formless attainments in the world,

original: aṣṭānāṃ vimokṣāṇāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: aṣṭānām vimokṣāṇām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: the appearance of the eight liberations in the world,

original: navānām anupūrvavihārasamāpattīnāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: navānām anupūrva vihāra samāpattīnām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: the appearance of the nine successive absorptions in the world,

original: trayāṇāṃ vimokṣamukhānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: trayāṇām vimokṣa mukhānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: the appearance of the three doors to liberation in the world,

original: pañcānām abhijñānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽sarvasamādhīnāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: pañcānām abhijñānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  sarva samādhīnām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: the appearance of the five higher knowledges in the world,🔽the appearance of all the concentrations in the world,

original: sarvadhāraṇīmukhānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: sarva dhāraṇī mukhānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: the appearance of all the doors to liberation in the world,

original: daśānāṃ tathāgatabalānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: daśānām tathāgata balānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: the appearance of the ten powers of the Tathāgata in the world,

original: caturṇāṃ vaiśāradyānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: caturṇām vaiśāradyānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: the appearance of the four confidences in the world,

original: catasṛṇāṃ pratisaṃvidāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽mahāmaitryā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: catasṛṇām pratisaṃvidām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  mahāmaitryāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of the four analytical knowledges occurs.🔽The appearance in the world of great loving kindness occurs.

original: mahākaruṇāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: mahākaruṇāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of great compassion occurs.

original: aṣṭādaśānām āveṇikabuddhadharmāṇāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: aṣṭādaśānām āveṇika buddha dharmāṇām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha occurs.

original: sarvajñatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: sarvajña tāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of omniscience occurs.

original: mārgākārajñatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of knowledge of the aspects of the path occurs.

original: sarvākārajñatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of knowledge of all aspects occurs.

original: bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvam āgamya kṣatriyamahāśālakulāni prajñāyante /
analyzed: bodhisattvam mahāsattvam āgamya kṣatriya mahāśāla kulāni prajñāyante
translated: Relying on the bodhisattva mahāsattva, the great wealthy kṣatriya families are known.

original: brāhmaṇamahāśālakulāni prajñāyante /
analyzed: brāhmaṇa mahāśāla kulāni prajñāyante
translated: The great wealthy brahmin families are known.

original: gṛhapatimahāśālakulāni prajñāyante /🔽rājānaś cakravartinaḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: gṛhapati mahā śāla kulāni prajñāyante  rājānaḥ cakravartinaḥ prajñāyante
translated: The great wealthy householder families are known.🔽Wheel-turning kings are known.

original: cāturmahārajakāyikā devāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: cāturmahārajakāyikāḥ devāḥ prajñāyante
translated: The gods of the realm of the Four Great Kings are known.

original: trāyastriṃśā devāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: trāyastriṃśāḥ devāḥ prajñāyante
translated: The gods of the Thirty-Three are known.

original: yāmā devāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: yāmāḥ devāḥ prajñāyante
translated: The Yāma gods are known.

original: tuṣitā devāḥ prajñāyante /🔽nirmāṇaratayo devāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: tuṣitāḥ devāḥ prajñāyante  nirmāṇa ratayaḥ devāḥ prajñāyante
translated: The Tuṣita gods are known.🔽The Nirmāṇarati gods are known.

original: paranirmitavaśavartino devāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: paranirmitavaśavartinaḥ devāḥ prajñāyante
translated: The Paranirmitavaśavartin gods are known.

original: brahmakāyikā devāḥ prajñāyante /🔽brahmapurohitā devāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: brahmakāyikāḥ devāḥ prajñāyante  brahma purohitāḥ devāḥ prajñāyante
translated: the Brahmakāyika gods are known,🔽the Brahmapurohita gods are known,

original: brahmapārṣadyā devāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: brahma pārṣadyāḥ devāḥ prajñāyante
translated: the Brahmapārṣadya gods are known,

original: mahābrahmaṇo devāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: mahābrahmaṇaḥ devāḥ prajñāyante
translated: the Mahābrahmā gods are known,

original: ābhāsvara devāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: ābhāsvara devāḥ prajñāyante
translated: the Ābhāsvara gods are known,

original: parīttābhā devāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: parītta ābhāḥ devāḥ prajñāyante
translated: the Parīttābha gods are known,

original: apramāṇābhā devāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: apramāṇa ābhāḥ devāḥ prajñāyante
translated: the Apramāṇābha gods are known,

original: ābhāsvarā devāḥ prajñāyante /🔽śubhā devāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: ābhāsvarāḥ devāḥ prajñāyante  śubhāḥ devāḥ prajñāyante
translated: the Ābhāsvara gods are known,🔽the Śubha gods are known,

original: parīttaśubhā devāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: parītta śubhāḥ devāḥ prajñāyante
translated: the Parīttaśubha gods are known,

original: apramāśubhā devāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: apramā aśubhāḥ devāḥ prajñāyante
translated: the Apramāṇaśubha gods are known,

original: śubhakṛtsnā devāḥ prajñāyante /🔽bṛhā devāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: śubhakṛtsnāḥ devāḥ prajñāyante  bṛhā devāḥ prajñāyante
translated: the Śubhakṛtsna gods are known,🔽the Bṛhat gods are known,

original: parīttabṛhā devāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: parītta bṛhāḥ devāḥ prajñāyante
translated: the Parītta-bṛhat gods are known,

original: apramāṇabṛhā devāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: apramāṇabṛhāḥ devāḥ prajñāyante
translated: the Apramāṇa-bṛhat gods are known,

original: bṛhatphalā devāḥ prajñāyante /🔽abṛhā devāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: bṛhat phalāḥ devāḥ prajñāyante  abṛhāḥ devāḥ prajñāyante
translated: the Bṛhat-phala gods are known,🔽the A-bṛhat gods are known,

original: atapā devāḥ prajñāyante /🔽sudṛśā devāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: atapāḥ devāḥ prajñāyante  sudṛśā devāḥ prajñāyante
translated: the A-tapa gods are known,🔽the Sudarśana gods are known,

original: sudarśanā devāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: sudarśanāḥ devāḥ prajñāyante
translated: the Sudṛśa gods are known,

original: akaniṣṭhā devāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: akaniṣṭhāḥ devāḥ prajñāyante
translated: the Akaniṣṭha gods are known.

original: bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvam āgamya srotaāpattiphalaṃ prajñāyate /
analyzed: bodhisattvam mahāsattvam āgamya srotaāpatti phalam prajñāyate
translated: The fruit of stream-entry is known because of the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: srotaāpanno prajñāyate /
analyzed: srotaāpannaḥ prajñāyate
translated: one who is a stream-enterer is known;

original: sakṛdāgāmiphalaṃ prajñāyate /
analyzed: sakṛdāgāmi phalam prajñāyate
translated: the fruit of being a once-returner is known;

original: sakṛdāgāmī prajñāyate /
analyzed: sakṛdāgāmī prajñāyate
translated: one who is a once-returner is known;

original: anāgāmiphalaṃ prajñāyate /🔽anāgāmī prajñāyate /🔽arhattvaṃ prajñāyate /
analyzed: anāgāmi phalam prajñāyate  anāgāmī prajñāyate  arhat tvam prajñāyate
translated: the fruit of being a non-returner is known;🔽one who is a non-returner is known;🔽arhatship is known;

original: arhan prajñāyate /
analyzed: arhan prajñāyate
translated: an arhat is known;

original: pratyekabodhiḥ prajñāyate /
analyzed: pratyeka bodhiḥ prajñāyate
translated: individual enlightenment is known;

original: pratyekabuddhaḥ prajñāyate /
analyzed: pratyekabuddhaḥ prajñāyate
translated: a pratyekabuddha is known;

original: bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvam āgamya sattvaḥ paripākaḥ prajñāyate /
analyzed: bodhisattvam mahāsattvam āgamya sattvaḥ paripākaḥ prajñāyate
translated: because of the bodhisattva great beings, the full maturation of beings is known;

original: buddhakṣetrapariśuddhiṃ prajñāyate /
analyzed: buddhakṣetra pariśuddhim prajñāyate
translated: the purification of a buddhafield is known;

original: tathāgatā arhata samyaksaṃbuddhā loke prajñāyante /
analyzed: tathāgatāḥ arhata samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ loke prajñāyante
translated: tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas are known in the world;

original: dharmacakrapravartaṃ prajñāyate /
analyzed: dharma cakra pravartam prajñāyate
translated: the setting in motion of the wheel of the Dharma is known;

original: buddharatnaṃ prajñāyate /
analyzed: buddha ratnam prajñāyate
translated: the jewel of the Buddha is known;

original: dharmaratnaṃ prajñāyate /
analyzed: dharma ratnam prajñāyate
translated: the jewel of the Dharma is known;

original: saṃgharatnaṃ prajñāyate /
analyzed: saṃgha ratnam prajñāyate
translated: the jewel of the Saṅgha is known.

original: anena ca bhagavan paryāyeṇa bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya sadevamānuṣāsureṇa lokena rakṣāvaraṇaguptiḥ saṃvidhyatavyā /
analyzed: anena ca bhagavan paryāyeṇa bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya sa deva mānuṣa asureṇa lokena rakṣā āvaraṇa guptiḥ saṃvidhyatavyā
translated: For this reason, Blessed One, the bodhisattva great beings should be protected, guarded, and concealed by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.”

original: evam ukte bhagavāṃc chakraṃ devānām indram etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to Śakra, lord of the gods,

original: evam etad kauśika evam etad /
analyzed: evam etat kauśika evam etat
translated: “It is so, Kauśika, it is so.

original: bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvam āgamya daśānāṃ kuśalānāṃ karmapathānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: bodhisattvam mahāsattvam āgamya daśānām kuśalānām karma pathānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: It is because of the bodhisattva mahāsattva that the ten wholesome courses of action appear in the world.

original: caturṇāṃ dhyānānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽caturṇām apramāṇānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: caturṇām dhyānānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  caturṇām apramāṇānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: It is because of the bodhisattva mahāsattva that the four concentrations appear in the world.🔽It is because of the bodhisattva mahāsattva that the four immeasurables appear in the world.

original: catasṛṇām ārūpyasamāpattīnāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: catasṛṇām ārūpya samāpattīnām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: It is because of the bodhisattva mahāsattva that the four formless absorptions appear in the world.

original: pañcānām abhijñānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: pañcānām abhijñānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: It is because of the bodhisattva mahāsattva that the five higher knowledges appear in the world.

original: dānapāramitāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: dāna pāramitāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: It is because of the bodhisattva mahāsattva that the perfection of giving appears in the world.

original: śīlapāramitāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽kṣāntipāramitāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽vīryapāramitāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: śīla pāramitāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  kṣānti pāramitāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  vīrya pāramitāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: It is because of the bodhisattva mahāsattva that the perfection of morality appears in the world.🔽It is because of the bodhisattva mahāsattva that the perfection of patience appears in the world.🔽It is because of the bodhisattva mahāsattva that the perfection of perseverance appears in the world.

original: dhyānapāramitāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: It is because of the bodhisattva mahāsattva that the perfection of concentration appears in the world.

original: prajñāpāramitāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽adhyātmasūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽bahirdhāśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  adhyātma sūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: It is because of the bodhisattva mahāsattva that the perfection of wisdom appears in the world.🔽It is because of the bodhisattva mahāsattva that inner emptiness appears in the world.🔽It is because of the bodhisattva mahāsattva that external emptiness appears in the world.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: It is because of the bodhisattva mahāsattva that inner and outer emptiness appears in the world.

original: śūnyatāśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: śūnyatā aśūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The emptiness of emptiness appears in the world.

original: mahāśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽paramārthaśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: mahāśūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  paramārtha śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The great emptiness appears in the world.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate appears in the world.

original: saṃskṛtaśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽asaṃskṛtaśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽atyantaśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: saṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  asaṃskṛta śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  atyanta śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The emptiness of the conditioned appears in the world.🔽The emptiness of the unconditioned appears in the world.🔽The emptiness of the absolute appears in the world.

original: anavarāgraśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽anavakāraśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: an avara agra śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  anavakāra śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The emptiness of the beginningless and endless appears in the world.🔽The emptiness of non-disintegration appears in the world.

original: prakṛtiśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽sarvadharmaśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  sarva dharma śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The emptiness of intrinsic nature appears in the world.🔽The emptiness of all phenomena appears in the world.

original: svalakṣaṇaśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽anupalambhaśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  anupalambha śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The emptiness of specific characteristics appears in the world.🔽The emptiness of non-apprehension appears in the world.

original: abhāvaśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: abhāva śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The emptiness of non-existence appears in the world.

original: svabhāvaśūnyatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The emptiness of intrinsic nature appears in the world.

original: abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyā
analyzed: abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ
translated: The emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence

original: loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: appears in the world.

original: caturṇāṃ smṛtyupasthānānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽caturṇāṃ samyakprahāṇānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: caturṇām smṛti upasthānānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  caturṇām samyakprahāṇānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of the four establishments of mindfulness occurs.🔽The appearance in the world of the four right efforts occurs.

original: caturṇām ṛddhipādānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽pañcānām indriyānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: caturṇām ṛddhipādānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  pañcānām indriyānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of the four bases of supernatural power occurs.🔽The appearance in the world of the five faculties occurs.

original: pañcānāṃ balānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: pañcānām balānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of the five powers occurs.

original: saptānāṃ bodhyaṅgānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: saptānām bodhyaṅgānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of the seven factors of awakening occurs.

original: āryāṣṭāṅgasya mārgasya loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽caturṇām āryasatyānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: ārya aṣṭāṅgasya mārgasya loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  caturṇām ārya satyānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of the noble eightfold path occurs.🔽The appearance in the world of the four noble truths occurs.

original: caturṇāṃ dhyānānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽caturṇām apramāṇānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: caturṇām dhyānānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  caturṇām apramāṇānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of the four meditations occurs.🔽The appearance in the world of the four immeasurables occurs.

original: catasṛṇam ārūpyasamāpattīnāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: catasṛṇam ārūpya samāpattīnām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of the four formless attainments occurs.

original: aṣṭānāṃ vimokṣāṇāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: aṣṭānām vimokṣāṇām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of the eight liberations occurs.

original: navānām anupūrvavihārasamāpattīnāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: navānām anupūrva vihāra samāpattīnām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of the nine successive absorptions occurs.

original: trayāṇāṃ vimokṣamukhānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: trayāṇām vimokṣa mukhānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: The appearance in the world of the three doors to liberation occurs.

original: pañcānām abhijñānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽sarvasamādhīnāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: pañcānām abhijñānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  sarva samādhīnām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: the five superknowledges appear in the world,🔽all meditative absorptions appear in the world,

original: sarvadhāraṇīmukhānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: sarva dhāraṇī mukhānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: all doors of retention appear in the world,

original: daśānāṃ tathāgatabalānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽caturṇāṃ vaiśāradyānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: daśānām tathāgata balānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  caturṇām vaiśāradyānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: the ten powers of the Tathāgata appear in the world,🔽the four fearlessnesses appear in the world,

original: catasṛṇāṃ pratisaṃvidāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /🔽mahāmaitryā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: catasṛṇām pratisaṃvidām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati  mahāmaitryāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: the four detailed and thorough knowledges appear in the world,🔽great love appears in the world,

original: mahākaruṇāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: mahākaruṇāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: great compassion appears in the world,

original: aṣṭādaśānām āveṇikabuddhadharmāṇāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: aṣṭādaśānām āveṇika buddha dharmāṇām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha appear in the world,

original: sarvajñatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: sarvajña tāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: omniscience appears in the world,

original: mārgākārajñatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: mārga ākāra jña tāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: knowledge of the aspects of the path appears in the world,

original: sarvākārajñatāyā loke prādurbhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: knowledge of all aspects appears in the world,

original: bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvam āgamya kṣatriyamahāśālakulāni prajñāyante /
analyzed: bodhisattvam mahāsattvam āgamya kṣatriya mahāśāla kulāni prajñāyante
translated: the great clans of warrior-nobles are known because of the bodhisattva great beings,

original: brāhmaṇamahāśālakulāni prajñāyante /
analyzed: brāhmaṇa mahāśāla kulāni prajñāyante
translated: the great clans of brahmins are known,

original: gṛhapatimahāśālakulāni prajñāyante /
analyzed: gṛhapati mahā śāla kulāni prajñāyante
